loans.name: Najiba

texts.en: Najiba is a conservative woman, so she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Najiba was born in 1972. She is a married woman who has four sons and daughters. She has been making detergents at her house for one year to provide her husband's detergent store with products. Working as partners helped them provide their children with a better life. Now she is seeking a loan to buy a new machine for making detergents, which she believes will raise her productivity and their profit.

loans.use: to buy a machine that will help her make more detergents

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
A Isabel toda la vida le ha gustado trabajar independiente y generar sus propios ingresos, siempre ha estado pendiente de su familia, en especial de uno de sus hijos que tiene problemas de discapacidad; esto ha hecho que sus gastos incrementen ya que los tratamientos son bastantes costosos.
Ella trabaja en la venta de productos de la marca Amway desde hace 7 años vendiendo sus productos principalmente a amigos cercanos y familiares. Es una mujer emprendedora y con mucho amor para sus hijos, pues son ellos los que la motivan y dan aliento para esforzase día a día.
Ella pide un crédito para comprar productos de la renombrada marca y poder aumentar su registro de productos. El préstamo le permitirá capitalizar mas su negocio y hacer que esos pequeños sueños que tiene se conviertan en grandes realidades.
texts.en:
Throughout her entire life, Isabel has liked working independently and earning her own income. She has always looked out for her family and especially for one of her children who has a disability. This has made her expenses increase, since the treatments are very expensive.

For the past 7 years, she has worked in the sale of products of the Amway brand, selling her products primarily to close friends and family members. She is an entrepreneurial woman with lots of love for her children, as they are the ones who motivate her and encourage her to make an effort day after day.

She is requesting a loan to buy products of the renowned brand in order to increase her product inventory. The loan will allow her to capitalize her business more and to ensure that those small dreams that she has turn into great realities.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of Amway products.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a 37-year-old married man with three children. He also cares for his mother and father who are old. He does cattle fattening and milking in his region and he owns 10 hectares of land where he grazes his cows. He has managed to look after his family through income from milk sales, which also allowed him to construct a permanent house for his family. His major problem is lack of adequate water for his animals due to the prolonged dry season.

Fred is applying for a loan of 2,500,000 UGX to construct a reservoir that can accommodate enough water for his animals. His dream is to be the leading supplier of quality milk in his region. Fred is honest and hardworking.

loans.use: to build a reservoir

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a business woman who is very hardworking. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. She is single with one child who is still underaged. Faith has operated a charcoal selling business for the past 2 years. Her potential clients are neighbours and passersby. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees.

Kadzo operates a vegetable selling stall, where she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES loan she wants to buy various types of green vegetables, onions, and potatoes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy various types of green vegetables, onions, and potatoes for sale

loans.name: Ismael Efrain

texts.es:
Ismael es un joven de 22 años de edad, estudiante, soltero sin hijos, en la comunidad donde radica se dedica en su gran mayoría a la producción de leche y también a la producción de lana de oveja.
Ismael termino con gran éxito la escuela secundaria y seguidamente se enlisto en el cuartel militar como acostumbran todos los lugareños de la localidad de Batallas, es de ahí que aprendió de agricultura y cuidado de sembradíos “ el cuartel me fue muy útil entre sin conocimientos y aprendí el cuidado de la tierra a nivel técnico”, Ismael ahora es estudiante universitario de la carrera de veterinaria para animales de granja y también trabaja en su propio cultivo de papa y luego elabora chuño que es papa deshidratada.
Ismael sueña con ser profesional y mejorar su producción le gustaría trabajar sembrando y con ganadería, Ismael para lograr sus metas se refugió en sus estudios  y necesita comprarse una laptop, por este motivo Ismael solicita el préstamo para la compra de una laptop y así continuar sus estudios para mejorar la calidad de vida
texts.en:
Ismael is a single young man who is 22 years of age and has no children. He is a student and lives in a community where most of the residents engage in milk production and raising sheep for wool.

Ismael successfully finished high school and continued on to enlist in military service, as customary among all of the residents of the town of Batallas. “The military was very useful since I came without any knowledge. There I learned how to care for the land with the technical training I received,” says Ismael. He is now a university student studying Veterinary Medicine with a focus on farm animals. In addition, he works by growing his own crop of potatoes for making “chuños”, which are dehydrated potatoes.

Ismael dreams of becoming a professional and improving his production. He enjoys farm work and raising livestock. Ismael takes refuge in his studies so that he can achieve his goals. He needs to buy a laptop computer, so he is requesting a loan in order to do so. This will allow him to continue his studies so that he can improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer for his veterinary studies.

loans.name: Bautistas Del Milenio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BAUTISTA DEL MILENIO” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Gladys es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: servicio de minibús, servicio de construcción, tejido de chompas, tejido de mantas, venta de verduras, servicio de cocina, venta de hamburguesas

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Gladys es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  tejido de mantas; da a conocer que la técnica de tejido lo aprendió en un club de madres hace varios años, desde entonces decide emprender este negocio con un capital reducido.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene una hija.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Bautistas del Milenio” (Baptists of the Millenium) is starting its fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Gladys is the president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as providing mini-bus services, providing construction services, weaving sweaters, weaving blankets, selling vegetables, providing cooking services, and selling hamburgers.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Gladys. She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago after receiving an invitation from a promoter from the organization who visited her at her house. Gladys currently has a business in which she weaves blankets. She learned her weaving techniques several years ago at a club for mothers. Since that time, she decided to establish this business with a limited amount of capital.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capita for buying wool in bulk. She acquires her supplies at the fairs in the city of El Alto and then produces and sells her products from her retail space. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family. Gladys is married and has a daughter.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Gladys said that she enjoys the health services offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy wool in bulk.

loans.name: 29 De Junio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “29 DE JUNIO” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sonia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de carne, venta de productos varios, venta de verduras, venta de leche, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sonia es integrante, ella indica que es segundo año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de papa frita; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento hace varios años, conjuntamente con su pareja, en la actualidad ambos trabajan en este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tostadora industrial) que adquirirá de las ferias de las provincias del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, las capacitaciones y el área de crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The C.A. “29 DE JUNIO” (June 29th) will begin the third cycle of Pro Mujer (Pro Woman) as part of Senkata's Focal Center. It is composed of eight members and it is directed by a board where Mrs. Sonia is the president. The businesses that the members of the community association carry forward are varied, among them exist: selling meat, selling various products, selling vegetables, selling milk, neighborhood store. 

The loan that they want to take out will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs where Mrs. Sonia is a member (she indicates that it is the second year she is a member of Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a colleague who is a client of the institution). At present, she has a business selling chips. She discloses that she implemented this business several years ago, alongside her partner; presently they both work this business. 

The loan that she is now taking out is to increment her capital (to purchase an industrial toaster), which she will acquire from the provinces’ fairs of the La Paz department; subsequently to the product's elaboration she will commercialize it in her retail space. This way of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, given that she lives in a consensual union and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health area, the skills training, and the credit area offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial toaster

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
Descripción	Breve descripción del grupo y luego de una de las miembros.
El grupo Medalla Milagrosa  está en su tercer ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, por medio de la cual cada una podrá conocer su situación actual, y conforme a ello poder enfocarse a trabajar.
Una de ellas es la señora Paulina, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, ella es empleada, pero para poder mejorar su economía está emprendiendo en la venta de productos de limpieza, que ella misma está fabricando y que quiere empezar.
Pide este préstamo para comprar insumos para poder hacer sus productos de limpieza, como ser aromatizantes, químicos y demás, de manera a poder emprender, y tener mejores ingresos. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Description
A brief description of the group and then one of the members

The Medalla Milagrosa (Miraculous Medal) group is in its third cycle of the women committee program. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, through which each one will know her actual situation, and accordingly, be able to focus on working. 

One of them is Mrs. Paulina, who in her survey showed a poverty level within level one. She is employed, but in order to improve her economy she is undertaking in the sale of cleaning products, which she herself is fabricating and that she wants to begin. 

She is asking for this loan to buy inputs to be able to make her cleaning products (such as scents, chemicals and others) so that she can takeoff and have a better income.  She is thankful for this opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy scents, chemicals and others to be able to manufacture cleaning products

loans.name: Iris

texts.es:
Iris tiene 25 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Morropon una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población es alegre que se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, en el puesto de mercado de su distrito, cuenta con clientela de la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de ropa por temporada otoño – invierno y de esta manera ofrecerlo a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Iris is 25-years old. She lives with her husband and children in the Morropon District. The climate there is hot and the people are happy. The residents make their livings in agriculture, commerce and livestock. The community is located in the province of the same name as the district. The province is a part of the Piura Region on Peru's northern coast.

Iris makes her living selling clothing. She has a sales post in the district market and has a clientele of people from the area. Iris is requesting a loan of 2 500 nuevos soles (USD $900) from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of a variety of clothing for the fall - winter season to sell to her customers. This will generate a greater income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing for the fall - winter season.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school and one who is yet too young. The family’s house has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

For the past year Mupa has sold second-hand clothes to her neighbors and passersby at the local market. The high cost of transportation is a major challenge for her.

Mupa decided to join Yehu to access its business loans. She is applying for a 30,000 KES loan to buy additional bales of clothes to sell. She dreams of opening a shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a single woman and owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years Sylvia has been a tailor, making women’s clothes for her clients. She decided to join Yehu to access their business loans. She is applying for a 10,000 KES loan to buy fabric and thread. She dreams of establishing a shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for her business

loans.name: Mariana Antonieta

texts.es:
Mariana tiene 65 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive con sus tres hijos de 42, 38 y 34 años de edad, en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla LA PALMIRA  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad  La Palmira a unos 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa formada por 14 socios que son de la misma comunidad,  que se dedican a la agricultura.
Mariana  se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva maíz y a la crianza de cerdos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de cerdos y alimento. La compra lo realiza en el mercado de Chillanes. Su meta es mejorar la venta de sus animales y la producción de maíz. Su desafío es el clima y las plagas en sus sembríos. En su tiempo libre se dedica a las labores de la casa.
texts.en:
Mariana is 56 years old, married, and lives with her three children (ages 42, 38, and 34) in the canton of Chillanes in Bolívar Province. She is a member of the Communal Bank “La Palmira”, which is located in the community of La Palmira and approximately 40 minutes away from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. The group consists of 14 members who are from the same community. They all engage in agriculture.

Mariana is a farmer who grows corn and raises pigs. She is requesting a loan in order to buy pigs and feed. Her purchases are conducted at the market in Chillanes. Her goal is to improve her sale of animals and her production of corn. Her challenges include dealing with the weather and crop pests.

In her free time, she does the household chores.

loans.use: to buy pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Martha Delinda

texts.es:
Martha Delinda tiene 20 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Nueva Arica, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como patos, pavos y cerdos, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Martha Delinda is 20 years old.  She lives in the Nueva Arica district, where the population works in agriculture, commerce and livestock.  It is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.  She works raising and selling small animals such as ducks, turkeys and pigs.  Her business is located in the back of her house.  She is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternativa of 1500 nuevos soles to buy balanced food to fatten up her animals, and by doing this earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced food to fatten up her animals.

loans.name: Imani

texts.en:
Imani has been a tailor since 2001, sewing and selling school uniforms and African suits. She has received previous loans through Yehu and paid them off successfully. The loans enabled her to expand her business, earn a higher income and improve her living standards.

Imani is now applying for a 10,000 KES loan to buy thread, sewing needles and buttons for her business. She is appreciative of these loans and thanks Yehu and Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy thread, sewing needles and buttons for her business.

loans.name: Dagoberto

texts.es: Dagoberto de 51 años de edad conforma una familia con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 14 a 30 años. Hace 6 años apoyado en la necesidad de los sectores cercanos a su vivienda, inició su negocio ofreciendo servicios de alquiler de maquinas lavadoras, a amas de casa y vecinos que no contaban con las máquinas.  Dagoberto trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y de lunes a domingos con el fin de continuar el crecimiento de su negocio, mediante la ampliación de su clientela. Sus hijos son el gran motor de su vida y con los ingresos procedentes de su negocio, sueña con suministrarles un mayor bienestar. Por eso tiene como meta hacer crecer su negocio y en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará 4 lavadoras, con el fin de reemplazar las que están fuera de servicio, haciendo de su credikiva una buena inversión.
texts.en: Dagoberto is 51 years old and lives with his wife and his 3 sons, whose ages range from 14 to 30.  Six years ago, with the support of the sectors around his home, he started a business renting washing machines to neighbors who did not have their own.  Dagoberto works from 7 in the morning until 6 at night from Monday to Sunday, with the goal of continuing to grow his business by increasing his customers.  His sons are the great driver in his life, and with the income from his business he dreams of providing them  with better conditions.  With this in mind, his goal is to grow his business.  He is now requesting a loan, the first one that he has had from the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use it to buy 4 washing machines, with the goal of replacing those that are out of service.  This will be a good investment of his Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy 4 washing machines.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia is the age of 32, living with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  Her husband owns an electrician shop in which he sells electrical goods and provides services for repairing electrical components, such as ceiling fans, washing machines and troubleshoots the underground electrical supply. He also sells electrical components in his shop such as bulbs, switches, sockets etc.  He wants to buy new inventories for his shop, but does not have cash in hand to buy the new inventory. Therefore, Asia has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can be empowered to buy his desired inventory.  Asia thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods for resale.

loans.name: Wendpanga Group

texts.fr:
Mme SOPHIE représente le groupe WENDPANGA. Elle est mariée et mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 19ans et le moins âgé a 06ans. 04 vont à l’école. Elle a 02 personnes en charge.
Elle fait la restauration depuis  03ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. 
Elle veut s’acheter 02 cartons de poissons et 20kg de viande.
Mme veut épargner ses  bénéfices. Elle ambitionne s’acheter une parcelle et mieux entretenir ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Sophie represents the Wendpanga group. She is married and the mother of four children. The oldest is 19 years old and the youngest is six. Four of them attend school, and she has two other persons under her care. 

For the past three years she has been active in the restaurant business. She resupplies at a local market. She wants to buy two boxes of fish and 20 kilos of meat.

She wants to save her profits. Her aim is to buy a plot and better support her children.

loans.use: buy two boxes of fish and 20 kilos of meat

loans.name: Kamwenga

texts.en: Kamwenga thanks Kiva lenders for her previous loan that improved her living standards. It enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan to buy more wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar. She thanks Yehu for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Jay Jaganath Shg (A) Group

texts.en:
The Jay Jaganath self help group consists of 10 cheerful, responsible, and hardworking women who are seeking to improve their work and families. They live in a small village of Nayagarh District of Odisha state, India.

One of the members of this group is Kuni, 38. She's married and has three children, aged 15, 12, and 9 years old. Her oldest son works and helps her financially. Her second and third children attend school. Her husband works as a labourer near Nayagarh city. They live in a family-owned home.

Kuni raises chickens and goats. She is also engaged in farming and harvesting for her home. Her main source of income is vegetable cultivation. The money from her loan will be used to invest in buying wire, chicks, goat kids, and animal feed. Her goal is to grow her livestock business.

loans.use: to invest in buying wire, chicks, goat kids, and animal feed.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg Group

texts.en:
Jhuna operates a food stall/restaurant selling soft drinks, snacks, and breakfast. Jhuna has been involved in this business for more than seven years. The main hardship that Jhuna faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to maintain the refreshment stall (Small bar with coffee, tea, soft drinks, fast food). 

Jhuna is 32 years old and has two children. The lady standing with her hand raised is Jhuna. Jhuna is the group leader of the Maa Santoshi self help group, which consists of eight members. She lives and works in the small village of Nayagarh district, a rural area in Odisha state, India.

In 2013, Jhuna joined People's Forum to improve her business. This is the first loan for Jhuna with People's Forum.

With her business profit, Jhuna hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good school, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials to maintain the refreshment stall

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en:
Munawar, age 34, is a married woman. She is a hardworking and brave mother, who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. Being a mother, she wants to provide better facilities to her children. This is the reason she is doing extraordinary, hard work, to keep her children smiling.

She has been sewing clothes after births of her two children, when she observed that her husband was failing to provide all the necessities to his family. She decided to start tailoring at home, and from then until now she is sewing clothes for her community. She wants to enhance the beauty of her stitching, so she wants to buy a Juki machine. The professional persons use this machine for tailoring, because its speed is very good. She knows the techniques of tailoring very well. Her regular customers are mostly her neighbors, relatives and local community persons.

Munawar has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, and some packs of zippers and buttons, to meet the increasing demand for her services. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a Juki sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat, a 47-year-old father of two schoolchildren, lives in a rural area of Svay Chek District, Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. To make a living, he works as a farmer on a small rice field near his house. Until now, it has been almost 20 years that he has been involved in this career, which allows him to make $3 USD per day.

Phat would like to get loan from HKL, which will be his first loan, for him to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of his family members. Phat thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides him with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 25 years old and married. She was blessed with two children and they live happily in a rural community. Due to financial hardship, Marilyn engages in raising pigs to help her husband in generating income. 

Marilyn aims to acquire more pigs to raise but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of  PHP 5,000 to buy pig feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise. Being a diligent mother, she believes that she will improve her business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition and buy educational materials for her daughter

loans.name: Manzanitas De Pampacollo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MANZANITAS DE PAMPACALLO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Agustina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de queso, venta de leche, servicio de construcción, venta de fibra de alpaca, agricultura.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Agustina es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de sus compañeras que ya pertenecían a la Banca Comunal. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de queso; da a conocer que este negocio fue un negocio familiar y que al casarse deciden seguir realizando el mismo negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para alimento en tiempo de sequía (compra forraje para ganado) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente lo dará a su ganado para la crianza. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito, el ahorro y el seguro de vida que ofrece la institución.
texts.en: The "MANZANITAS DE PAMPACALLO" communal bank is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Copacabana focal center.  It is made up of eight members, and is led by an executive of which Agustina is president.  The business run by the members are varied, and include:  selling food, selling cheese, selling milk, construction, selling alpaca  yarn, and agriculture.  The loan that she is requesting is for food in times of drought (to buy cattle fodder), that she will buy in bulk from vendors in his community and then give it to her cattle to grow.  This work allows her to earn income, as she is married and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the loan, the savings, and the security that the organization offers.

loans.use: to buy fodder for cattle.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is 57 years old, hard working, responsible and honorable. He lives in his own home.

For the past 16 years, he has made a living growing crops. All these years have given him the experience he needs to have a good harvest. Many of his neighbors give good references to his character and his product. These are all reasons that he has so many customers. 

He is asking for a loan from ASKI in order to purchase more agricultural supplies like seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, etc. At the same time, he wants to improve his land where he plants his crops. This will help the land and his family will have a better quality of life without limitations placed on it.

loans.use: to purchase more agricultural supplies like seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a bed for his daughter.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: To have an additional source of income, Remedios has been engaged in direct selling of personal collection products within the local community. She is 61 years old and blessed with ten children. She and her husband aimed to become financially stable in order to educate their children and give them a better living. To attain their goal, Remedios wants to make her business profitable to generate a higher income. Having inadequate capital, she wants to access a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more stocks of personal collections to resell. Through this loan, Remedios believes that someday, she will further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of personal collections  to resell

loans.name: Mary Jene

texts.en:
Mary Jene is 58 years old and married with six children.

Mary Jene is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Jene requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Jene has been raising pigs for 21 years now, and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF, and more recently, from Kiva, to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Eng's Group

texts.en:
Eng, 47, is married and lives with her husband and five children, in a village of the Thmor Koul district, Battambang province. She and her husband are rice farmers, and they supplement their family’s income by working for others for a fee. She has been in the rice farming business for 10 years, earning about 30,000 KHR per day to feed her family.

Eng has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. She is going to use her portion of the loan funds to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield and earn more income, to better off her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Sokchhoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Sokchhoeurn is residing in Koh Sotin district, located in Kampong Cham province. She is a 34-year-old married woman and also a mother of three dependent children; one under school-aged child and two schoolchildren. Her main sources of income are from agribusiness - maize and tobacco farming. 

This is the first loan for Sokchhoeurn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for the watering fee. 

Additionally, she also weaves cotton scarves called “Krama” as a supplementary source of income. 

This is the first time loan for Sokchhoeurn and her two group members to apply for a loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  The entire loan amount is 4,200,000 KHR, which contributes an equal share of 1,400,000 KHR each. 

She plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for the watering fee. She strongly hopes that the loan will enable her to earn a higher income so she that she can live in a more hygienic lifestyle and be able to provide enough school material for her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for the watering fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: La Pampa Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer abandonada tiene 28 años 4 hijos y durante toda su vida se ha dedicado a quemar carbon de leña y comercializarlo en Borbón y San Lorenzo. sus hijos estudian la escuela y ella desea cambiar de actividad ya que es muy peligroso y siempre se afecta con quemaduras en su piel y manos. ella desea que sus hijos no aprendan esta actividad por lo peligroso que es.
en vista que sus hijos estudian. se hace primordial el acompañamiento. es por eso. que ahora se dedicara a la cria de pollos. 
con este préstamo que FODEMI le brinda. ella tendrá la oportunidad de comprar 100 pollos, alimento balanceado y algunos productos para implementar en una pequeña tienda de abarrotes para servir a su comunidad.
dice tener dificultades con el carbón por que muchas veces la gente no paga el precio fijado y ademas es costoso llevarlo hasta San Lorenzo o Borbón y muchas veces no venderlo y tener que regresarlo a la comunidad. habiendo gastado dinero en el transporte.
menciona que la elaboración de carbón de leña es una actividad autóctona difícil de elaborarla y mal remunerada.
con el cambio de actividad. ella esta segura de poder brindar mejor educación y oportunidades a sus hijos ya que en un futuro no muy lejano desea comprar una casa en donde sus hijos puedan tener acceso a educación secundaria.
texts.en: Maria is a 28-year-old woman who has been abandoned with 4 children.  All her life she has worked making and selling charcoal in Borbon and San Lorenzo.  Her children go to school and she would like to change her occupation, because what she is doing is very dangerous and she is constantly burning her skin and hands.  She does not want her children to learn this trade because it is dangerous.  Because her children are in school, it is imperative that she support them.  For this reason she now works raising chickens.  With this loan through FODEMI, she will be able to buy 100 chickens, balanced food for them and also some products to sell in a small store in her community.  She says she has problems with charcoal because often people do not pay her the full price, and it is expensive to transport it to San Lorenzo and Borbon.  Many times she doesn't sell it and has to go home, having wasted money on transportation.  She says that making charcoal is a difficult and badly paid local activity.  With her change in occupation, she is sure that she will be able to provide better income and opportunities for her children.  In the future she would like to buy a house in a place where they will have access to secondary education.

loans.use: to buy 100 chickens, balanced food for them and also some products to sell in a small store in her community.

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
This group, called Grace's Group, is made up of seven women and will begin its eighth loan cycle from ID-Ghana. The members of the group run a variety of businesses including the sale of soft drinks, detergents, barrels, hardware, pork meat, provisions and a beauty salon.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small micro-business owners like Barikisu, who has a business selling detergents. She says that she joined ID-Ghana five years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. She explains that she started this business after seeing a friend who was selling these products and obtaining capital from ID-Ghana to establish her own independent business.

The loan she will take now is to increase her capital for the purchase of detergents wholesale, which she will acquire at the market in the city of Accra. She will then sell them in another small market. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is married with five children.

When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responds that she likes the savings and the institution's heath-related offerings.

The group needs a total amount of GHS 10,500 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase detergents wholesale at the market in the city of Accra.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 48-year-old married man with five children and three other dependants whom he looks after due to financial constraints in their families. He has a retail general store business in his region, and also works as a taxi driver and in agriculture as additional sources of income. As a result, Grace has been able to provide his family with the basic necessities of life. 

His primary challenge is limited capital to meet all his customers’ demands, which ultimately limits his profits and his ability to invest in his business and home life. Therefore Grace is applying for a loan of 4,000,0000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) to buy more stock for his business so that he can better meet his customers' needs. 

His dream is to see his business grow from a retail to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his retail general store

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate,provincia La Convención y departamento Cusco.
La socia María de los Ángeles tiene 44 años tiene 01 hijo y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono y otros para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI from the district of Echarate, which is located in the province of La Convencion and belongs to the Cusco office.

Maria de los Angeles is 44, single and has one child.  She does different daily activities, working in agriculture.  She has been in this line of work for several years and is successful thanks to the hard work she puts in every day.  

She wants to continue working so that she can support her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy some compost among other things for her business.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to pay it back in the agreed instalments.

loans.use: to buy compost and other agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate,provincia La Convención y departamento Cusco.
La socia Irene tiene 51 años tiene 05 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono y otros para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI from the district of Echarate, which is located in the province of La Convencion and belongs to the Cusco office.

Irene is 51, married, and has five children.  She does different daily activities, working in agriculture.  She has been in this line of work for several years and is successful thanks to the hard work she puts in every day.  

She wants to continue working so that she can support her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy some compost among other things for her business.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to pay it back in the agreed instalments.

loans.use: to buy compost and other agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Las Comadres Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS COMADRES” iniciará el vigésimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rogelia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: librería, venta de pito, venta de verduras, servicio de construcción, venta de celulares, venta de comida, venta de polleras, tienda de barrio, venta de gorras, venta de matas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rogelia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una vecina que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento hace varios años al observar que estos productos eran requeridos en el mercado, decide comercializarlos y lograr un medio de subsistencia. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Comadres” (The Godmothers) is starting its 22nd loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Community Center. This group consists of nine members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Rogelia is the president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as managing a bookstore, selling pan flutes, selling vegetables, providing construction services, selling mobile phones, selling food, selling traditional skirts, managing a neighborhood store, selling caps, and selling plants.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Rogelia. She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago after receiving an invitation from a neighbor who is a member of the organization. Rogelia currently has a business of selling vegetables. She became knowledgeable about this type of business several years ago after observing the products that were sold in the market. Rogelia decided to sell these products in order to earn a living.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying vegetables in bulk. She acquires her inventory at the wholesale fairs in the city of El Alto and then sells her products from her retail space. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family. Rogelia is in a common-law relationship and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Rogelia said that she enjoys the health services and the training seminars offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO AMANECER” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Herminia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: artesana en mantillas, tejido de mantas, venta de granos de cebada, venta de ganado camélido, venta de papa y chuño, servicio de turismo, elaboración de colchones.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Herminia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de colchones de paja; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su pareja, al unirse deciden emprender este negocio juntos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el seguro de vida que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal bank "Nuevo Amanecer" will start the third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the regional office in Copacabana.  It is made up of ten members and is run by a board of directors, of which Herminia is the president.  The various business activities that the members do are: making blankets, weaving blankets, sale of barley grains, rearing livestock, sale of potatoes, tourism and mattress making.
 
The loan that they are requesting will benefit the group of small businesses of which Herminia is a member.  She became a member two years ago when the institution carried out a publicity campaign.  She currently has a business producing straw mattresses.  She learnt this trade from her partner and they decided to go into business together.
 
The loan that they are asking for is to increase their capital so that they can buy fabric wholesale from the traders in the area.  Then they will sell their products in the local market.  

This work allows her to generate an income to support her family, as she is married and has two children.  

When she is asked what she likes most about 'Pro Mujer', she tells us that it is the life insurance that the organization offers.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale.

loans.name: Roy

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Roy se dedica al negocio de agricultura, el socio tiene un terreno donde cultiva platanos,cafe,mandarinas, naranjas y cacao, el socio trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar su terreno de cultivo.El socio solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI from the district of Echarate, which is located in the province of La Convencion and belongs to the Cusco office.

Roy works in agriculture.  He has a field where he grows bananas, coffee, mandarins, oranges and cocoa.  He works from 6:00 am until 5:00 pm.  He has been in this business for several years and he is very successful.  

He dreams of expanding his land so he can grow more.  He is asking for a loan to buy seed and fertilizer.

He is happy with the loan system and is committed to meeting the monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.es:
La señora emperatriz tiene muy claros sus objetivos que son acreditar su negocio de comidas rápidas y extender sus comidas y buen servicio a más personas.
Esta idea es la que siempre lleva en su mente y hace todo lo posible para aplicarla en todo lo que hace cada día. Tiene su negocio de preparación y venta de comidas rápidas hace más de 1 año y adicionalmente vende refrescos y frituras.
Se siente muy contenta al poder generar sus propios ingresos y manifiesta gran gratitud con la Corporación Interactuar quien le ayudo para montar su negocio.
Ella solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos para sus preparaciones y surtido de bebidas y frituras para aumentar su oferta de servicios.
Es una mujer con gran sentido de emprendimiento y con ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Emperatriz is a woman who has very clear goals in life.  These are to finance her fast food business and extend her meals and good service to more people.

This is the idea she always has in her head and she does all she can to apply this philosophy to her work on a daily basis.  She has had her fast food business for more than a year and she also sells soft drinks and fried foods.

She is very happy to be able to generate her own income and is grateful to the 'Interactuar Corporation' who have helped her set up her business.

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies to prepare her meals; as well as a selection of drinks and fried foods which will expand her business and the service she offers.

She has a very enterprising mind and a strong desire to succeed.

loans.use: to buy supplies and a selection of drinks and fried snacks.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a married woman with 3 children, all of whom still attend school and are still under her care. They live in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanahamisi operates a clothes selling business, and she sells at the market to the other town dwellers and her neighbours. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase one bale of clothes for resale.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of clothes for resale

loans.name: Tarangire-Bunda Group

texts.en:
Christina, a business woman and the mother of five school-aged children, is aged thirty. She is married and supports her family by running a general store enterprise which sells cereal items like rice and beans, sugar, maize flour, baking flour, cooking oil, etc. She has been in this business for six years now and is able to make a good profit each month. She works at the business from 7am to 6pm daily.

This will be her first credit via Tujijenge Tanzania. Christina is applying for a loan which will be shared among Tarangire-Bunda, a five-member group. Each member of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. She will use her portion to purchase rice, sugar and other shop items. 

Christina's ambition is to build business premises.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar and other shop items.

loans.name: Aroma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AROMA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rebeca es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, pastelería, venta de material de limpieza, agropecuario, venta de artículos varios, venta de chuño y papa, venta de cerveza, venta de fruta.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rebeca es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia, ya que desde niño ella apoyo a su familia y por ello conocía este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de semillas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo cultivará en su estancia para poder comercializarlo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal bank "Aroma" will start its second cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the regional office in Patacamaya.  It is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors of which Rebeca is the secretary.  The different business activities that the members of the group do are: running a local grocery store, running a cake shop, selling cleaning materials, agricultural work, selling general goods, selling potatoes, selling beer and selling fruit.
 
This loan will benefit the small businesses such as the one Rebeca has.  It is the first time that she has been a member of the Pro Mujer group, joining when a representative of the group visited her house to promote the organization.  

She has a business producing fruit.  She started this business on her own initiative because when she was young, she helped her family out and learnt about this trade.
 
She is asking for a loan to buy seeds wholesale from the traders in the El Alto area.  She will grow and then sell her produce on the market.  This way of working allows her to generate an income to support her family.  She is married and has one child.  

When she is asked what she likes most about 'Pro Mujer', she tells us that it is the training that the organization offers.

loans.use: to buy seeds wholesale.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Valentina se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI from the district of Echarate, which is located in the province of La Convencion and belongs to the Cusco office.

Her name is Valentina and she sells food.  She prepares various dishes such as roast chicken, soup and meat.  She works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm.  She has been in this business for eight years and she is doing very well.  

Her dream is to have a restaurant.  She is asking for a loan to buy products to prepare meals, such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

She is very happy with the loans and promises to meet the monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy products to help her prepare her food, such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 32-year-old married man with four children and one dependent, whom he is looking after due to the loss of her parents. He does cattle fattening and milking as his major source of income, and he has managed to provide his family with the basic necessities of life. He owns 30 hectares of land and owns about 50 cows, the majority of which are for milk production. 

Wilson's major challenge is the lack of a permanent house for his large family. He currently lives in a grass-thatched house which can’t accommodate his growing family. Therefore he is applying for a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) to finish his house, which is currently under construction. 

He dreams of being a good father and providing his family with all the necessities. He is honest and hardworking.

loans.use: to complete his house

loans.name: Estrellas De Fatima Group

texts.es: Rosario de 34 años es separada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella  pertenece al grupo  “Estrellas De Fátima” conformada por 09 mujeres entusiastas. Rosario hace más de 02 años que se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y cosméticos. Gracias a su constancia su negocio le va bien. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de perfume, colonia y talco. El deseo de Rosario es  crecer en su negocio llegando a más clientes.  El grupo “Estrellas De Fátima” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda facilitada. Rosario se encuentra sentada es la primera del lado derecho y viste casaca marrón.
texts.en:
Rosario is 34 years old, separated from her spouse, and has two dependent children. She is a member of the group “Estrellas de Fátima”, which consists of nine enthusiastic women.

For more than two years, Rosario has been selling beauty products and cosmetics. As a result of her persistence, her business is doing well. She is requesting a loan in order to buy perfumes, colognes, and talcum powders. Rosario wants to grow her business by reaching out to more customers.

The group “Estrellas De Fátima” is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the assistance they have provided. In the photo, Rosario is seated in the first position on the right-hand side and is wearing a brown jacket.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, colognes, and talcum powders.

loans.name: Ana Miriam

texts.es: Ana tiene 20 años de edad y habita junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de un año de edad. Ana se dedica a la venta de verduras de forma ambulante desde hace tres años. De esta forma logra llevar el sustento a su hogar y se gana el pan de cada día y junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía del hogar. Ana solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea comprar las ventanas a su casa y enladrillar el piso de la misma. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo y ventanas.
texts.en:
Ana is 20 years old and lives with her life companion and their one-year-old son. She has been selling vegetables as a street vendor for three years. This is how she sustains her household and earns her daily living. She and her companion maintain the household finances together.

Ana is requesting this loan from FUSAI because she wants to buy windows for her house and pave the floor with bricks. The amount she requested will be used to buy cement, sand, bricks, and windows.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, and windows.

loans.name: María Andrea

texts.es:
María Andrea tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a su cónyuge y un hijo, en una comunidad de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, desde hace varios años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y una segunda parte para la compra de mayor cantidad de pollos y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Andrea, 39, lives with her husband and son in a community in Oyotun.  The local people work in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming.  It is located in the province of Chiclayo which belongs to the Lambayeque Region along the northern coast of Peru.

María Andrea raises and sells animals such as ducks and chickens and has been in business for several years, working out of the backyard of her home.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced animal feed and more chickens to sell to customers.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Monique

texts.fr: Monique est une femme de 52 ans divorcé, mère de 5 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 15 et 26 ans. Trois de ses enfants vont encore à l'école. Elle est commerçante et vend du bois de chauffage depuis 20ans, c''est grâce à cette activité qu'elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille. La bonne maitrise et son expérience dans cette activité agrandit sa clientèle au fil du temps. Elle s’approvisionne sauvant dans les villages en achetant des tas de bois pour fendre et détailler. Mais elle aimerai grâce à ce crédit pouvoir à nouveau remplir un pick up de bois parce que cela lui rapportera plus de bénéfice. Elle épargnera une partie de son profit et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Monique is 52 years old. She is divorced and the mother of 5 children aged between 15 and 26. Three of her children still attend school. She is a retailer and has been selling firewood for 20 years; it is thanks to her business that she is able to meet her family's needs.

Her good knowledge and experience in her area of work have helped her grow her customer base over the years. She often gets her supplies in the villages, buying stacks of wood which she splits and sells retail.

Monique would like, thanks to this loan, to be able to buy a pickup load of wood because that would generate more profit for her. She will save a part of her profit and the rest of it will enable her to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy wood wholesale.

loans.name: Richard Blaise

texts.fr: Richard est un homme de 31 ans père de famille. il est commerçant et a ouvert un atelier dans lequel il arrange et commercialise les pneus dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 3 ans déjà. il sollicite un crédit pour augmenter son stock de marchandises. ceci augmentera non seulement sas ventes, ainsi aussi sa marge bénéficiaire. bénéfice qui sera réinvesti en partie dans son activité, et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Richard is a 31-year-old man with children.  He is a trader and opened a workshop where he sells tyres three years ago.  His workshop is in a neighbourhood of the capital city.

Richard has requested this loan in order to increase his stock levels.  This will increase, not only his sales, but also his profit levels.  He intends to reinvest some of his profits in his business, and use the rest to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to increase his stock of tyres.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric and wheat flour.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo tiene 55 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en el Caserío Pueblo Libre, una zona rural del Distrito de Yamango, una zona de clima caluroso, es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura , ganadería y comercio cuentan con servicios básicos como son agua y luz, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo y comercio de guayaquil, actividad que realiza hace más de 03 años, contando con clientela fija en la zona, ya que se utiliza para cercos de viviendas, para decoración de tiendas y restaurants.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de Guayaquil en las zonas aledañas para posteriormente ofrecerlo a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
Guillermo, 55, lives with his common-law wife in Caserío Pueblo Libre which is a rural area in the district of Yamango.  It is a place with a hot climate where the local people work in agriculture, livestock farming and commerce.  Basic utilies such as water and electricity are available in this area which is located in the province of Morropon in the Piura Region along the northern coastline of Peru.

Guillermo works in agriculture, growing and selling bamboo, and he has been in this business for three years.  He has many clients in the area because bamboo is used for walls around houses and as decoration in stores and restaurants.

He has requested a loan in the amount of 2,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy bamboo in neighboring villages to later sell for a profit.

loans.use: To buy bamboo in neighboring villages to sell later for a profit.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, provincia La Convención y departamento Cusco.
La socia Vilma tiene 37 años tiene 05 hijos y es viuda, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cultiva frutas entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, fertilizantes entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI which is located in the district of Echarate in the province of La Convención, department of Cusco.

Vilma, 37, is a widow and has five children.  She alternates her daily activities with her work in agriculture which she has been involved in for some time.  It is going well for her because of the effort she puts into it daily.  She grow fruits and other crops, and wants to continue working in order to support her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy compost, fertilizers and other supplies.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy compost, fertilizers and other products.

loans.name: Crescence

texts.fr: Crescence est une femme de 42 ans mariée mère de famille. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais( gombo, légumes, maniocs, plantains) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 21 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaiterai à nouveau augmenter son stock de vivres en achetant en gros ceci augmentera non seulement ses ventes mais aussi son bénéfice. Bénéfice qu'elle réinvestira en partie dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Crescence is a 42-year-old woman who is married and a mother. She is a retailer and has been selling seasonal fresh food items (okra, vegetables, cassava, plantains) to retail customers at a local market for 21 years. She knows the suppliers well, as she does her customers, whom she has acquired over time thanks to her experience in her line of work. However, she often has stock shortages as she is forced to use up all of her inventory before she can afford to buy more, because of her limited capital. She would like to increase her inventory of food items by buying wholesale; this will not only increase her sales, but also her profits. She will reinvest part of those profits in her business so that she can expand it, and the other part will be used to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of food.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo tiene 31años de edad, vive con su padres en el Caserío Chisca Blanca, una zona rural del distrito de Morropon una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de jornalería en las fincas de sus vecinos y zonas aledañas, también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores en un corral ubicada en la parte posterior a su domicilio.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos y de esta manera ofrecer un servicio adicional al de jornalería y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Eduardo, 31, lives with his parents in the Caserío Chisca Blanca, a rural area in the district of Morropon.  The climate here is hot and the local people work in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming.  The area is in the Morropon Province which belongs to the Piura Region along the northern coast of Peru.

Eduardo offers day laborer services to neighboring farms and in nearby villages.  He also raises small animals in a pen in back of his house.

The loan he is requesting through Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1,500 PEN is to buy composts to offer as an additional service in order to generate more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy compost to offer as an extra service in his day labor business.

loans.name: Muyisa Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Kyakimwa est une commerçante depuis 12 ans, âgée de 49 ans, mariée et mère de 11 enfants dont 2 scolarisés et 9 n'étudient plus. La cliente est membre d’une Association d’Affaires «Muyisa». Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle installe ses marchandises à domicile dans un  quartier commercial. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 1 sac de braises, 1 sac de farine de manioc, tomates. Son conjoint est un charpentier. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables en leur accordant de crédit pendant, ce moment post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.Il sied de signaler qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Kyakimwa has been a retailer for twelve years.  She is 49 years old, married and mother to eleven children.  Two of her children still attend school and the other nine have finished studying.  Kyakimwa is a member of the business group 'Muyisa', and sells food products from her home in a commercial district.  Her husband is a carpenter, and she started her business with funds provided by him.

Kyakimwa has requested this loan from the field partner, Hekima, in order to expand her business.  She plans to buy one sack of charcoal, one sack of cassava flour and tomatoes.

In the future, Kyakimwa would like to increase her working capital, and educate and feed her children.  She is grateful to Hekima for the support and loans that they offer to non-bankable women entrepreneurs during the post-conflict period in the east of the country.

It should be noted that one of the clients is holding her baby.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of charcoal, 1 sack of cassava flour and tomatoes.

loans.name: Kadziche

texts.en:
Kadziche lives in the Coastal region of Kenya. She is a very hardworking woman who greatly appreciates Kiva lenders for financial support.

Kadziche is requesting a loan to purchase building materials for construction of her house. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for the construction of her house

loans.name: Srimariyamman Shg Group

texts.en:
Daisy (standing in the photo with her hand raised) is a member of the “Srimariyamman” Self-Help-Group (SHG), started by the NGO “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT) which serves the Melappalur village of Tamil Nadu, India. Daisy is married to her spouse, Johnson, and has three sons who are studying in the 10th, 9th and 7th grades. They possess a house of their own.

Daisy and her group wish to reduce expenses as well cook in a healthier environment. They are requesting a Kiva loan in order to buy smokeless stoves from Grameen Infra. The Greenway smart stove is a single burner, high-efficiency cook stove designed for long-term, everyday use. The stove can use any type of solid biomass fuel, producing 70% less smoke emissions and using 65% less fuel than traditional mud cook stoves.

This is the “Srimariyamman” Self-Help-Group’s first loan with Kiva (and MicroGraam).They are looking forward to the income they will save and a better cooking environment due to this purchase.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Sriakilandeshwari Shg Group

texts.en:
Sumathi (standing in the photo with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the “Sriakilandeshwari” Self-Help Group (SHG). The local NGO “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT) has been financing this group via microfinance loans for the last six years. With the loans, the borrowers have been able to improve their livelihood through the cultivation of crops. Through NGO training, the women in the group are empowered and have become morally strong.
 
Sumathi lives in the rural village of Annalagaharam in the Trichy District of Tamil Nadu, India. She is married to her spouse, Vedhalingam, and is the mother of two children. They live in a house made of thatched roof. Her husband is a carpenter by profession.

Sumathi and her group are requesting a Kiva loan in order to purchase a smokeless stove for their own families.The stove can use any type of solid biomass fuel including wood, cow dung and agricultural waste and is therefore highly sustainable. It also produces 70% less smoke while using 65% less fuel than traditional mud cook stoves. Not only will the stove help save money for each family but it will also decrease overall air pollution in the village.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Udhayam Shg Group

texts.en:
Philomin (in the middle of the photo with her hand raised) is the leader of the Udhayam Self Help group, which is managed by the local NGO “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT).  The group contains five members from the Lalgudi village in Tamil Nadu, India. She is 45 years old and married to her spouse Anthony, who is a milkman by profession. They are parents of two children.

The group has been receiving microfinance loans from PAT for the last five years. These loans have been instrumental in developing the quality of their livelihood as well as in purchasing cows, goats etc. Because of these loans, they have been able to earn more income and are prompt in their repayments.

With a Kiva group loan, the members of the group can buy smokeless stoves that lower firewood consumption. As a result, these stoves reduce carbon emissions as well as indoor air pollution levels. The group is requesting a loan of INR 7,000. By purchasing this stove, group members can reduce fuel consumption, lower costs and help create a better environment in their surrounding village.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: Elisabeth est une femme 41 ans mère de famille. Elle a un restaurant qu'elle gère depuis 16 mois. c'est grâce à lui qu'elle s'occupe de sa famille. Le fait d'acheter les produits de restauration en détail ne rapporte vraiment grand chose pour elle. D'où l'importance de ce crédit pour son activité parce que ça lui permettra d'augmenter le stock de ses denrées alimentaires (sacs de d'arachide, 1 sac de riz et le petit nécessaire pour cuisiner ses plats. Cela lui évitera les déplacements quotidiens et diminuera ses frais de taxi, ça augmentera aussi ses bénéfices. Elle réinvestira une partie de ce profit pour agrandir son restaurant, l'autre l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Elisabeth is a 41-year-old woman and a mother. She owns a restaurant which she has been running for 16 months. It is thanks to her restaurant that she is able to take care of her family. Having to buy the ingredients for her restaurant at retail prices does not allow her to earn much money. Thus the importance of this loan for her business, as it will enable her to increase her stock of food products (bags of groundnuts, one bag of rice and other small items she needs to prepare her meals). This will help her to avoid making daily trips and will decrease her taxi expenses, which will increase her profit margin. She will reinvest part of her profits in expanding her restaurant, and the rest will help her to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of food products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Maria Judit

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, provincia La Convención y departamento Cusco.
La socia María Judit tiene 47 años tiene 03 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cultiva frutas entre otros, la socia a la vez tiene otro negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, fertilizantes entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI which is located in the district of Echarate, province of La Convención in the department of Cusco.

María Judit, 47, is single and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with her work in agriculture, which she has been involved in for quite some time.
