Business is going well for her because of the effort she puts into it every day.  She grows fruits and other crops, and also runs a grocery store.  María Judit wants to continue working so she can support her family.

The loan she is requesting is to buy compost, fertilizers and other supplies.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy compost, fertilizers and other supplies.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Siramarg

texts.en:
Siramarg lives in the village of Gandzaqar, which is in the Tavush region. She lives with her husband.  

Both Siramarg and her husband are self-employed. They are engaged in farming and agriculture. On their farm, they have a lot of animals, and it is the only source of income for their family. They have five cows, four calves, and chickens. Near their house, they have a small plot of land where they cultivate potato, haricot and corn. All the income that they earn from farming they use first for their family's expenses. The requested loan of USD 3,000 will be a big help for Siramarg to purchase three calves, two pigs and forage for the livestock. 

She hopes very much that Kiva will support her and help her to better her family's poor living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for three calves, two pigs and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with four children, three in school and one underage. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mariam has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past two years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Shallot

texts.en:
Shallot is a 29-year-old married woman with two children and three dependents who she takes cares for due to the financial constraints of their families. Shallot operates a retail trade shop and does cattle fattening and milking as her major sources of income. She has managed to look after her family and relatives, providing them with the basic necessities. 

Shallot is applying for a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy more cows and construct a reservoir for her animals to get water even in the dry season. Her major challenge is the prolonged drought due to seasonal changes, which has left her animals with limited water. Shallot’s dream is to own the largest farm in her region. She is a hardworking, generous and social woman.

loans.use: to buy cattle and build a reservoir

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Lunar

texts.en:
Lunar is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over three years, she has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase more stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions

loans.name: Lucky Group

texts.en:
Alice is in her 30s and has two sons in school. She is a divorcee who supports her family with her shop selling gowns, trousers, shirts and shoes. She has been in this business for four years now and is able to make a fair monthly profit. Alice opens her shop from 7 am to 6 pm daily. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this will be her first loan. She will use it to buy clothes and shoes to resell. She is applying for a loan to be apportioned among the three-member Lucky group. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Her ambition is to build a business premise.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is a hardworking woman who greatly thanks Kiva lenders for supporting her financially in her previous loan.

She is requesting a loan to purchase buttons, thread and needles for her business. She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase buttons, thread, and needles for her business

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine lives in Kapan town in the Syunik region. She lives there with her daughter and works as a telephone operator for a taxi service. As her salary alone is not enough for covering her family's expenses, Narine is also involved in agriculture. She keeps livestock including cows, calves, pigs and piglets. 

The requested loan of USD 3,000 will be a huge support for Narine's farm. She will use it to purchase two cows and a calf. Narine hopes for the lenders' support and good will.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and a calf

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and one of them goes to school. She takes care of additional family members (a sister and brother). She is a tailor. She operates her business on a retail basis and works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last 12 years. She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 2,500,000 from MCDT–SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing material. She generates additional income from her restaurant. Her major challenges include seasonality and defaulters. Her goal and aspiration is to own a tailoring school. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing material

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with six children and none of them goes to school. She has additional family members (grandchildren). She has a restaurant. She operates her business on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last 25 years. Imelda generates additional income from rental rooms. She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 1,800,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more foodstuffs like bunches of green bananas, beef, chicken, cassava and rice. Her major business challenges include transportation, seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked restaurant and to build more rental rooms. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees for her grandchildren and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuff like bunches of green bananas, beef, chicken, cassava and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to furnish his house by painting it.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is a widow with four children, of whom two go to school. She has no additional family members. She has a business of selling used clothes. She operates her business on a retail basis and moves door to door selling used clothes seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last three years. She generates additional income from selling clean drinking water. She has requested for a loan of UGX 1,200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy several bales of used clothes to sell. She describes her main business challenge as seasonality. Her aspirations are to obtain a permanent business premise and to become a wholesaler. She resides in the family house, where she has access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Jones

texts.en: Jones is a married man with four children who all attend school. He runs a transport business and works ten hours a day, six days a week. He has been in the transport business for five years and also earns an additional income through his retail shop. Jones started his business to have a daily income to sustain his family and he hopes that buying a bigger vehicle will increase his income. Jones wants money to pay his children's school fees. He is hard working but his business is impacted by mechanical breakdowns and weather changes.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and over-sewing machine

loans.name: Lucky-B Group

texts.en:
Shabani is a man in his late thirties with two daughters who are still young. He is divorced and supports himself by managing an internet cafe business together with selling cellular phones. His internet cafe is open from 7am to 6pm daily and is able to generate a fair return each month. Shabani has been in this business for two years now. Internet cafes are a necessary and important service in his region, as internet service is still a challenge in most parts of Tanzania. He aims to improve his cafe by offering faster internet and other necessary services. 

Shabani is requesting his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to purchase a business computer and cellular phones to resell. Shabani dreams of expanding his business. He will share this loan with his loan group, "LUCKY-B," which consists of three people. The people of this group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a business computer and cellular phones to resell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margret lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is a widow with eight children, of which one goes to school. She takes care of additional family members (her grandchildren). She is a poultry farmer. She operates her business on a retail basis from home seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last seven years. She has requested a loan of UGX 1,500,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags chicken feed. Her major business challenge includes poultry diseases and the ever-increasing prices of chicken feed. Her goal and aspiration is to expand her business into a big poultry farm. She resides in the family house, where she has access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed

loans.name: Mti Mrefu Group

texts.en:
Fortunatus is in his late twenties and married with one child who is still small. He has been selling chips with chicken, goat's meat and beef, as well as bananas. He does not fry the meat but just boils it. He has been in this business for five years now. He works with his wife. They work from 11am to mid-night daily and are able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Fortunatus' second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan, which he successfully repaid, to restock items in his business. He is happy with the loan and thanks Kiva for its support of his loan group. He used the additional profit to cover household expenses. He dreams of building his own house and being able to afford to send his children to very good schools.

Fortunatus will share this loan with his loan group, "MTI MREFU." The two members of this group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes, chicken, goat meat and beef, cooking oil, charcoal and bananas.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Margaret. This thirty-two-year-old mother of three is a resident of Kapletundo village in the South Rift region of Kenya. She is a smallholder farmer who has been engaged in mixed farming for ten years. She keeps dairy cows and grows tea and various vegetables. 

Margaret is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to venture into poultry farming. The indigenous poultry industry in Kenya has a recognized potential to generate higher income and transform living standards if appropriate interventions are developed and implemented. It also contributes significantly to food security and employment.

For Margaret to become competitive and achieve this potential, she requires training to handle emerging issues. Juhudi has an extension officer at Margaret’s disposal for all the technical guidance and training programmes. This will ensure he employs the best practices in horticulture to guarantee success. 

She plans to invest her profits back into the business. With your help, her family will enjoy financial security from this venture.

loans.use: To purchase chickens

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy corn and palm nuts.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is single with four children and one of them goes to school. She also takes care of her mother. 

Sarah sells used clothes. She operates her business on a wholesale basis and works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last seven years. She requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy several bales of used shoes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and theft. Her goal and aspiration is to start importing used shoes. She resides in the family house where she has access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Sacristain Group

texts.fr: La cliente Masika est une commerçante depuis 10 ans, vice présidente et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Sacristain», entrepreneur, âgée de 48 ans, mariée et mère de 10 enfants, qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés, elle étale son business dans le marché du centre ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 180 paires de souliers. Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire de l’Administration publique. Elle débuta avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite  scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour avoir bien choisi sa cible, en apportant un soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle.
texts.en: The customer, Masika, has been a trader for the past ten years and she is vice-president and member of the "Sacristain" business association. She is an entrepreneur who is 48 years old and mother to ten children, all of whom are studying. She sells used shoes and displays her goods in a market in the town centre. She is requesting a loan from Hekima so she can expand her business, and she is going to buy 180 pairs of shoes. Her husband is a civil servant who works for the State Administration. She began her business with funds from her husband. In the future she would like to be able to educate and feed her children. She is grateful to Hekima for having chosen its objective well, by supporting female entrepreneurs who do not have access to the classic bank system, by granting them loans without requiring any material guarantee.

loans.use: to buy 180 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Diouma Ngor's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 6 fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 13 décembre 2008. Ce banc regroupe de femmes qui viennent du même village et ceux des environs. Une bonne entente règne entre elles.
Diouma debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. 
Avec le prêt elle compte acheter un bœuf à 150000f et des brebis. Elle compte sur le soutien de ses enfants pour faire son embouche.
Avec les bénéfices elle va renforcer son épargne dans le banc villageois et prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group of six belongs to the Banc Villageois which was set up on 13th December 2008. This Banc Villageois brings together women who come from the same village and its surroundings. There is a good relationship between them.

Diouma, who is standing on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is 51 years old. She is married and mother to two children. 

With this loan she is planning to buy a cow for 150,000 francs and some sheep. She counts on her children's support to carry out her fattening business. With the profits she makes she will boost her savings in the Banc Villageois and be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy a cow and some sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric, bags and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es:
Luz Angélica tiene 23 años de edad, vive junto con sus padres en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población es alegre se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza y comida desde hace 2 años cuenta con clientela en la zona, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mesas y sillas que le permitan ampliar su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Luz  Angélica is 23 years old. She lives with her parents in the district of Buenos Aires, a community in a warm climate. Its people are cheerful and they work in agriculture, commerce and ranching. It is located in the Provincia of Morropon, which belongs to the Piura region in the northern coast of Peru. 

She has worked selling beer and food for 2 years. She  has customers in the area and her business is located in her house. She has asked for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1,500 nuevos soles to buy tables and chairs so that she can expand her business and thus generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs that will allow her to expand her business.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 64 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 02 hijos en el Caserío km 81, una zona rural del Distrito de San Felipe que se encuentra ubicada en la carretera de Jaén – Chiclayo, su población se dedica al comercio de alimentos y frutas, ubicado en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica al comercio de diversos productos de primera necesidad, con la ayuda de su esposa atienden en su bodeguita brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos para hacer crecer su negocio y una segunda parte para la compra de aceites para su mototaxi y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco is 64 years old and he lives with his partner and has 2 children. He lives in Caserío km 81, a rural area in the district of San Felipe, located on the Jaén – Chiclayo highway. Its residents work selling animals and fruit. It is in the province of Jaén, which belongs to the region of Cajamarca, in the northern Sierra of Peru.  

He works selling staple products. He and his wife run their little store and offer their customers a good service. They have asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy a variety of products to grow his business and also to buy oil for his motorcycle taxi so he can generate income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to grow his business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr:
Ama a 43 ans et habite le quartier Agoè à Lomé. Entre 2009 et 2012, elle était restauratrice ce qu’elle abandonne pour se lancer dans la vente de charbon de bois dû à la mévente. Ama vend de lundi à samedi de 7h30 à 17h à la devanture de sa maison, l'accueille et l'écoute des clients est sa particularité, a tel point qu’elle s’approvisionne deux fois par mois juste pour satisfaire ses clients.
Le coût élevé de la livraison à domicile l’a poussé à solliciter un crédit pour réduire sa fréquence d’approvisionnement à une fois le mois.
Ce crédit lui permettra d'acheter 20 sacs de charbons de bois supplémentaires.
texts.en: Ama is 43 years old and lives in the Agoè district in Lomé. She ran a restaurant between 2009 and 2012 but had to give up that business and start selling charcoal due to poor sales. Ama sells charcoal in front of her home from Monday to Saturday between 7.30am and 5pm. Her customers value her warm welcome and her skills as a good listener so much that she has to get supplies twice a month just so that she can satisfy demand. The high cost of getting the supplies delivered to her home has prompted her to ask for a loan so that she can start buying what she needs just once a month. This loan will enable her to buy 20 extra bags of charcoal.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, provincia La Convención y departamento Cusco.
El socio tiene 40 años tiene 02 hijos y es soltero, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio cultiva frutas como plátanos, naranjas entre otros, el socio  desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, fertilizantes entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This partner belongs to the KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Echarate, province of La Convención and department of Cuzco.

He is 40 years old and has 2 children. He is single. His daily activities are farming. He has been in tis business for a long time and it is going well for him thanks to the hard work he puts into his business every day. He grows fruit such as plantains, oranges and more. He wants to keep working so that he can keep supporting his family. 

He is asking for the loan to buy fertilizer and more. He is grateful for the loan and committed to making his payments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy lubricants for resale.

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
Nunjar Simona tiene 46 años de edad, vive junto con su cónyuge y su hijo en una comunidad de Morropon, el clima es caluroso y su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre, ubicada en la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de yuca, tiene pedidos de los restaurants del distrito donde reside, junto con su esposo compran de caseríos aledaños para posteriormente ofrecerlo a mayor precio.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de tubérculos para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio y generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Nunjar Simona is 46 years old and lives with her partner and her child in a community in Morropon. The climate is warm there, and the people work in agriculture, business and animal husbandry.  It is located in the province of the same name, in the region of Piura, on the north cost of Perú. 

She works buying and selling yucca and has orders from the restaurants in the district where she lives, with her husband, she purchases them from nearby farmhouses and later sells them at a higher price. 

She has requested a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase a variety of tubers to to sell to her customers and, in this way, grow her business and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of tubers to offer her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise to open a small business.

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es:
Sixto tiene 60 años de edad, de estado civil casado, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo que viven El Caserío Cruz Verde, una zona rural del distrito de La Matanza, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, producción y comercio de limón, plátano, con la ayuda de su esposa cosechan cada temporada, son una familia unida que se esfuerzan por tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Sixto is 60 years old, married, and has 2 children in his care, who lives in El Caserío Cruz Verde, a rural zone in the La Matanza district. The people there work in agriculture, business and animal husbandry, and it is located in the Morropon province, which is part of the Piura region on the north coast of Perú. 

He works in agriculture, growing and selling lemons and bananas. With the help of his wife, he harvests every season.  They are a close family that works hard to have a better quality of life.

He has asked for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase fertilizer to maintain his crops.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to maintain his crops.

loans.name: Wenkame

texts.fr:
Depuis de 2003, Veuve Wenkame prépare et vend du fromage de soja associé à la restauration de la boule d’akassa. Agée de 45 ans, elle a trois enfants en charge et est obligée de travailler sept jours sur sept et de s’approvisionnée trois fois dans le mois pour être à la hauteur des charges domestiques trop coûteuse. 
Pour ce crédit qu’elle sollicite, elle va augmentée son stock de grain de soja et de maïs à 2 sacs supplémentaires ainsi elle réduira les coûts du transport lié approvisionnement et maximiser son profit.
texts.en:
Since 2003, Wenkame, who is a widow, sells soya bean curd, this is sold in catering establishments with akassa (a thick cornmeal porridge).  She is 45 years old and is responsible for three children.  This means that she must work seven days a week.  She replenishes her stocks three times a month in order to be able to cope with very high domestic expenses.

Wenkame plans to use her loan to increase her stock levels of soya beans and maize, by two extra sacks.  This will reduce her transport supply costs and improve her profits.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of soya beans and 2 sacks of maize.

loans.name: Victor Alfredo

texts.es:
Victor es una persona trabajadora, tiene 28 años de edad y vive en el Distrito de Santiago junto a su familia.
Tiene dos hijos quienes son su mayor orgullo y por quienes lucha constantemente para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
Desde hace varios años trabaja como ayudante en una empresa constructora y le va muy bien porque es una persona luchadora, responsable, con muchas ganas de salir adelante y sobre todo porque su mayor motivación es su familia.
Victor está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá remodelar su casa, como pintarrajear las paredes, arreglar el techo, también arreglar el piso y cambiar el sistema de seguridad de su vivienda para que de esta manera su familia pueda sentirse más cómoda y disfrutar de buenos momentos en familia en una ambiente agradable y seguro.
texts.en:
Victor is a hard-working person. He is 28 years old and lives in the district of Santiago with his family.

He has 2 children who are his greatest pride and for whom he fights constantly in order to be able to offer them a better quality of life.

For several years, he has worked as a helper in a construction business and it is going well for him because he is a determined, responsible person with great desire to get ahead and, above all, because his greatest motivation is his family.

Victor is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the help that they offer him, he will be able to remodel his house, such as paint the walls, fix the roof, and also fix the floor and change the security system on his house so that, in this way, his family can feel more comfortable and enjoy good family time in a friendly and safe environment.

loans.use: to remodel his house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy trays of eggs, maize and rice.

loans.name: Osmer Germain

texts.es:
Osmer Germain tiene 22 años de edad, vive en casa alquilada de material rustico, junto a su esposa e hija en el distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a prestar servicio de transporte en su mototaxi, desde hace un año, trasladando a sus pasajeros a zonas aledañas a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de llantas para su vehículo y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Osmer Germain is 22 years old and lives in a rented house made of rustic materials, along with his wife and daughter, in the district of Pucará. The people there work in agriculture, business and animal husbandry, and it is located in the province of Jaén which is part of the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Perú. 

He has worked providing a transportation service in his motorcycle taxi for a year, carrying passengers to nearby areas in his district. He has asked for a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase tires for his vehicle and in this way, generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es:
María Alicia tiene 24 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con un hijo a su cargo, en su casa propia en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral desde hace 4 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de cemento para el piso de su dormitorio.
texts.en:
María Alicia, 24, lives with her partner and has one child in her care.  She lives in her own home in the Oyotún district of Chiclayo Province, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.  The residents work in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

She has earned a living for four years raising and selling farm animals.  She runs her business out of her home.

María Alicia has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 500 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy cement for her bedroom floor.

loans.use: to buy cement for her bedroom floor

loans.name: Flor De Naranja Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE NARANJA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marcela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de queso, librería y fotocopiadora, servicio de construcción, agricultor, venta de rellenos, venta de salchipapas, venta de leche y queso.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marcela es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicia hace dos años al observar a una de sus amigas quien le enseñó la forma de venta de este producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para alimento en tiempo de sequía (compra verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el seguro de vida que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "FLOR DE NARANJA" communal association will begin its third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Copacabana, and is comprised of eight members and is directed by a board of officers, with Marcela as the president. The businesses that the group members run are varied and include: food sales, a neighborhood store, cheese sales, a bookstore and copy business, construction service, a farm, sales of stuffing, salchipapa (a kind of kebab) sales, and milk and cheese sales. 

The loan that they take out will benefit the small business owners of whom Marcela is a member. She states that two years ago she joined Pro Mujer, at the invitation of the institution's massive promotion. At the moment, she has a business selling food. She says that she began this business two years ago after observing one of her friends who taught her how to sell this product. 

The loan that they are taking out now is for food during the time of drought (purchasing vegetables in bulk) that she will get from the bulk sellers in the city of El Alto and after preparing them will sell them in her rented space. This work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she lives in a common-law marriage and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the life insurance that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Prosperidad Y Responsabilidad Group

texts.es: Esta es la Alcancía “Prosperidad Y Responsabilidad” la cual está conformada por 07 socios responsables y prósperos. Juana de 37 años es separada con 01 hijo. Hace más de 01 año que Juana se dedica al alquiler de cuartos. Con su ganancia Juana ha podido mejorar su vivienda beneficiando a más personas. El crédito que solicitó lo invertirá para la compra de pintura, brocha y lavatorio. El anhelo de Juana es mejorar las instalaciones de su vivienda para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. El grupo “Prosperidad  y Responsabilidad” agradecen por la ayuda brindada. Juana es la tercera del lado izquierdo, viste chaleco rojo.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Prosperidad y Responsabilidad” [Prosperity and Responsibility] and comprised of seven prosperous and responsible members. Juana, 37, is separated and has a son. She has been renting rooms for over a year and with the profits, she has been able to improve the services she provides.

She requested a loan to buy paint, paintbrushes and a sink. Her dream is to imiprove her property so that she can treat her customers better. The communal bank “Prosperidad y Responsabilidad” appreciates the help they are receiving. Juana is standing, third from left to right. She is wearing a red vest.

loans.use: to buy paint, paintbrushes and a sink.

loans.name: Njira

texts.en:
Njira is a widowed woman with six children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her biggest monthly expense is food.

Njira has operated a cereal-selling business at the market for the past year, selling to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan she wants to purchase sacks of maize, beans, rice, green grams, ground nuts and lentils. She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize, beans, rice, green grams, ground nuts and lentils.

loans.name: Manzanitas De Cohani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MANZANITAS DE COHANI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. El negocio al que pertenecen todos los integrantes de la Banca Comunal es el de lechería.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción y venta de leche; da a conocer que ella desea iniciar este negocio con este primer préstamo, ya que conoce la forma de venta que se debe realizar con este producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para alimento en tiempo de sequía (compra semillas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente a la elaboración le dará a sus amínales para la producción de leche. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el seguro de vida que ofrece la institución.
texts.en: Communal bank 'Manzanitas de Cohani' starts its first lending cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the focus centre of Copacabana. The group is comprised of eight members and presided by Juana as head of its bureau. All members raise milk cows. The loan will thus benefit small entrepreneurs. Juana says it is her first time working with Pro Mujer, an institution she learned of thanks to a massive promotional campaign it launched. Juana sells the milk her cows produce and wants to bolster her business with this first loan, which she will put to good use since she knows how to sell her product. She wants to buy seeds wholesale from sellers in her community, in order to grow feed against droughts, as a way to ensure her cows always produce milk. The income Juana derives from her business goes toward supporting her family, since she is in a civil union and has two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she mentions the life insurance policy offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy seeds wholesale.

loans.name: Jhony Fredy

texts.es:
Jhony es un joven emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, tiene 20 años de edad y vive en el Distrito de San Juan de Lurigancho junto a su familia. Desde hace casi 3 años tiene un negocio de venta de prendas de vestir, le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable, trabajadora, amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque ofrece productos de calidad al mejor precio.
Jhony está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han dado él podrá comprar mercadería para implementar el negocio y poder obtener más ingresos y con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación más adelante podrá cumplir su más grande sueño: "Estudiar una carrera profesional y abrir varias tiendas de ropa en Gamarra".
texts.en:
Jhony, 20, is a young entrepreneur who very much wants to get ahead.  He lives with his family in the district of San Juan de Lurigancho.

He has had a clothing business for three years.  It's going very well for him because he's a responsible and hardworking person who is friendly with the customers and, above all, sells quality products at the best price.

Jhony is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their help he'll be able to buy merchandise to help his business and earn more income.

With a lot of effort and dedication, later he'll be able to achieve his biggest dream: to study for a profession and open some clothing stores in Gamarra.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Las Siempre Amigas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS SIEMPRE AMIGAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Janneth es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: artesana en mantas, elaboración de mantas, venta de leche y carne de cerdo, servicio de transporte, panadería, venta de frutas.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Janneth es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicia hace dos años al aprender la forma de tejido, decide implementarlo como medio de generación económica.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para alimento en tiempo de sequía (compra lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el seguro de vida que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Las Siempre Amigas” [Friends Forever] will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the regional office of Achachi. It is comprised of eight members and directed by a board where Janneth is the president. The members have different businesses: blankets sales, milk and pork sales, transport services, a bakery and fruits sales.

This loan will help micro entrepreneurs such as Janneth. She says that this is the first time she works with Pro Mujer. She was invited to join by a friend who was already a client. She currently works weaving blankets. She says that she started this business two years ago when she learned how to weave and decided to start making money with that knowledge.

She is requesting a loan to buy wholesale wool from the wholesalers at the city of El Alto. She will make the blankets and sell them in her stall. With this activity, she receives an income that helps her to support her family. She lives in a common-law marriage and has a son.

When asked what she likes the most about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the life insurance policy offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy wholesale wool to make blankets.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Mère d’un enfant Kossiwa est âgée 30 ans, elle est mariée et vie en location dans le quartier Agoe à Lomé capitale du Togo. Depuis 2011, elle vend des gâteaux communément appelés en langue locale Africa-tennis, qu’elle prépare à domicile. Elle est ambulante dans les quartiers Atchavé, zogbédji et autres, tous des quartiers environnants. Son fond de roulement ne l’a permet pas de préparer une quantité importante de gâteaux suffisante pour satisfaire un grand nombre de client.
Pour résoudre ce problème Kossiwa sollicite un crédit pouvant lui permettre d'acheter 4 sacs de farines de blé pour sa transformations.
texts.en: Kossiwa is a 30-year-old married mother with one child. She lives in rented accommodation in the Agoe District of Lomé, the capital of Togo. Since 2011, she has been selling cakes, which are commonly called "Africa-Tennis" cakes in the local language, which she prepares at home. She sells these cakes on foot throughout the districts of Atchavé and Zogbédji, as well as in other surrounding areas. Her lack of working capital prevents her from making large enough quantities of these cakes to satisfy her great many customers. In order to solve this problem, Kossiwa is requesting a loan which will allow her to purchase four sacks of wheat flour to make her cakes.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy canned food and bread.

loans.name: Iris Yaneth

texts.es: Doña Iris, tiene 52 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene cuatro hijos, y reside con una nieta en una aldea del municipio de Puerto Cortes. Ella tiene su propio negocio de una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar, como ser arroz, azúcar, manteca, pan, huevos, condimentos, churros, refrescos, frijoles etc. este negocio lo tiene hace 10 años y lo ha mantenido estable mediante la inversión de varios prestamos. Con el fin de crecer en ventas y clientes ha solicitado otro préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para surtir de productos como manteca, azúcar, frijoles, huevos, pan, arroz, productos de limpieza, condimentos etc. Su plan es seguir creciendo con el negocio y ayudar a su nieta.
texts.en: Doña Iris is 52 years old. She is the single mother of four children and lives with her granddaughter in a village outside Puerto Cortes. She has her own grocery store where she sells staple goods such as rice, sugar, butter, bread, eggs, condiments, churros, soft drinks, beans, and so on. She has had this business for ten years and invested a number of loans in it to keep it going. To increase her sales and customer base, she has requested another loan of 15,000 lempiras to stock products such as butter, sugar, beans, eggs, bread, rice, cleaning supplies, condiments, and so on. Her plan is to keep growing the business and help her granddaughter.

loans.use: to stock products such as butter, sugar, beans, eggs, bread, rice, cleaning supplies, condiments, and so on.

loans.name: Gidah

texts.en:
Gidah lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is single with four children and two of them go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells charcoal. She operates her business on a retail basis and works at the market six days a week. She has been in this business for one year. She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal for sale. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations are to see her business grow bigger to start selling to villages for charcoal and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. 

Gidah resides in a rented a house, and the family has access to electricity and no piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Villa Totorani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VILLA TOTORANI” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Adelia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción de queso, crianza de ganado, producción de papa, servicio de construcción, artesanía.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Adelia es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción y venta de queso; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia, ya que desde niño ella apoyo a su familia y por ello conocía este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de vaca lechera) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de  su comunidad y posteriormente lo criará en su estancia. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y el crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
Villa Totorani Communal Bank will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya Regional Office.  The bank is made up of eight members governed by a board of directors of which Adelia is the president.  The bank members carry out a variety of businesses, including cheese production, growing potatoes, construction services, and handicrafts.

The loan they're getting will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Adelia.  She said this is her second year as a member of Pro Mujer, having joined on the invitation of a friend from the institution who visited her at home.  Currently she has a business making and selling cheese, which she started on her own initiative because she had helped her family in the business from a young age.

Adelia's loan is to increase her capital by buying a dairy cow, which she'll get from the wholesale vendors in her community and then raise on her farm.  This job allows her to earn income to support her family, because she's married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says the savings and the loans the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy charcoal and seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru:
Саломат 35-летняя вдова из района Шахритус. Она трудолюбивая сельская женщина, занимающаяся растениеводством. Саломат не имеет высшего образования. Она как и многие сельские жители занимается посевом и сбором урожаев. Ей помогают ее дети, которые для нее в этой жизни являются опорой и поддержкой. Саломат выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры на протяжении 10 лет. Она продолжает ремесло своего отца. 
Саломат сейчас нуждается в кредите. Ей необходимо закупить минеральные удобрения, чтобы обработать посевы. Она нуждается в вашей финансовой поддержке.
texts.en:
Salomat is a 35-year-old widow from the Shahrituz district. She is a hard-working farmer who plants crops in a rural region. She does not have a higher education. Like many residents of the village, she plants and harvests crops. Her children, who are her comfort and support, help her on the farm. She has been a farmer for over ten years, continuing her father's work.

Now Salomat needs a loan. She needs to buy mineral fertilizers for her crops. She needs your financial support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Jose Antono

texts.es: Don José Antonio, es periodista y labora como publicista, su familia la conforman su esposa y sus dos hijos quienes estudian la secundaria y universidad, para el es muy importante la educación de sus hijos por lo que los apoya incondicionalmente, José Antonio requiere el crédito para comprar materiales y poder realizar canal de desagüe el cual es muy necesario en estas temporadas de lluvia, comprara pintura, puerta y verja para ir acondicionando su hogar dando una mejor apariencia física.
texts.en: Don José Antonio is a journalist and works as a publicist. His family is made up of his wife and his two children, who are in high school and college. His children's education is very important to him, so he supports them unconditionally. José Antonio needs this loan to buy materials so he can install a drainage channel, which is urgently needed during the rainy season. He will buy paint, a door, and window bars to improve his home and its appearance.

loans.use: buy paint, a door, window bars, and sheet metal for a drainage channel.

loans.name: Valle Hermoso Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VALLE HERMOSO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mónica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de salteñas, taller de tapicería, taller de carpintería, venta de ropa interior, venta de api, venta de pescado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mónica es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de coca; da a conocer la afiliación al sector cocalero lo adquirió recientemente, sin embargo ella apoyaba a su madre en este mismo negocio. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de coca por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas del departamento de La paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Valle Hermoso village bank is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana regional office. The group has eight members, and Mónica is the president of the board of directors. The members of the group earn their living in a variety of ways, including upholstery, carpentry, and selling food, lingerie, api (a nonalcoholic drink made from corn), food, and fresh fish.

This loan will help these microentrepreneurs. Mónica notes that this is the first time she has been part of Pro Mujer, which she joined at the invitation of an acquaintance who is a member of the institution. She currently has a business selling coca leaves. She says that she has recently joined the coca industry, but she helped her mother in the business when she was younger. 
 
She will use this loan for working capital to buy coca leaves from wholesalers in La Paz and then sell them in her business. This business helps her bring in an income to support her family, since she is unmarried and has a son.  

When we ask her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the professional development it offers.

loans.use: to buy coca leaves at wholesale.

loans.name: Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HORMIGUITAS” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Karina es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: elaboración de canastas, venta de ropa, venta de coca, tejido de macramé de mantas, costura de mochilas, tienda de barrio, servicio de transporte.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Karina es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  costura y venta de ropa; da a conocer que la técnica de costura la aprendió de su hermano hace tres años atrás y la estrategia de venta la aprendió de su madre, ya que desde niña apoyaba en su negocio. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en: The Communal Association “HORMIGUITAS” will start its fifth loan cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Panamericana. It is composed of eight members and is led by a board, where Karina is the treasurer. The members of the communal association work in different businesses such as: production of baskets, sale of clothes, sale of coca, knitting blankets in macrame, sewing backpacks, a grocery store, transportation services.  The loan will be used to help small enterprising women, being Karina a member of it. She says that she has been part of Pro Mujer for a year. She joined the group after being invited by a friend, who is a member of the institution. Currently she has a business of sewing and selling clothes. She learned a sewing technique from her brother three years ago and she learned sales strategy from her mother, because since she was a young girl she helped her in her business. The loan she is requesting now will pay for increasing capital (buying fabric at wholesale prices) that she will get from the wholesale sellers of the city of El Alto. After production she will sell it in her place of sale. This way of work will allow her to generate resources to support her family since she is single. When they ask her what she likes from Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the area of health offered by the institution.

loans.use: To buy fabric at wholesale prices

loans.name: Por Un  Futuro Mejor Group

texts.es: Efraín, tiene 58 años de edad, es casado, tiene 4 hijos, vive en un sector que pertenece al municipio de San Pedro Sula. Toda su vida la ha dedicado a la agricultura, cultiva café, rábano, cilantro, zanahoria, maíz, frijol etc. La producción es vendida en el mercado local y obtiene sus ingresos. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras en forma grupal para fertilizar, abonar y limpiar la finca de café, con el propósito de darle el mejor mantenimiento a su cultivo, para que su familia tenga una vida mejor y sus hijos logren estudiar. El grupo se llama Por un Futuro Mejor, integrado por 8 personas que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a realizar actividades agrícolas. Cada uno solicita 10,000 lempiras haciendo un total de 80,000 Lempiras de préstamo. En la foto se encuentra Jaime a la izquierda, luego Yensy, Efraín, Adelmo, Erick, Ramón, Carlos y José a la derecha.
texts.en: Efraín is 58 years old. He is married and has four children, and he lives in San Pedro Sula. He has been a farmer his whole life. He grows coffee, radishes, cilantro, carrots, corn, beans, and other crops. He sells his products at the local market and so earns an income. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 lempiras as part of a group loan. He will use it to fertilize and improve his coffee farm so his crop will grow better. That way, his family will have a better life and his children will be able to go to school. The group is called Por un Futuro Mejor (For a Better Future). It has eight members who live in the same community and are all farmers. Each one is requesting 10,000 lempiras, making the loan 80,000 lempiras in total. In the photo from left to right are Jaime, Yensy, Efraín, Adelmo, Erick, Ramón, Carlos, and José.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, and weed his coffee farm.

loans.name: Floristas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLORISTAS” iniciará el vigésimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lourdes es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de guantes, costura de gorras, venta de ropa de bebe, venta de mochilas, venta de helados, venta de coca.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lourdes es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de ropa; da a conocer que la venta de este producto lo aprendió de su madre, desde niña, es por ello que decide independizarse y emprender un negocio propio. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de las fronteras Bolivia - Chile y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el trato que ofrece la institución
texts.en:
Floristas Communal Bank will start its twenty-second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Regional Office.  It's made up of nine members governed by a board of directors of which Lourdes is the president.  The bank members carry out a variety of businesses, including clothing sales, glove sales, making hats, baby clothing sales, backpack sales, ice cream sales, and coca sales.

The loan they're getting will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Lourdes.  She said she has been a member of Pro Mujer for three years, having joined on the invitation of a friend who's a client of the institution.  Currently she has a business selling clothing, which she learned from her mother from a young age.  She decided to go out on her own and start her own business.

Lourdes will use her loan to increase her capital by buying clothing, which she'll get from the wholesale vendors on the Chile and Bolivia borders and later sell in her sales stall.  This form of work allows her to generate income to support her family, because she's single and has three children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says the institution's trainings and treatment.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Mujeres Emprendedoras” conformado por 07 socias responsables y dinámicas. Teresa de 52 años de edad  es soltera. Ella se dedica  a la venta de productos de belleza.  Gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado  salir adelante. Su mayor anhelo es de poder instalar un espacio donde pueda ofrecer sus productos de belleza. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de desodorantes, colonias y perfumes. El grupo “Mujeres Emprendedoras” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por hacer posible este crédito. Teresa es la segunda del lado izquierdo, viste chaleco plomo y polo de color rosado.
texts.en:
This is the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” group, made up of 7 responsible and dynamic members.

Teresa is 52 years old and is single. She makes a living selling beauty products. Thanks to her hard work she has managed to make progress in life. Her main dream is to be able to open an outlet where she can sell her beauty products.

She is asking for the loan to buy deodorants, colognes and perfumes.

The "Mujeres Emprendedoras" group thanks the Kiva lenders for making this loan possible.

Teresa is the second from the left in the photo, in the grey waistcoat and pink top.

loans.use: to buy deodorant, colognes and perfumes.

loans.name: Wilman Alfonso

texts.es: Wilman de 45 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de carne de res y de ave. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en un municipio cercano a la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde habita con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijas en las edades de 4 y 6 años. Su familia ha estado toda la vida en el comercio de carne vacuna y avícola; esto llevó a  willman a aprender  de esta experiencia y continuar finalmente, un trabajo independiente,  que conservó su tradición, y que inició desde hace 20 años.  Sus ventas las realiza en su propia comunidad, donde existen muchas tiendas y familias que le compran directamente de contado, y sus metas  están relacionadas con mejorar la imagen de su negocio y aumentar su calidad de vida , aunque su mayor desafío es lograr fuentes de financiación para hacer inversiones oportunas . Esta es la razón por la cual está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará especialmente carne de res y pechuga por libras, con lo que logrará aumentar sus ventas e impulsar su bienestar y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Wilman, 45, sells beef and poultry. He works close to the city of Barranquilla, where he lives with his wife and two daughters aged 4 and 6. His family has always worked selling beef and poultry, which is why Wilman learned this activity and was able to work independently. He started this business twenty years ago and was able to continue with the family’s tradition. His customers are local families and businesspeople who pay him in cash. His goals are to improve the reputation of his business and his living conditions. His biggest challenge is to find sources of financing in order to be able to make timely investments.

This is why Wilman is requesting a CrediKiva, his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use it to buy beef and chicken breasts by the pound. This will increase his sales and improve his and his family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy beef and poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food.

loans.name: Hyline

texts.en:
Even smallholder farmers based in deep rural villages in Kenya get that when you conserve water in water tanks, you are doing a big favor for the environment. Hyline, a mother of two, is a mixed farmer based in Nyamira, Kenya. She is seeking a loan to purchase a water tank that will be installed in her farm. After six years in farming, she has come to appreciate the use of water in her life. In one day, she uses water for domestic purposes, farming purposes and consumption. 

She believes saving rainwater in a water tank is an environmentally friendly way to prevent water wastage and to fully utilize the best of what nature has to offer. 

With your loan, Hyline will store water that will provide water for dairy animals and poultry consumption, gardening, cleaning, cooking, drinking and washing. The convenience of a water tank location will also spare Hyline’s energy for going to fetch water down the river. 

When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?" Hyline replied, "My family’s basic needs will easily be taken care of."

loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
The acquisition and installation of water tanks is certainly a dream come true for most of the rural smallholder farmers in Kenya. Vincent, a Juhudi Kilimo farmer, is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to get one.
 
Vincent lives in a rural town in Kenya known as Kisii. He is a father of two who has been practicing mixed farming for the last eight years. He enjoys milking and mixing manure. However, climate in the region has changed rapidly, leading to long dry spells. 

Vincent acknowledges that acquiring a water tank will be advantageous to him and the environment. “All I need is a water tank that matches my farm’s requirements, and I will start reaping the benefits almost immediately.”

The water will serve both domestic and farming purposes. Vincent’s family suffers through carrying water several trips a day over long distances during dry seasons. To Vincent, storing water in water tanks not only reduces their work for fetching, but also puts an end to the wastage that takes place when rain water simply drains away.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a smallholder farmer in Chuka, Kenya. He is a father of 3 who has been practising mixed farming for 12 years. He keeps dairy cows and poultry that produce milk and eggs for family consumption and sales. James also grows commercial crops and engages in personal businesses to boost his income. 

James is seeking a loan for purchasing a water tank, fertilizer and seeds. A water tank offers an effective water storage solution that is suitable for homes and farms in the deep rural regions of Kenya. Farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer are increasingly becoming expensive for poor farmers. Farmers are forced to skip crucial stages to save costs, leading to poor quality harvest, losses and food insecurity. 

With your loan, James is going to purchase a water tank that comes in a suitable size to accommodate his needs and uses. He will use the rest of the loan to purchase farm supplies for healthy and productive crops. Money generated as profits through this loan is already committed to his children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Maira Alejandra

texts.es: En muchas ocasiones cualquier persona que está acostumbrada al trabajo arduo, a la cotidianidad de una jornada laboral donde la monotonía de las labores llegan a aburrir en exceso a una persona pero María Alejandra una joven de tan solo 21 años de edad que debido a conflictos tuvo que huir de su hogar y reside actualmente en la casa de su novio donde un fuerte pensamiento la aquejaba diariamente y es que se quería sentir útil para su hogar aportar capital para progresar junto con su esposa y es por esta razón que decidió comenzar con un negocio de venta de hielo en bolsas, bolis (que son los productos que se observan en la nevera) y paletas ya que estos productos son muy tradicionales en barrios humildes donde el calor excesivo hace una invitación a consumir los productos, solicita un crédito para la compra de una nevera y materia prima para la elaboración se sus productos pues quiere recuperar en base al trabajo lo que un día el conflicto armado le quito.
texts.en: On many occasions, somebody who is used to working hard and to a daily, monotonous work routine can become bored. Maira Alejandra is just 21 years old and, due to the conflict in Colombia, had to leave her home. She is now living at her boyfriend's house; there she was always thinking that she wants to feel useful for her household. She wanted to to bring in an income in order to progress with her partner and so she decided to start her own business selling bags of ice, ice-pops (shown in the freezer in the photo) and ice-lollies, traditional products in poor barrios where the high temperatures bring people to buy them. Maira is applying for a loan in order to buy a freezer and basic supplies for preparing her products. Maira wants to take back the work that was taken from her by the armed conflict.

loans.use: to buy a fridge and supplies for making frozen products; Maira wants to earn back everything that she lost because of the armed conflict.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger is a Cameroonian aged 46. He is married with three children; the oldest is 12 and in secondary school, and the youngest is 1 year old. He has been in this business for over 11 years, which makes him very experienced and his business profitable. His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. 

This loan will be used to increase his turnover from 600,000 XAF to 900,000 XAF monthly.

loans.use: to buy used shoes for resale

loans.name: Juan Gabriel

texts.es: Juan u n hombre de tan solo 19 años de edad, el cual desde muy joven le inculcaron el valor de trabajo y es algo muy común que pasa en personas nacidas bajo un seno familiar campesino donde le inculcan que debe superarse cada día pero con trabajo y humildad y es por esta razón que poco a poco fue formalizando y creando su micro-empresa un establecimiento encargado en la comercialización de cerdos. Juan tiene un gran factor a favor y es su edad ya que tiene ideas e implementa estrategias de ventas frescas y siempre manteniendo la alegría para trabajar un factor que le ha ayudado a ganarse los clientes pues el solo carisma de su personalidad le da un aval para vender. Con el ánimo de progresar de cada ser mejor de poder competir en la zona Juan quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de cerdos pues quiere hacer crecer su número de activos para tener un mejor y mayor volumen de venta dado que apuesta por la prosperidad de su negocio encontrando en la perseverancia y humildad sus mejores armas para progresar
texts.en:
Juan is just 19 years old. From a young age, he was taught the value of work, something that is very common to those born into peasant families where everybody has to do better through their work and humility. For this reason, little by little, Juan created his own micro-business selling pigs. Juan has one great advantage, which is his age. He has ideas and applies new sales strategies. Juan is always happy in his work, which has helped him to find new customers. Juan's charisma helps him to sell his products. 

With a desire to progress and to be better and compete in the area. Juan is applying for a loan in order to buy pigs. Juan wants to increase his number of pigs and increase his stock in order to have a higher number of sales. Juan wants to prosper with his business: his perseverance and humility are his best weapons as he fights to progress in life.

loans.use: to buy pigs to increase his number of animals on sale; with more animals, Juan can sell them for a lower price.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah, a mother of 4, has been involved in the dairy business for 14 years. She owns dairy cows that produce milk daily for sale. Besides dairy, she also keeps poultry. When you visit her small farm, you will witness tea growing and a variety of vegetables. 

Norah is seeking a loan to construct a dairy cowshed. With your loan, she will be able to better manage her dairy farm to create more value. Every byproduct (dung/urine) of a cow can be sold or better yet, used on the farm. With a dairy unit, she can better feed her animals and collect the by-products, such as dung, to generate biogas fuel, make organic fertilizer and to plaster her hut. The money she will generate from this dairy unit will be reinvested back into the business to push growth. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?", Norah replied "Will build dairy shed which increase the productivity of my cow and relieve my stress."

For many of us, the idea of a dairy farm may evoke bucolic images of cows grazing peacefully on acres of green, rolling pastures. But the upcoming trend of Kenya, dairy production is making these images increasingly obsolete. In recent years, small pasture-based dairies have disappeared, their production replaced by confined animal feeding operations. This technique proves to be more profitable than traditional ways because of better feed management.

loans.use: To construct a cowshed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his children's education

loans.name: Trust In God Group

texts.en:
These members are part of Trust in God Group and are beginning their sixth loan cycle in ID-Ghana. The group is made up of five members and led by Lilly, the featured borrower. The members of the group run a variety of businesses including materials, kenkey (boiled corn paste) and fish, detergents and sachet water. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit small micro-businesses, including Lilly's. She states that she joined ID-Ghana three years ago at the invitation of a relative who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a clothing materials sales business; she explains that she learned this business when she observed that the business was a big seller in the Accra market. That's why she decided to launch this business.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital for the purchase of clothing materials wholesale, which she will acquire from markets of the city of Accra. She will sell them door to door. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is a single mother of two children.

When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responded that she likes the loans, the savings, the health-related offerings, and the training that the institution provides.

loans.use: To purchase clothing materials wholesale, which she will acquire from markets of the city of Accra.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
For a second, suppose that you were a smallholder farmer based in a remote village in Kenya with no water supply. Now imagine how getting your farm equipped with a water tank can provide you with great benefits!

Sophia, a mother of six, is a mixed farmer based in Mathingira village. The weather in Mathingira is cool and dry. Sophia keeps dairy cows and poultry. She also grows horticultural crops.

Sophia is seeking a loan to purchase a water tank. Sophia’s most strenuous task is fetching water from a spring far from her farm. She rations water so that she can do so much with it, including cooking, bathing, washing and cleaning. The animals and plants on the farm need water, too, for consumption and gardening, respectively.

With your loan, Sophia can collect rainwater and substitute that for spring water and do a lot of cleaning, washing or gardening. The water tank will also help to preserve the availability of water, whose loss is most keenly felt during a drought.

Her family will greatly benefit from the convenience brought by the water tank.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: Pensamiento Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PENSAMIENTO II” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Yolanda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de carne, venta de productos varios, venta de verduras, venta de leche, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Yolanda es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  bordado de enaguas; da a conocer que la técnica de bordado la aprendió de su madre, ya que le apoyaba desde niña en su negocio. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela e hilos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas del departamento de La paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el trato que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Pensamiento II" communal bank will begin its first loan cycle through "Pro Mujer's" Panamericana branch office. The group has nine members and is run by a board of directors, which has Yolanda as its president. The members have different business, including selling meat, selling miscellaneous products, selling vegetables, selling milk, and a grocery store.

This loan will benefit small-business owners in Yolanda's group. Yolanda herself tells us that she joined "Pro Mujer" three years ago following an invitation from a friend who is a member of the organisation. Yolanda currently has a business selling embroidered products. She tells us that she learned to do embroidery from her mother, whom she helped with her business as a girl.

This loan will be used to increase capital by buying material and threads in bulk. She will buy these items from bulk sellers in the La Paz department of the country. She will later sell the goods at her sales point. This work allows Yolanda to earn an income in order to support her family; she has a partner and three children.

When asked what it is that she likes about "Pro Mujer", Yolanda tells us that she likes the training and deals offered by the organisation.

loans.use: to buy material and threads in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for his son’s education.

loans.name: Mt Usambara Group

texts.en:
Josephine, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children who are still at school. She has two jobs- she is a tailor and a shoe seller. She has been in her business for five years now. She works from 7am to 9pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Josephine's 15th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.
