She used the previous loans to add a tailoring machine, buy materials and sewing equipment,  and she also started shelling shoes for children, ladies, and men. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She is doing great and appreciates Kiva's support for their group. She used the profits to build two houses, pay school fees, and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to start selling shoes at wholesale prices. She dreams of owning a tailoring firm.

Josephine will share this loan with her loan group "Mt Usambara" which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start selling his shoes at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Mijgona

texts.ru: Мижгона бизнес-леди, проживающая в столице, в городе Душанбе. Она в возрасте 27 лет имеет мужа, сына, дочь и собственный торговый бизнес. Мижгона в 2009 году самостоятельно начала заниматься продажей одежды и уже 5 лет как ведет этот бизнес у себя дома. Она в основном продает женскую и детскую одежду. Ее клиентами являются ее соседи, родственники, знакомые, друзья и т.д. Ее товар быстро расходится, так как она знает толк в одеждах и покупает только качественную и удобную одежду. Сейчас Мижгоне необходимо привезти новый товар и для этой цели ей нужен кредит. Она хочет закупить сезонную женскую и детскую одежду. Этот кредит ей важен для продолжения своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Mijgona is a businesswoman who lives in Dushanbe, the capital city. At 27 she is married and has a son, a daughter, and her own retail business. In 2009 she began to sell clothing and has been running her business from home for five years. She sells women's and children's clothing. Her customers are her neighbors, relatives, acquaintances, friends, and so forth. Her clothing quickly sells out because she knows a lot about clothes and only buys high-quality, comfortable items. Now she needs a loan to purchase new seasonal clothing for women and children. This loan is important to her so that she can keep up her business.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal women's and children's clothing for resale

loans.name: Ilse Idania

texts.es:
La señora ILSE de 35 años de edad,  tiene tres  hijos que dependen de ella, es viuda , vive en casa de su padres , radica en la comunidad de san Lorenzo  al sur de Honduras, y se dedica desde hace 3 años  al negocio de venta de tortillas, abarrotería en general como frijoles, arroz, maíz, azúcar, manteca, frescos de todos los tamaños y sabores, la señora ILSE es una mujer madre soltera ya que a sus esposo fue atropellado por un vehículo y falleció ahora ella lucha por sus tres hijos con estos negocios y está saliendo adelante.
Doña Ilse está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña,  carne de pollo, arroz, condimentos, aceites, jugos, lácteos, embutidos y más,  con el apoyo del crédito ella saldrá adelante, es un cliente que solicita por primera vez el crédito.
Su sueño  tener su propia casa y mejorar su negocio.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2014.
texts.en: ILSE is 35 years old and has 3 children who are dependent on her. She is a widow and lives in the house of her parents in the community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. For the past 3 years she has been working selling tortillas and groceries in general like beans, rice, corn, sugar, lard, and drinks of all sizes and flavors. ILSE  is a single mother as her husband was struck by a vehicle and died. Now she has to fight for her three children with these businesses and get them ahead. ILSE is requesting a loan to buy corn, wood, chicken, rice, spices, oil, juices, dairy products, canned goods and others. With the help of the loan she will make progress. This is the first time she has requested a loan. Her dream is to have her own house and to improve her business.  San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2014.

loans.use: to buy corn, wood, chicken, rice, spices, oil, juices, dairy products and canned goods for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Danelia

texts.es:
Las gotas de lluvia traspasan el techo de la casa de Rosa, pues desde hace tiempo se ha ido deteriorando. Por otro lado, sus servicios higiénicos están dañados y desgastados, lo que hace de esta maestra de primaria preocuparse más por mejorar su calidad de vida. Rosa es madre soltera de 5 hijos independientes y colaboradora en la educación formal desde hace 28 años que logró conseguir su título en la carrera técnica, luego de sentirse motivada por el papá se sus hijos. 
Sus únicos ingresos son como maestra, algunas remesas de una hija que vive en España y la ayuda económica de algunos de sus otros hijos. En estos momentos, Rosa solicita de un préstamo para reparar su servicio higiénico: el baño, el lavadero y el inodoro. En sus próximos planes también está reparar o cambiar el techo de su casa, para poder cumplir con sus metas de regalarse a ella misma una verdadera calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Drops of rain come through the roof of Rosa's house because it has been deteriorating for a long time.  On the other hand, her restroom is damaged and worn out, which worries this elementary school teacher more about improving her quality of life.

Rosa's the single mother of five adult children and collaborator in formal education for 28 years, since she managed to earn her degree in the field after feeling motivated by the father of her children.  Her only income is as a teacher, some remittances from a daughter who lives in Spain, and the financial help of some of her other children.

Rosa is currently requesting a loan to repair her restroom: the bathroom, sink, and toilet.

Her future plan is also to repair or change the roof of her house so she can achieve her goal of giving herself a real quality of life.

loans.use: to repair her bathroom

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more blood syrup, malarial drugs and pain tablets to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her son's education

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for her children’s education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wax cotton, lace and different kinds of clothing material to expand her business.

loans.name: Maria Pastora

texts.es:
Un quintal de arroz y otro de frijoles, fueron algunos de los primeros productos que le dieron la oportunidad a María de 48 años, salir adelante como comerciante en su propia pulpería hace 3 años, con el apoyo de $500 por parte de su esposo. A pesar de no poseer un título de bachiller, ya que llegó hasta cuarto año de secundaria, siempre ha buscado como seguir aprendiendo mediante sus trabajos. 
María Pastora es madre y modelo a seguir de tres hijos de las edades de 30, 25 y 22, todos independientes.  Afortunadamente, siempre ha tenido el soporte económico compartido con su esposo, lo que la hace sostenible. No obstante, ella quiere seguir creciendo hasta convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora, pero para ello necesita de un préstamo para invertir en el capital del trabajo. Comprar frijoles, arroz, verduras, sopas instantáneas, entre otros productos para ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes y así hacer crecer más su negocio, como siempre ha sido su meta.
texts.en:
One quintal of rice and another of beans were a few of the first products that gave the opportunity to María, who is 48 years old, to become a merchant. She opened her own small store 3 years ago with the support of $500 from her husband. Despite not have her Secondary school diploma, she did study until 4th year of secondary school and she has always tried to continue to learn through her work.

María Pastora is a mother and a role model for her 3 children, aged 22, 25 and 30, all of them independent. Unfortunately she has not always enjoyed the financial support shared with her husband which makes things sustainable. However she would like to continue to expand changing her store into a distribution center, but she needs a loan to invest in working capital. She will buy beans, rice, vegetables, instant soups amongst other products to offer a greater variety of products to her clients. She wants to expand her business which has always been her goal.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, vegetables, instant soups, amongst other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sticks for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Ep Neema Group

texts.fr: Le client Mutsopi est un homme d’affaires, président et membre d’une plate forme «EP Neema», entrepreneur, âgé de 37 ans, marié et père de 8 enfants, dont 4 scolarisés et 4 autres n’ont encore débuté les études. Il est vendeur divers articles et sociétaire d’une quincaillerie. Il étale ses business dans un centre commercial de la ville. Il sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Il va acheter  divers matériels de plomberie et construction (tuyaux, vannes, clous, câbles, tôles etc.). Il avait débuté avec de fonds reçu de son salaire, quand il fut enseignant. Dans l’avenir, il souhaite progresser dans son business construire une maison, scolariser, nourrir  ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien aux entrepreneurs gagnes petits exclus du système bancaire classique, tout en leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle.
texts.en: Mutsopi is a businessman and the leader of the "Ep Neema" platform. The 37-year-old entrepreneur is married and the father of 8 children, 4 of whom attend school and 4 of whom have not started school yet. He sells various items and is the member of a hardware store. He displays his merchandise in the town's commercial centre. He is requesting a loan from Hekima so that he can increase his business. He will buy plumbing and construction supplies (pipes, valves, nails, cables, metal sheets etc.). He started his business using money from the salary he got when he was a teacher. In the future, he wants to go further with his business, build a house and feed and educate his children. He thanks Hekima for its support of small entrepreneurs excluded from classic banking channels, and for awarding loans which do not involve material guarantees.

loans.use: to buy plumbing and construction supplies (pipes, valves, nails, cables, metal sheets etc.).

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm nuts.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
José es una persona muy trabajadora honesta y responsable, vive en un departamento al  sur de Honduras junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Su negocio es  un taller de soldadura  ubicada en una zona estratégica por eso es bastante frecuentada por sus vecinos y personas que transitan por ahí a diario.
El está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de un compresor que necesita  para  su negocio. El espera que el préstamo lo beneficie para así contar con esa herramienta que es muy necesaria para atender a sus clientes de esta manera los atenderá mejor y con esto aumentar sus ventas de igual manera, generar un poco más ingresos que beneficien el estilo de vida de la familia en el hogar.
Don José espera que en unos años sus negocio crezca y sea el más conocido de la comunidad y con esto seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que terminen sus estudios para que sean personas de bien y  tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.

Choluteca, Honduras – Mayo del 2013
texts.en:
José is a hard-working, honest and responsible person who lives in a Department in the south of Honduras with his wife and two children. His business is a welding shop which is located in a strategic area as it is traveled by his neighbors and people in transit daily.

He is requesting a loan to buy a compressor which he needs for his business. He hopes that the loan will benefit his business as with this tool he can attend to clients in a better way. By doing this he will increase his sales and generate a little more income that will benefit the family's lifestyle. Jose hopes that in the next few years his business will grow and that it becomes better known in the community. He wants to continue to support his children so that they complete their studies and become good people who have more opportunities in life. Choluteca, Honduras – May 2013

loans.use: to buy a compressor for his workshop.

loans.name: Jose Jesus

texts.es:
El Señor Jesús vive en santa cruz de Yojoa un municipio al norte de santa cruz él es una persona muy trabadora muy responsable con sus compromisos, está casado y don Jesús se ha hace cargo de los gastos de la casa tiene ya muchos años de estar en el negocio de la barbería es una persona muy conocida y respetada en su aldea. Se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy dinámica, luchadora y muy trabajadora que ha sabido salir adelante con su esfuerzo su dedicación y sus ganas de tener una mejor vida.
Don Jesús  brinda sus servicios en toda la aldea de Yojoa el cuenta con una clientela permanente ya que él tiene mucha preferencia dentro de los clientes ya que solo hay dos barberías en la aldea, el atiende todos los días el Sr. Jesús necesita el préstamo para comprar de una silla porque él necesita tener más sillas para la mejor atención a sus clientes 
Don Jesús  espera que con este préstamo pueda comprar una silla eléctrica de mejor calidad para así poder darle una mejor atención a los clientes  así seguir creciendo ya que su sueño es tener la mejor barbería dentro de la aldea de Yojoa.

Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras – Abril 2014
texts.en:
Jesús lives in Santa Cruz de Yojoa, a municipality north of Santa Cruz. He is a very hardworking person who is very responsible with his commitments. He is married, and Jesús is responsible for the household expenses.

He has been in the barber shop business for many years, and is a very well-known and respected person in his town. He has been described as being a very dynamic, determined and hardworking person, who has known how to get ahead through his effort, dedication, and desire to have a better life.

Jesús offers his services in the whole town of Yojoa. He has a permanent clientele, because he is highly preferred among customers, since there are only two barber shops in town. He works everyday.

Jesús needs the loan to buy a chair, because he needs more chairs to better attend to his customers. He hopes that with this loan, he can buy a better quality electric chair to be able to give his customers better attention and thus continue to grow. His dream is to have the best barbershop in the town of Yojoa.

Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras – April 2014

loans.use: to buy a new chair for his barber shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food containers, cups, and knives to expand her business.

loans.name: Kasozi Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Forty-five-year-old Johnson sells a local brew (waragi) in Hoima, Uganda. He is married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of nine children, all of whom go to school. His business is supplemented by farming and a produce business. He hopes to to invest the surplus in home development. Transportation hinders provision of his delivery service to clients, thus reduces sales. He is acquiring a loan to buy more of the local brew (waragi) to sell.

Johnson is a member of Kasozi Village Bank, where members guarantee each other to access a loan.

loans.use: to buy more of the local brew (waragi) to sell.

loans.name: Carmen Del Rosario

texts.es:
Al entrar a la casa de Carmen, una vitrina con diversos productos como ropa, aretes, cintillos, sandalias y collares, adornan el lugar. Sin embargo, para esta señora de 52 años con una sonrisa que toca el corazón de todos, también vende comida, pues ella siempre ha visto cómo seguir trabajando por su cuenta, desde hace 30 años, a pesar de haber llegado a tan solo primer año de secundaria y ser madre soltera de cuatro hijos, ahora independientes.
A pesar que para Carmen el dinero siempre ha sido limitado, siempre ha buscado cómo trabajar para salir adelante. Fue así cómo empezó todo, con el ahorro de las propinas cuando vendía paletas heladas de Eskimo cuando tenía 22 años. Sus hijos siempre han sido su soporte, ellos le mandan remesas o la ayudan en el negocio. Por el momento necesita de un préstamo para seguir creciendo, comprar plátanos para freírlos y venderlos en la comida, aceite para cocinar, ropa, collares y sandalias para vender, pues su meta es seguir creciendo. Entre sus planes principales está, poner un restaurante.
texts.en:
Upon entering Carmen's house, a display case with a variety of products (such as clothing, earrings, hairbands, sandals, and necklaces) adorns the place.  Nevertheless, this 52-year-old woman whose smile touches everyone's heart also sells food.  She has always been able to keep on working on her own, for 30 years, despite having finished only the first year of secondary school and being the single mother of four children, now adults.

Despite the fact that money has always been limited for Carmen, she has always looked for ways to get ahead.  That was how she started everything, with savings from her tips when she sold Eskimo-brand ice-cream bars when she was 22.  Her children have always been her support: They send her remittances or help her in her business.

At the moment she needs a loan to buy plantains to fry and sell; oil for cooking; and clothing, necklaces, and sandals to sell.  Her goal is to keep on growing.

One of her main plans is to start a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy plantains, oil, clothing, necklaces, and sandals

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Jose Noel

texts.es:
El joven Noel es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es un taller de vidriería y valconeria, desde hace  15 años, la cual funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de materiales como lamina troquelada, electrodos, vidrios, aluminio, platinas, llavines, tubo industrial y mallas, y así seguir  realizando su trabajo; el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos. Con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten considerablemente, y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los materiales necesarios para cubrir los pedidos y trabajos solicitados por sus clientes a diario, y gracias a esto poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar.
Noel espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.
Choluteca, Honduras – Mayo  del  2014
texts.en:
Noel is a hard-working and responsible young man who lives with his family in a community in the south of Honduras. He has had a workshop for 15 years doing glassmaking and producing iron railings. This is based in his home in the town where he lives. 

He needs the loan to buy materials such as die-cut sheets, electrodes, glass, aluminium, plates, latch keys, industrial tubing and mesh so he can continue with his work, which provides a major part of his income. With the loan he hopes his sales will increase considerably and the loan will help him a lot, since he does not have the necessary materials to cover the orders and jobs requested by his customers on a daily basis. With the help of the loan he will be able to improve his family's quality of life by increasing his household income.

In the short term Noel hopes to grow his business and so continue supporting his family, as well as making sure his children get the necessary education so they can have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – May 2014

loans.use: to buy materials such as die-cut sheets, electrodes, glass, aluminium, plates, latch keys, industrial tubing and mesh for his business.

loans.name: Zeka Women Group

texts.en:
Benadetta, raising her hand in the photo, is a member of Zeka Women Group. She is 30 years old with two children. Her first child is in primary school while the other has yet to start school. She is married and lives with her extended family.

Benadetta operates a kiosk with her husband where she sells goods like flour, sugar, cooking oil, milk and other household items. She opened this kiosk after receiving Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training where she acquired skills on table banking and enterprise management.

In 2013, she borrowed KSH 10,000 (Kenyan shillings) through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa's (HiH EA's) Enterprise Incubation Fund (EIF) to boost her kiosk business and completed repaying this loan in June 2014. She is taking a Kiva loan to continue to expand her business.

She is happy about HIH EA because she says the training has helped her gain business knowledge. She hopes the Kiva loan will also boost her business the way the previous EIF loan helped her.

Benadetta is grateful for the Kiva loan and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for the kiosk

loans.name: Zeka Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Agusta, a member of Zeka Women Group. She is married and has eight children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from training courses on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her improve her knowledge in business management.

Her economic activity is dairy farming. She needs a loan to buy higher-quality fodder for her cows. This will increase their milk production and help Agusta keep up with the increased demand for milk in Limuru. She hopes this will increase her level of income in order to continue supporting her family and in the long run improve their living conditions. 

 Agusta is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To purchase fodder for dairy cows.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Marié et père de quatre enfants, Kodjo habite le quartier Bè et a 42 ans, il fut électricien de 1992-1997 suite à un accident il devient handicapé moteur. Miroitier de 1998-2001, faute de moyens financiers, il cessa ce commerce. En 2007 grâce au financement d’une institution de la place il se lance dans la vente de pièces détachées pour engins tricycle et réparation de tricycle à moteur.
Pour répondre aux besoins du marché et suit à son adhésion à une association de prise en charge des personnes handicapés il sollicite un  financement pour augmenter son stock de pièces détachées.
texts.en:
A married father of four children, Kodjo lives in the Bè district and is 42 years old. He was an electrician from 1992 to 1997. And then, following an accident, he became physically disabled. A seller of mirrors from 1998 to 2001, he dropped this business due to a lack of financial means. In 2007, thanks to financing from a local institution, he got started selling spare parts for 3-wheeled vehicles and repairing their motors. 

To respond to the needs of the market, and after joining an association for care of the disabled, he is requesting financing to increase his stock of spare parts.

loans.use: to purchase tires, inner tubes, roller chains, and drum bearings

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
As a married parent with two children, Regina, 30 years old, works hard to support her family. She has a grocery business in Limuru, Kenya. Regina is taking a loan to purchase and add more stock to her grocery business, which she has been operating for the last two years. She has gained a good number of customers through her enterprise. With this loan, she hopes that her business will go a long way in helping increase her level of income, supporting her family, and improving their overall living standards.

Regina is very happy for Kiva and the support of its lenders.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her grocery business

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photograph is Priscila. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2012 to learn more skills on enterprise development and financial management. She is a 31-year-old mother with one son, married and living with her husband. She has been a teacher for over two years, and currently teaches 20 kindergarten children. Besides that, Priscila owns a kiosk. She has applied for a loan to help add stock to her kiosk since the demand for products is high. She says the loan will help improve her business, thus generating more income to support her family.

Priscila is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for this help and support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her kiosk

loans.name: Women Of Faith  Victory Group

texts.en:
In 2014, Women of Faith Victory Group from a small village in Limuru joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to enhance their knowledge in saving and enterprise development in order to improve their lives. The group is involved in 'merry-go-round' and table banking and also farming activities.

The person raising her hand is Mary. She is 60 years old, married and living with two of the five children she is blessed with. She is involved in selling handbags and perfumes. She also does poultry farming, which she started 10 years ago. Her businesses have expanded, and she wants to buy more chicken feed and additional handbags and perfumes.

This loan will enable her to purchase additional stock and hence meet the growing demand for eggs, chicken, handbags and perfumes in Limuru. Mary plans to use profits from her businesses to support her family and improve their living standards.

Both members in this group are happy and grateful to Kiva and for the support they will get from their lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of chicken feed, handbags and perfumes to grow her businesses

loans.name: Katy Yanet

texts.es:
La señora  Yaneth  de 26  años de edad  vive con su esposo en su casa de habitación, se dedica al negocio que es la venta de golosinas sus ventas son de lunes a domingo por la mañana y por la tarde, frente de su casa de habitación, además de vender golosinas también elabora buzos y camisetas colegiales.
Doña Yaneth mantiene contrato  con los diferentes quinderes, escuelas y colegios del municipio, se dedica a su negocio desde hace 6 años, sus clientes son todo los amigos y vecinos de su aldea, su negocio esta ubicado en el municipio de amapala al sur de honduras.
Esta solicitando 20, 000.00 lempiras para compra  de materiales de construcción como cemento, varilla, ladrillos, arena, grava, alambre dulce y mano de obra para mejorar su vivienda. Y Con las ganancias y el apoyo de este préstamo  Doña Yaneth desea salir adelante y mejorar su vivienda.
Su sueño es  un construir su vivienda.
San Lorenzo, Honduras – Mayo 2014
texts.en:
Yaneth is 26 years old and lives with her husband in their house in the municipality of Amapala in the south of Honduras. She works in her business selling sweets in front of her house. She works from Monday to Sunday in the mornings and afternoons. Besides selling sweets she also makes school coats and t-shirts. Yaneth keep in contact with various kindergartens, primary and secondary schools in her municipality. She has been in business for 6 years and her clients are her friends and neighbors in her community.

She is requesting 20,000 HNL to buy construction materials like cement, re-bar, bricks, sand, gravel, wire and to pay for labor to make improvements on her house. Yaneth wants to continue to progress and improve her house. her dream is to build her house. San Lorenzo, Honduras – May 2014

loans.use: to buy cement, re-bar, bricks, sand, gravel, wire and to pay for labor to make improvements on her house.

loans.name: Cruz Del Sur Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CRUZ DEL SUR” iniciará el décimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Paulina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de accesorios de autos, llantería, costura de deportivos, venta de comida, venta de leche, venta de salchipapa, producción de sombreros.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Paulina es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de repuestos de autos; da a conocer que la venta de este producto lo aprendió de su familia y cuando decide establecer una familia emprenden este negocio con el apoyo de su esposo. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de repuesto de autos) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Cruz del Sur" is starting its 10th loan cycle with Pro Mujer.  They meet in the Santiago II central office.  This group has 8 members, and is led by a board of directors where Paulina is the President.  The members of this group have a variety of businesses, including: selling automotive accessories, tire shop, sewing sports clothes, selling food, selling milk, selling sausages with potatoes, and making hats.  This loan will benefit all of the small business-people in Paulina's group.  

Paulina states that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for 5 years.  She joined at the invitation of a friend who is also a member of the institution.  Paulina currently has a business selling auto parts.  She learned this business from her family, and when she decided to establish her own family she started up this business with the support of her husband. She will use this loan to increase her capital (buying auto parts).  She will buy these parts from the wholesale traders and later sell them from her sales post.  By working in this way, she is able to generate resources to support her family, as she has a husband and 3 children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Paulina responded that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy auto parts

loans.name: Hodalo

texts.fr:
Hodalo, âgée de 39 ans, vit dans le quartier d’Agoe à Lomé. Depuis 2009, elle prépare et vend du fromage de soja ce qui lui permet de participer conjointement avec son mari aux dépenses liées au foyer. Mère d’un enfant avec deux autres personnes en charge, Hodalo doit encore redoubler d’effort pour être à la hauteur des charges.
Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter quatre sacs de soja dans le but de les transformer en fromage pour sa commercialisation et ainsi accroître ses revenus.
texts.en:
Hodalo, aged 39, lives in the Agoe district in Lomé. Since 2009, she has been making and selling tofu. This enables her to help her husband to cover household expenses. A mother of one child and with two other to support, Hodalo must still redouble her efforts to meet her responsibilities. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase 4 sacks of soybeans with the goal of processing them into tofu to sell, so as to grow her revenues.

loans.use: to purchase 4 sacks of soybeasn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase caustic soda and palm oil expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plastic wares and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase rice, yams, corn, condiments, and vegetable oil

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase corn, rice, cloth, and condiments.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, who lives in Uganda, Kampala, is a single mother of two children, both of whom go to school. She also takes care of her elderly mother. Rose resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.  

For the last 10 years, Rose has been selling sweet bananas and milk on a retail basis at the market six days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

Rose has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 500,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bunches of sweet bananas and cans of milk. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler of sweet bananas and milk and to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of sweet bananas and cans of milk.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase staple foods (corn, beans, etc.)

loans.name: Unión Libertad Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIÓN Y LIBERTAD” iniciará el trigésimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mary es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de faldas, venta de regalos, venta de fruta, servicio de internet, servicio de fotocopiadora, macramé de mantas, venta de salchipapas, venta de masitas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mary es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de frutas; da a conocer que la venta de este producto lo aprendió de su familia, pues desde niña vendía al lado de su madre, en la actualidad tiene un negocio independiente donde trabaja todos los días. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de frutas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es vive en unión libre y tiene una hija.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Unión y Libertad communal bank will begin its thirtieth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II regional center.  It is comprised of eight members, and it is led by a board of directors.  Mary is the president.  The members’ businesses are varied and include making skirts, selling gifts, selling fruit, Internet services, photocopy services, macramé blankets, selling ‘salchipapas’ [sausages and potatoes mixed together], and selling pastries.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesswomen where Mary is a member.  She states that this is the first time she has been a member of Pro Mujer.  She joined by invitation from one of her colleagues who is a client of the institution.  She currently has a business of selling fruit.  She says that she learned to sell this product from her family.  When she was a girl she sold by her mother’s side.  She currently has an independent business where she works every day.

The loan that she will now take is to increase capital (to buy fruit wholesale).  She will get the fruit from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz.  She will later sell it at her place of sales.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she has a daughter.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fruit wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy maize, cassava flour, vegetable oil and condiments.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a 27-year-old businesswoman and a mother of one. She lives in a remote area of Gokwe North, Zimbabwe where she has been operating a fruit and vegetable stall at the local market for two years. She started the business so that she could be in a better position to provide for her family. She sells onions, potatoes, tomatoes and apples. When she is not at her business, she volunteers as a seed money scheme monitor for members of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network. Furthermore, she serves as a community health activist and a Learner Guide at the local school where she teaches students life skills.

With the Kiva loan, she will purchase more stock to improve her sales. An improvement in the business would mean an improvement in her family’s well-being. She also hopes to open her own fruit and vegetable store one day.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is a 22-year-old businesswoman, living in a rural village of Gokwe South, Zimbabwe. She serves as a Leaner Guide at a local school where she teaches life skills education. 

Noreen takes pride in her business, selling poultry to local customers. She has been successfully operating the business for 13 months and produces batches of 40 birds every six weeks. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Noreen will buy more chicks and chick feed to improve production. Noreen hopes to expand her business into a large-scale poultry production in order to become a major supplier of chickens and chicken products in her community.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products and an air conditioner and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Isreal

texts.en:
Isreal is a 43-year-old man. He is married, with five children who all attend school. 

Isreal is a teacher by profession and works for eight hours a day and six days a week, having been in service for twenty years. He also does farming for additional income.  He likes his profession just as he has love for children. 

Isreal needs a loan to pay school fees for his children to meet his dream, despite the challenge of little salary and delay in salary payment.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more groceries and household items to sell at her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wax cotton, lace and different kinds of clothing material to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an air conditioner and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her home for winter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Myness

texts.en:
Myness is a 23-year-old businesswoman and a mother of one. 

She lives in the Gokwe North District of Zimbabwe where she has been operating a poultry business for six months now. She started the business to increase her monthly income. She produces 100 birds every six weeks and is very pleased with how far she has come. Myness also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills at the local secondary school. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Myness intends to purchase stocks of feed, vaccines, and chicks. She also intends to use the proceeds from the business to build a bigger fowl run, so that she can increase production.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks, feed, and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more shoes, clothing and linens to sell.

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es:
Nueva Vida está en el cuarto ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, también forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde por medio de esta podrán conocer la situación de vida de cada una de ellas.
Ceferina es una de las integrantes, que con gran sacrificio y esfuerzo está saliendo adelante por medio de su trabajo en la costura, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo muy luchadora, que quiere seguir ayudando a su familia y a sus seres queridos por medio de su trabajo.
Ceferina comenta que su sueño es poder tener un gran taller donde poder dar trabajo a otras personas que al igual que ella quieran salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, botones y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Nueva Vida is in the fourth cycle of the women’s committee program. It is also a part of the program for the elimination of poverty where through this they will be able to know the living situation of each one of the members.

One of the members is Ceferina, who with great sacrifice and effort is coming out ahead by means of her sewing work. She is a very hard-working woman and above all very determined, and a woman who wants to continue helping her family and her loves ones through her work.

Ceferina says that her dream is to be able to have a great workshop where she can give employment to other people that want to come out ahead, same as her.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of cloth, thread, elastic, buttons, and others, and in this way be able to continue with her dressmaking as she has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, thread, elastic, buttons, and more.

loans.name: Fungai

texts.en: Fungai is a 20-year-old entrepreneur living with her family in the Gokwe South District in Zimbabwe. She serves as a peer educator and a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school sharing life skills with students. Fungai has been operating a grocery shop successfully for over two years with the assistance of her family. With the Kiva loan, Fungai will purchase sugar, rice, tea, stationery, sanitary wear, cooking oil, and potato chips to increase sales and profits. With the increased income, she looks forward to improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more products for the shop

loans.name: Clorid

texts.en: Clorid is 24 years old and a mother of one living in Gokwe District, Zimbabwe. Clorid has been working as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well-being of students by enhancing their learning environment. In addition, she rents a table at the local flea market, where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts. She has been running this business for one year now and it has enabled her to support her family.  With the Kiva loan, Clorid will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and be able to provide for her child.

loans.use: To purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to increase her supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grocery items to increase the stock at her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase vaccines, feeders, feed, and chicks in bulk

loans.name: Precious

texts.en: Precious is a 22-year-old businesswoman and mother of one. Precious lives in the rural district of Gokwe North, Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a grocery shop for one year now, selling soap, cooking oil, salt, and sugar. When she is not working in her shop, she volunteers at the local secondary school as a Learner Guide. Camfed Learner Guides work with students to increase their life skills and wellbeing. With the requested Kiva loan, Precious intends to purchase supplies to improve sales and profits. She is also hoping to create employment in her community.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to increase sales.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 19-year-old entrepreneur from Gokwe South in Zimbabwe. Florence really values the education that she received and wants other children in her community to receive a quality education as well. To increase the quality of learning for other students in her local community, she serves as a Learner Guide, teaching students life and study skills. 

To earn an income, Florence has been successfully operating a poultry business for a year and a half. She produces batches of 50 chickens every 6 weeks and supplies them to the local community. 

With the Kiva loan, Florence will purchase day-old chicks, vaccines, sawdust and feed to improve production and sales. She will use the proceeds from the business to further her education and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, chick feed, vaccines and sawdust.

loans.name: Tierra Fertil  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Tierra Fértil está formada por 8 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, parroquia que se caracteriza por la belleza de sus paisajes, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, aun mantienen su cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.
Las son personas alegres y trabajadoras que laboran en distintas actividades diarias, actividades que les permiten aportara la economía de sus hogares  y salir adelante con sus familias.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señoras. Patricia, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 10 y 7 años que estudian en una escuelita de la localidad, su esposo se dedica a la venta de gas, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
Doña Patricia desde hace 4 años labora en el negocio familiar el cual es la venta de gas, esta actividad la realiza sin un horario fijo y trabaja de lunes a sábados. El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en el pago de una cuota de un terreno que se compraron para construir su casa. Su meta es tener su casa propia. 
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar prresente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The “Tierra Fértil” [Fertile Land] loan group is comprised of eight women that live in the areas surrounding Valle de Cuenca, a parish characterized by its beautiful landscapes.  The people are engaged in business, raising animals, and farming, and still maintain the culture and traditions of their parents. 
The group members are happy, hardworking people that work in different activities, which allow them to contribute to their household expenses and get their families ahead.

One of the members of the group is Patricia.  She is 31 years old, married, and has two children, ages 10 and 7, who attend the local school.  Her husband sells gas, and they are renting as they don’t have their own home.

Patricia has worked in the family business, selling gas, for four years.  She works from Monday to Saturday, without a fixed schedule.  She will invest the money from the loan to pay for a plot of land that they will buy to build their house.  Her goal is to have her own house.
The small photo is of a member of the group who couldn’t be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to pay for a plot of land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more groceries in bulk to improve her stock.

loans.name: Yazini

texts.en: Yazini is a 22-year-old mother of one living in Zimbabwe’s Gokwe South District. She has been selling farm produce including potatoes, fruits, cucumbers, onions, bananas, apples, and oranges for the past 11 months. The business provides her local community with many healthy eating options. She also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school. At the school, she teaches students life skills and encourages them to continue with their studies. With the requested Kiva loan, Yazini will purchase more farm produce to improve her sales. This will enable her to improve her income and standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more farm produce to improve her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her store

loans.name: Rumbidzai

texts.en:
Rumbidzai is a 29-year-old mother of two. She lives in the Gokwe South District of Zimbabwe, where she has been running a poultry project successfully for over two years at her home. She produces batches of 40 birds every six weeks. In addition, Rumbidzai volunteers as a janitor in local schools where she cleans playgrounds. She is also involved in community outreach programs.

Rumbidzai will use the Kiva loan to make bulk purchases of vaccines, layer chickens, and feed. She wants to venture into egg production since eggs are a profitable commodity on the market and are easy to sell.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy corn and millet.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en: Carol is a 22-year-old mother of one, living in the Gokwe South District of Zimbabwe. To support her family financially, Carol has been successfully operating a flea market business for over nine months. She sells shoes, slippers, shirts, t-shirts, trousers, skirts, baby clothes and jewelry. When she is not working at her flea market she serves as a Learner Guide and volunteers as a community health activist. With the requested Kiva loan, she will expand her business by making bulk purchases of shirts, t-shirts, trousers, skirts, baby clothes and blankets. With the additional profits she hopes to provide for her child and husband.

loans.use: to expand her business by making bulk purchases of shirts, t-shirts, trousers, skirts, baby clothes and blankets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make bulk purchases of more stocks for her business.

loans.name: Ackline

texts.en: Ackline is a 24-year-old businesswoman. She has been operating a poultry project for two years and is now a reliable supplier of chickens in her community. She produces about 100 birds every six weeks. Ackline also volunteers as a janitor cleaning toilets and the schoolyard at her local school where she is also a Camfed Learner Guide. As a Learner Guide, she works with students to increase their life skills and well-being. With the requested loan from Kiva, Ackline would like to renovate her business and increase the number of chicks to improve production. With additional profits, she hopes to improve her standard of living and support her parents.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks to increase production.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase SOBEBRA products (beverages)

loans.name: Daba's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 7 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 13 décembre 2008. Ce banc regroupe des femmes dynamiques, elles habitent dans le même village et les alentours. La plupart font du commerce comme activité génératrice de revenus.
Khemesse debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 32 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 3 garçons.
Avec le prêt elle envisage d'acheter du tissu pour une valeur de 125000f. Elle peut avoir un bénéfice de 25000f.Elle va donner les 175000f restant à son mari pour renforcer sa boutique.
Les bénéfices lui serviront à renforcer son épargne et la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This group of seven women belongs to a Banc Villageois that was created December 13, 2008. It consists of dynamic women who live in the same village and surrounding areas. For the most part, their income-generating activities revolve around commercial endeavors. 

Khemesse, age 32, is the member standing on the right and raising her hand in the group photo. She is married with five children, three of them boys. 

She plans to use her loan to buy 125,000f worth of fabrics. She could earn a profit of 25,000f. 

She plans to give the remaining 175,000f of her loan to her husband to help with his store. 

The profits earned will be used to bolster her savings and to help with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for resale, and to help her husband's business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her business.

loans.name: Chipo

texts.en: Chipo is a 21-year-old, mother of one, living in Zimbabwe’s Gokwe North District. For the past year, she has been running a grocery shop where she sells sugar, cooking oil, soft drinks, biscuits, powdered milk and bath soap. Chipo also volunteers at her local school as a Camfed Learner Guide teaching life skills education and cooperative learning to students. With the requested Kiva loan, she will buy more merchandise to sell in her store. She intends to use the proceeds from the business to provide for her child, as well as further her education.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her business.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is a 23-year-old self-started businesswoman living in Gokwe South District, Zimbabwe. She is running a home-based hair salon, which she started nine months ago when she realized that it is a very profitable business in the community. She also wanted to be financially independent in order to support herself and her family. 

Roseline inspires young women in her community as both a community health trainer and as an entrepreneur. She wants to move the business to the growth point to increase her clientele base. 

With the loan from Kiva, Rosaline will purchase a hairdryer, rollers, a ceramic iron or tongs, and hair products for her salon. With the proceeds, she will be able to open a salon at the local town center.

loans.use: to purchase hair products and equipment.

loans.name: Soli

texts.en:
Soli is a 39-year-old, married woman with four children. She bakes cakes and muffins and sells them at the shops around her community or at the schools. She has joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in order to gain access to financial assistance. 

Soli plans to use this loan to purchase an oven, a gas bottle, baking pots and pans, a strainer, and other baking utensils. With the profits she plans to get from her sales, she hopes to provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an oven, a gas bottle, baking pots and pans, a strainer, and other baking utensils.

loans.name: Moemoe

texts.en: Moemoe is 44 years old and married with five children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for eight years. Moemoe has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, and a cutter. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2006 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, and a cutter

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 66-year-old, married woman, with seven children. She runs a small shop which has been in operation for more than four years. Maria plans to extend her shop, thus the reason for this loan application. 

Maria will purchase cement, bricks, iron roofing, timber, ceiling boards, nails, and paint. Maria joined the South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) program in 2011 and she has managed, not only to increase the variety of stocks sold in her shop, but to improve the family's living standards, as well.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, iron roofing, timber, ceiling boards, nails, and paint.

loans.name: Peka

texts.en: Peka is 39 years old and married with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 15 years. Peka needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, sprayers, fertilizer, gloves, new overalls, a tiller, a rake, a machete, a crowbar, a new barbed fence, iron poles and new gumboots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Peka will use the profits from her sales to expand her business and help pay for her family’s weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, sprayers, fertilizer, gloves, new overalls, a tiller, a rake, a machete, a crowbar, a new barbed fence, etc.

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en: Epenesa is a 49-year-old, woman with six children. She runs a small vegetable garden business selling her produce to the members of her community, and to the public as well. She has been doing this for more than two years now. She is planning to purchase shovels, rakes, rolls of fencing wire, wheel barrows to further improve her vegetable garden business. Epenesa has managed to uplift the standard of their livelihoods with the profits she has made from her business.

loans.use: to purchase shovels, rakes, rolls of fencing wire, and wheel barrows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 54 years old from Sindangan. In order to support the family, she operates a sari-sari store. She became an active member of Paglaum MPC with a good credit standing. She wants to obtain financial assistance to purchase an additional inventory of goods (canned goods, milk, shampoo, and oil) for her sari-sari store. Lolita smiles at the thought of seeing all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase an additional inventory of goods (canned goods, milk, shampoo, and oil)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy packing materials, machinery, and more dried sardines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Kudakwashe

texts.en:
Kudakwashe is a 19-year-old businesswoman living in Zimbabwe’s Gokwe South District. She has been successfully operating a business selling clothing from her home for over a year. She sells pants, skirts, shirts and dresses. 

Kudakwashe volunteers as a Learner Guide and a community health trainer in schools within the community. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Kudakwashe intends to purchase clothing items to boost her sales and profits. She hopes to be financially stable and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing items to boost her sales and profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing for resale at her store.

loans.name: Sheena

texts.en: Sheena is a 27-year-old, single woman with three children. She has a small vegetable garden and grows cabbages, tomatoes and cucumbers to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Sheena has requested a loan to buy insect poison, sprayers, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow and a tiller. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. With her profits, Sheena hopes to pay for her family’s weekly expenses, and help pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, sprayers, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow and a tiller.

loans.name: Malia

texts.en: Malia is 59 years old and married with six children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for nine years. Malia needs a loan to buy a large display fridge, a new chest freezer, a cash register, a new hanging scale, snacks, frozen goods and canned food. She hopes to save her profits for the expansion of her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2005 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a large display fridge, a new chest freezer, a cash register, a new hanging scale, snacks, frozen goods and canned food

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es: Mario tiene 46 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus cinco hijos tres de los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Mario se dedica a la agricultura. Desde hace mucho tiempo cultiva ejotes, espinaca, mora, cilantro, güisquil, etc. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Mario desea construir un cuarto para cocina para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina, madera, clavos, cemento y arena.
texts.en:
Mario is 46 years old and he lives in his own home with his partner and their five children, three of which are in school. Mario works as a farmer. For quite some time he has grown green beans, spinach, blackberries, cilantro, pear squash, etc. This is how he makes a living and supports his family. 

Mario wants to build a room for the kitchen, for which he is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of sheet metal, wood, nails, cement and sand.

loans.use: to buy: sheet metal, wood, nails, cement and sand to build a room for the kitchen.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is 50 years old and married with eight children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for six years. Anita has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, brushes, stencils, rollers, a large table and wooden carved designs. She plans to use her profits to expand and extend her business. She joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, brushes, stencils, rollers, a large table and wooden carved designs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy foodstuffs such as maize and beans.

loans.name: Velasco Astete Group

texts.es:
La socia Edith pertenece al banco comunal VELASCO ASTETE, el banco está ubicado  en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
 La socia  Edith tiene 35 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a trabajar como docente, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su trabajo el  cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia es docente de profesion,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, este préstamo es parte de una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa su nombre es Credi Yapa, esta línea de crédito es otorgado a los prestatarios con buen historial crediticio, siendo este un grupo que cumple dichas características.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales didácticos.
Las personas que salen con la cara tapada no pertenecen al banco comunal.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

 La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas. 
Los demás socios se dedican al negocio de restaurante, tienda de abarrotes, elaboración de tortas, hospedaje, docentes.
texts.en:
Edith belongs to the communal bank Velasco Astete, a bank that is located in the province and department of Cusco. She is 35 years old and has a son and a partner. Edith spends her day working as a teacher, she has spent a long time doing this job which is going very well thanks to the hard work that she puts into her work. Edith hopes to be able to continue working so that she can continue to support her family. This loan is part of one of the credit facilities from the Asociación Arariwa which goes by the name of Credi Yapa. This line of credit is given to loan borrowers with a good credit history, and this group fits these characteristics.

Edith is seeking the loan to buy educational materials. The people in the photo with their faces covered up do not belong to the communal bank, those who appear in the attached photos requested permission to arrive late to the meeting for work reasons.

Edith is grateful for the loan given and pledges to meet the defined repayment deadlines. The other members work in restaurants, grocery store, making cakes, hospitality and teaching.

loans.use: to buy educational materials.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
From Sindangan, Rolando earns a living through his buy-and-sell business of fruits and vegetables. He seeks to have enough inventory to continuously provide for his family. 

For his capital needs, Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) stood by him since the start of his business. He is happy that he is able to survive the odds of business with determination and his family is his inspiration. 

To earn more money, Rolando applied for a loan to purchase more kilos of vegetables and fruits to sell. Rolando hopes to live comfortably with his children while they finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Bremilda

texts.es:
Bremilda tiene 32 años, vive junto a su hija en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad de clima muy caluroso, su población es amable y religiosa, se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella brinda servicio de fotocopias, su hija le apoya en esta labor, brindan un buen servicio a sus clientes, por lo que son conocidas en su distrito.

Bremilda es una madre emprendedora que ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para invertir en implementar útiles de oficina, lo que le generará mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Bremilda, 32, lives with her daughter in the Cayalti district.  This is a community with a very warm climate.  The people here are kind and religious, and they work in agriculture, commerce, and animal husbandry.  This area is located in Chiclayo province, which is part of the Lambayeque region in the northern coast of Peru.

Bremilda has a business providing photocopying services.  Her daughter helps her with this work. They provide good service to their customers, and they are well-known in the area.

Bremilda is an enterprising mother who has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 Peruvian soles to invest in office supplies for her business.  This will enable her to attract more customers and increase her household income.

loans.use: Compra de utiles de escritorio para hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.name: Mujeres Obreras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MUJERES OBRERAS” iniciará el décimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maruja es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, servicio de construcción, venta de comida, venta de polleras, tienda de barrio, venta de matas, venta de ropa

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maruja es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su pareja, que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento hace varios años, ya que aprendió la comercialización de estos productos cuando apoyaba a su madre, es por ello que decide independizarse. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido de la clienta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
“Mujeres Obreras” (Women Workers) is a Communal Bank that will start its tenth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. It is composed of eight members, guided by a directive board presided over by Maruja. The member of the Communal Bank engage in different activities such as selling vegetables, construction services, selling meals, selling traditional skirts, managing a neighborhood store, selling blankets, selling clothes.

Maruja is one of the micro entrepreneurs forming this group, and she will benefit from the requested loan. She says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for three years, having been invited by her partner who is a member of the institution. She is currently running a clothes shop: she says she has been working for many years in this field, having learned how to sell clothes by helping her mother, and now she wants to be work independently.

The loan she is now requesting will be used to increase her working capital by buying clothes at wholesale price that she will buy from wholesalers in the town of El Alto, to then sell them according to her customers’ requests. This type of activity helps her earning an income to economically support her family, as she is single and she has three children.

When asked about what she likes of Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the seminars offered by the institution.

loans.use: To buy clothes at wholesale price.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora 4 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad de Itá, tiene 20 integrantes, es un grupo numeroso que trabaja unido para poder dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Sandra es miembro de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas varias y calzados varios, que vende en forma ambulante, y de esta forma tiene los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia. Sandra es una persona muy sacrificada, que pese a los obstáculos está saliendo adelante gracias a su esfuerzo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas varias de invierno, y también de calzados para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: This group is from the city of Itá.  They are a large, twenty member group that works together to provide their families with all that they themselves couldn’t have.  Sandra, a member of this group, is a street vendor, and sells various clothing and footwear.  In this way, she has income to be able to support her family.  Sandra is a very self-sacrificing person who is moving forward in spite of obstacles, thanks to her hard work.  She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase various winter clothing items, as well as shoes to continue with her sales as she has been doing.  She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving, which will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to purchase various winter clothing and footwear for sale.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmen tiene 59 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 4 hijos todos mayores, que con mucho sacrificio saco adelante, ya que tuvo que luchar sola.
Ella  empezó trabajando desde muy joven como costurera luego de mucho esfuerzo, y la dedicación con su fallecido esposo, logro comprar una máquina de coser para poder fabricar sus propias prenda y salir a venderlos, este trabajo le genero mejores ganancias, actualmente ya tiene una clientela bien formada en el barrio donde vive y el negocio le está resultando muy bien.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, bebidas entre otros, para poder seguir con sus confecciones, trabajando para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Carmen is 59 years old. She is a widow and has 4 adult children. She managed to raise them with a lot of effort because she had to struggle alone.
She started working as a seamstress since she was very young. After a lot of effort, and after being dedicated to her deceased husband, she was able to buy a sewing machine to make her own clothes and sell them. This job helped her get better profits. Currently, she has a good clientele in the neighborhood where she lives at, and the business is going very well. 

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of fabrics, threads, elastics, and drinks among others. She wants to be able to keep working making up clothes to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, elastics, and drinks among others.

loans.name: Elsa Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, provincia La Convención y departamento Cusco.
La socia Elsa Elena  tiene 60 años tiene 08 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono ,fertilizantes y otros para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Sra. Elsa Elena is a member of the Communal Bank “Komoyganakera Maganiroigi” which is located in the District of Echarate in La Convención Province, Department of Cusco. She is 60 years old, married, and has eight children. Elsa Elena divides her time between her daily activities and her farming duties. She has been devoted to her business for a long time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work. Elsa Elena wants to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy compost, fertilizers, and other supplies for her business. Elsa Elena appreciates the loan that has been provided, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, and other supplies

loans.name: Foisaga

texts.en:
Foisaga is a 37-year-old, unwed woman with four children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Foisaga has requested a loan to buy chemicals, sprayers, a tiller, a crowbar, a new wheelbarrow, and new overalls. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2014. With her profits, Foisaga hopes to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, sprayers, a tiller, a crowbar, a new wheelbarrow, and new overalls.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a businesswoman from Sindangan. She is 38 years old, married, and has expertise in selling. 

She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. She is a full fledged member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. 

Now, Rosalie has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Rosalie continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 23-year-old businesswoman living in Gokwe South District, Zimbabwe. She has been successfully running a shop selling clothes such as jackets, skirts, shirts and dresses for over ten months. When she is not working in her flea market, Lydia serves as a Learner Guide at the local secondary school teaching students life skills education.  

With the Kiva loan, Lydia intends to purchase more stock for her business and improve sales and profits. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring financial stability to her life and enable her to finally further her education.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Gamey

texts.en:
Gamey is 37 years old and married with five children who are all in school.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Gamey is borrowing 9,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gamey has been farming vegetables for five years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dreams of saving enough money to expand her business and repairing her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Erkeaiym

texts.ru: Эркеайым, 53 года, вдова, мать 4 детей, все дети самостоятельные и живут отдельно,старшая дочь временно проживает с Эркеайым и активно помогает ей по хозяйству. У Эркеайым- средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она на протяжении 20 лет занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 13 овец. Также есть земельный надел мерою 0,64 ГА, выращивает клевер, для обеспечения скотины кормом. Ежемесячный доход от перепродажи скота составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Эркеайым обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Эркеайым планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить средства на свадьбу сына и построить ему собственный дом.
texts.en: Erkeaiym is 53, widowed, and the mother of four children. All of her children live independently except her eldest daughter, who is living with her temporarily and helping with the housework.  Erkeaiym has a vocational education and has earned a living for 20 years raising livestock. Thanks to her hard work she currently has 13 sheep. She also has 0.64 hectares of land where she grows clover to feed the livestock. She earns 15,000 som (KGS) per month selling livestock. In order to expand her business, Erkeaiym applied for a loan with the bank "Bai-Tushum" for 20,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock. She plans to use the profits to buy additional livestock and to save money for her son's wedding and to build him a new house.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is taking a loan of USD 800 to improve her business. She is married and she has four children.  

Ana is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, such as  coffee, sugar, salt, noodles, and cigarettes.

She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of USD 200. Ana is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, salt, noodles, and cigarettes.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Sindangan, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to jump start her farming activities. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital.

To this day, Patricia feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business.

Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Patricia wishes to sustain this business and be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is married and she is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family.

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as beer, oil, noodles, candles, water, rice, Sprite and coffee. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $300.  She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy beer, oil, noodles, candles, water, rice, Sprite and coffee

loans.name: Makerita Kolio

texts.en:
Makerita is 50 years old and married with 11 children. She runs a small business selling puddings and pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 5 years.

Makerita has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, a large pot, a frying pan, tongs, a new oven, yeast, custard and icing sugar. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Makerita will help pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, a large pot, a frying pan, tongs, a new oven, yeast, custard and icing sugar

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
