El comité Oñondivepa se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní, todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades eminentemente rurales, a través de las cuales quieren dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener. Son de una zona rural, que se encuentra aún en crecimiento.
Nilda es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se dedica a la cría, venta o faena de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cerdos, y demás, aunque es un trabajo muy sacrificado, por medio de ello ayuda a su familia y les da una vida digna, para que no pasen por necesidades.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, y de esa forma poder seguir con la cría y luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
The Oñondivepa communal bank was formed with the union of various neighbors in the city of Santaní.  All of the members of the communal bank are engaged in notably rural business activities.  Through these business activities they want to give their families everything that they were not able to have.  They are in a rural area that is still growing.

Nilda is one of the members of this group.  She raises and sells barnyard animals like chickens, pigs, and the rest.  Although it is very demanding work, it is through this work that she helps her family and gives them a decent life.  She does this so that they do not have to do without the necessities.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy balanced feed for her animals.  This way she will be able to continue raising animals and struggling to improve.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for animals.

loans.name: Natercia

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Natercia to improve her business.  She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $100.

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like fish, noodles, cigarettes, water, coffee, sugar, candles and shampoo. Natercia is generating a good income from selling her things from the kiosk.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business, and she is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy fish, noodles, cigarettes, water, coffee, sugar, candles and shampoo

loans.name: Barrio 3 Tapiracuai Group

texts.es:
El comité Barrio 3 Tapiracuai se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades eminentemente rurales como criar y faenar animales de corral, como gallinas y cerdos.
Griselda es una de las integrantes que se dedica a eso, y comenta que tiene un número considerable de animales, los cuales cría, y luego vende o faena, ya tiene una muy buena clientela, y es por medio de este trabajo que su familia tiene para el día a día.
Griselda pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con la cría de sus animales. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir con su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The Barrio 3 Tapiracuai committee was formed by several neighbors of the city of Santaní coming together. All the members of the committee engage in fundamentally rural activities such as raising and slaughtering small farm animals like hens and pigs.

Griselda is one of the members who makes her living doing this. She says that she has a considerable number of animals, which she raises and then sells or slaughters. She has a very good clientele, and it is through this work that her family has enough for their day-to-day life.

Griselda is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in buying feed for her animals, so that she can continue raising her animals. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is getting to be able to continue with her undertaking.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Nisel

texts.en: Nisel helps her husband on their farm, growing and harvesting rice to make a living. With much of the earnings from her farm, she was able to sustain their needs and repaid her previous loan used for buying fertilizer. Their farm is doing well and with this, she had to borrow a new loan for additional capital to buy fertilizer. In the future, she wants to improve the general living of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.ru: Guillerma has a store in Sindangan. At 30, she enjoys tending her stall with little help from her husband. This is how they support their children. She is micro-entrepreneur member of PMPC and has maintained a good credit record. She applied for a loan because she is in need of capital to purchase softdrinks and groceries. Guillerma wishes to sustain her business and hopes to operate a mini mart in the future.
texts.en: Guillerma has a store in Sindangan. At 30, she enjoys tending her stall with a little help from her husband. This is how they support their children. She is a micro-entrepreneur member of PMPC and has maintained a good credit record. She applied for a loan because she is in need of capital to purchase soft drinks and groceries. Guillerma wishes to sustain her business and hopes to operate a mini mart in the future.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and groceries

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a very hard-working entrepreneur from Taguig City, Philippines. She is 48 years old and has eight children. Melitin, her husband, works as a driver. She manages a food-vending business and her income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures.

In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings, when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons, when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

Nancy is requesting a loan to purchase more quantities of products, like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. She will use her loan to improve her sales and her additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In the future, Nancy hopes her small 'carinderia' (a local eatery, selling and serving affordable viands for the masses in the Philippines) will become a big restaurant. She wants her children to finish their studies and also prays that she will always be healthy and strong for them.

Every week, Nancy meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more products needed in her business, like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Luis de 62 años de edad habita en la ciudad de Barranquilla y se dedica a la elaboración y venta de calzado artesanal femenino desde hace 30 años.  Antes de realizar esta actividad, se dedicaba a ganar ingresos trabajando en cualquier actividad que le permitiera ganara un poco de dinero para subsistir, como dice él “Yo me rebuscaba, hacia de todo lo que me ponían a hacer”. Así fue como un día llegó a una Microemrpesa de calzado a trabajar y allí aprendió todo lo que hoy sabe, hasta que se independizó. Hoy tiene su negocio,  elabora  sandalias, zapatos femeninos y colegiales, que vende a crédito; sus mayores clientes son las misceláneas, a quienes distribuye su calzado y estas mantienen en su estantería exhibiciones, que le permiten vender.  Las compras de materias primas e insumos las realiza en peleterías o almacenes especializados en calzado y sus derivados, donde comprar por volumen le resulta muy competitivo.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un crédito mediante el cual comprará sintéticos e insumos con los cuales fabricar nuevos y modernos diseños. Su meta es ensanchar su negocio y apoyar los estudios profesionales de su nieto para sacarlo adelante, aunque su mayor desafío sea tener suficiente capital de trabajo para lograrlo.
texts.en:
Luis is 62 years old. He lives in the city of Barranquilla and he works making and selling artisanal women’s shoes. He is been doing this for over 30 years.

 Before doing this, he was making an income working in any occupation that would allow him to make some money to survive. He states “ I looked for work, I did whatever they wanted me to do." That’s how one day he found a small footwear company to work in. He learned there everything he knows today, until he became independent. He owns a business today, he makes sandals, female shoes, and school shoes, and he sales them on credit.
His biggest clients are the corner shops, where he distributes the footwear and they keep some models to sell on the shelves. He purchases the raw materials and supplies  in leather shops or warehouses specialized in shoes and similar products. He buys in bulk and that gives him really competitive prices.

Currently, he is requesting a loan to buy synthetics and supplies to make new and modern designs. His goal is to expand his business and support his grandson with his professional studies. His big challenge will be to have enough work to be able to do it.

loans.use: to buy synthetics and supplies to make new and modern footwear designs.

loans.name: Risolat

texts.ru: Рисолат уроженка района Носири Хусрав. Ей 32 года. Она занята в сфере торговли. Ее муж находится сейчас в России на заработках. Рисолат живет с двумя маленькими детьми, которым по 2 и 4 года. В 2011 году Рисолат начала бизнес по продаже женской одежды. Ее торговая точка находится на центральном рынке ее района. Рисолат хочет привезти побольше летнего товара, чтобы увеличить объем продаж. Так как ее собственных средств не хватает, она обратилась за кредитом. Рисолат надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Risolat is 32 and from the Nosiri Khusrav district. She works in the retail business and her husband works in Russia. She lives with her two young children, ages 2 and 4. In 2011 she started a business selling women's clothing, located in the district's central market. She wants to sell more summer clothing to increase sales. Since she does not have enough money, she applied for a loan. Risolat hopes for financial support.

loans.use: to buy seasonal women's clothing to increase sales

loans.name: Myanganbaatar

texts.en: Myanganbaatar is 32 years old and newly married. He lives with his spouse in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He works as a plumber in a private company, and his wife is a doctor. Recently he has built a house with the help of some construction workers, and now he is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugrik) to pay the rest of the workers' wages.

loans.use: to pay the rest of the workers' wages

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is 34 years old. She lives with her husband and three children in a rural area located in the Bovel district in Cambodia. She has been growing cassava for three years. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day.
This is the second loan for Sok with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 KHR. She is going to use this loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds for her cassava. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s business and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds for her cassava

loans.name: Sam Art

texts.en:
Sam Art is a 29-year-old mother of four children living in a rural village of the Bovel district in Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been growing cassava for almost 10 years, and her husband supplements the family’s income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about USD 20 per day. 

This is the second microloan for Sam with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for this loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Samet's Group

texts.en:
Aged 39 years old, Samet is a married mother of five children living in a rural village of Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Rice farming is the main source of the family’s income. She has been in this business for 20 years. She can earn about 60,000 KHR per day. 

Samet has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice healthfully and sell it for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Mauga

texts.en:
Mauga is 51 years old and married with seven children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living, which she has been doing for four years. 

Mauga has requested a loan to buy fabric paint, rollers, stencils, brushes, wooden carved designs, a cutter and material. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric paint, rollers, stencils, brushes, wooden carved designs, a cutter and material

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en:
Sreymom, 46, is widowed and lives with her family in a village of the Moung Russey district. She has two children. To make a living, she has been farming rice for several years, and the current business earns her family about 37,000 KHR per day. 
There are four members in Sreymom's Group, and she is the second cycled client with VisionFund. Sreymom, who is the leader, is leading her group to apply for a loan. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to increase her family’s income from her current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en:
Sophea is 26 years old and married. Her family lives in a village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, and she and her husband earn a living through farming rice. Having been in this business for 10 years, she is able to earn about 80,000 KHR per day.
Sophea is the existing client of VisionFund who has received loans for three cycles. The past loans have helped her family relieve their financial burden to a great extent. She is now leading a group of three members to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for land plowing and labor. With this loan, she hopes to make more crops and sell it for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a 56-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She is trying hard to provide their needs including food, health, clothing, and education. She is in the agriculture business growing and selling bananas with the support of her husband. Through this, she earns a good amount of income to support the household expenditures. In order to grow her sales in the near future, she has requested a loan to buy organic fertilizer and pay for banana replanting costs.  She expects this to boost her earnings and profits. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and pay the cost of replanting bananas

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru: Сабохат добрая,открытая и позитивная женщина. Она замужем и проживает со своей семьей в районе Спитамен. Ей 24 года. В возрасте 16 лет Сабохат начала самостоятельно заниматься откормом и продажей крупнорогатого скота, которому научил ее отец. Сабохат успешно продолжает свой бизнес уже 8 лет. В данный момент в ее скотном дворе имеется только два быка. Сабохат хочет увеличить их поголовье для развития бизнеса. В связи с этим она запрашивает кредит. Она нуждается в вашей поддержке.
texts.en: Sabohat is a kind, friendly, positive woman. She is married and lives in the Spitamen district with her family. She is 24 years old. When she was 16, Sabohat began fattening and selling cattle on her own, which her father had taught her to do. She has successfully run her business for eight years. Right now she only has two bulls in her barn and wants to increase her livestock headcount in order to expand her business. This is why she has asked for a loan and needs your support.

loans.use: to buy young bulls and expand her business

loans.name: Ang's Group

texts.en:
Ang, 25, is married and lives with her husband and three children in a village in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She and her husband are rice farmers. She has been in the rice farming business for several years, earning about 20,000 KHR per day to feed her family. 

Ang’s group consists of three members who all are female. She is in her third cycle with VisionFund. She has successfully paid back the past loans, which have helped her family relieve their financial burden and improve their livelihood. Now requesting another loan with VisionFund, Ang, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en:
Yen, 54 years old, is a married mother of seven children living in a rural village of the Bovel district in Cambodia. To support her big family, Yen and her husband have been farming rice and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 70,000 KHR per day. 
Yen’s group consists of four members, and she is the leader. She is the third cycled client with VisionFund. She has successfully used the past loans from VisionFund to better support her family. With this loan, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for land plowing. She hopes to increase her crop yields and sell it for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Hermenegelda

texts.en:
Hermenegelda owns and operates a plot of farmland, cultivating bananas and rice for sale to earn a living. She was able to build a swine fattening business in addition to her farming activities. She is borrowing this loan from GDMPC Microcredit to purchase fertilizer. 

In the future, Hermenegelda hopes to expand her farm to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Eth's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village in Battambang province’s Moug Russey district, Eth is a 44 years old. She and her husband have been farming rice for 24 years. Together, they can earn about 80,000 KHR per day from the current business and can manage to save about 30,000 KHR each day.

Eth is just with VisionFund for this cycle and she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Roeury's Group

texts.en: Roeury is 34 years old and a resident of Moung Russey district in Battambang province. She is the mother of three dependent children, all of whom remain in school.  To make a living, she grows rice as the main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. Roeury has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles already. She has completely repaid the past loan. Now, Roeury leads a group of four members to get a loan of 4,400,000 KHR. Her portion is 1,400,000 KHR. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and to pay land plowing fees. She hopes that the loan will allow her to get a higher yield so that she can earn a better income to support a family of three children who are going to school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay land plowing fees

loans.name: Sokunthea's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Moung Russey district, Sokunthea is 40 years old and married. She has six children. She and her husband have been working very hard to support their family by farming rice and working for others for a fee. Having been in this business for almost 30 years, she currently can earn about 45,000 KHR per day. 

This is a microloan for Sokunthea’s group of two and she is a sixth-cycle client. The past loans have helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Khai's Group

texts.en:
Khai is 59 years old and married with nine children. He and his family live in a village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To make a living, he and his wife have been farming rice for 25 years, earning about 50,000 KHR per day. 

Khai is a third-cycle client while his group member is a fourth-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. He has successfully used the past loans to improve his family’s livelihood. Now he is leading his group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. He will use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland. With this loan, he hopes to grow his crops better and produce higher yields in order for him to increase his family’s income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farmland

loans.name: Mael's Group

texts.en: Age 36, Mael is a resident of Moung Russey district in Battambang province.  She supports her family through two hectares of rice cropping as the main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. This business earns her about 32,000 KHR per day. She is the leader of a group of three members. This is the third cycle for her and the first cycle for the other two group members with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  She has repaid her past loan completely and it has enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle at a gradual pace. For this cycle, the group requests a loan of 3,400,000 KHR. Mael's portion is 1,400,000 KHR. As the leader, she plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay land plowing fees. She strongly believes that the loan will enable her to earn a higher income to better support her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay land plowing fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing machines for developing a new business

loans.name: Sareoun's Group

texts.en: Sareourn is a resident of Moung Russey, located in Battambang province. She is a 54 years old and a married woman, who has five children.  Her entire family solely relies on rice farming on one hectare  and on sesame growing on another hectare of land. On average, her family can earn 31,700 KHR per day. Sareourn has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three cycles already. She has completely repaid past loans, and it has allowed her to improve the living conditions of the family. Now she leads a group of two members to request a loan of 2,800,000 KHR, each having an equal share of 1,400,000 KHR. As the group leader, she plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for labor fees for the farms. She looks forward to getting a higher yield from the farms and hoping to uplift the family’s living conditions at a gradual pace.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for labor fees

loans.name: Ioanina

texts.en:
Ioanina is a 40-year-old single woman with four children. She makes and sells cakes, donuts, pies and scones in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business.

 Ioanina needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, butter, yeast, baking soda, a new oven and trays. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Ioanina has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, butter, yeast, baking soda, a new oven and trays

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Thy, 34, lives with her husband and three children in a rural village of the Bovel district, Cambodia. Two of her children are still in school. To feed the family, Thy and her husband earn a living as farmers who have been farming for 15 years, earning about 33,000KHR per day to spend for the family’s needs. 

This is Thy’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she has been with VisionFund for five cycles. Thy has used the loans to improve her family’s livelihood and keep her children in school. She is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. Thy is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her family’s business and she hopes to increase her crop yields so as to generate more income to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her family’s business

loans.name: Sarin's Group

texts.en:
Moung Russey district of Battambang province is the residential area of Sarin and her family. Sarin is 45 years old and also a mother of four dependent children. She struggles to earn a living by doing rice farming. She has been engaged in agribusiness for about 25 years already. 

This is the first time for Sarin to get a loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She leads a group of four members to request a loan of 4,400,000 KHR, of which 1,000,000 KHR is allocated as Sarin’s share. As the leader, she will use the loan to buy seed, fertilizer and gasoline to use on her crop farm. 

She optimistically believes that the loan will allow her to get a higher yield from her farm.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and gasoline to use on her crop farm.

loans.name: Phoun's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Phoun is 36 years old and married. She has four children to support since all of them remain in school. 

To tackle her family’s hardship, Phoun grows rice on a two-hectare area and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has been involved in her current business for 11 years. This is the sixth cycle for Phoun with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia. She has completely repaid her past loan and it improved her lifestyle at a gradual pace. 

Now, in a group of two members, Phoun is the group leader. The group requests a loan of KHR 2,600,000, of which Phoun owns a portion of KHR 1,400,000. 

As the representative of the group, Phoun will use the loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline and pay for labor fees. She looks forward to getting a higher yield from the crop farm through the help of the loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and gasoline and pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Hei's Group

texts.en: Hei is a villager of Moung Russey district, located in Battambang province. Hei is 52 years old and a mother of five children. She struggles to earn a living for the huge family through paddy rice farming and her paid-working job. Including this loan, Hei and her joint borrower, are in a second cycle loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely, and it has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle at a good pace. Now, she and her joint borrower are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, gasoline and pesticides to use on her crop.  She hopes that this year she will be able to get a higher yield from her farm than previous years.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline and pesticide

loans.name: Sreyhai's Group

texts.en: Sreyhai, a villager from Battambang province, is a young mother of two children. Currently, one child is in school and one is still under school-age. Her income is from her rice farming  on six hectares area and her paid-working job. This business earns her about 31,700 KHR per day. This is the second time that Sreyhai has gotten loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is the group leader of a group of two members. She and her fellow group member are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will use the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for labor fees of the farm. She looks forward to getting a higher yield from her crop.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for labor fees

loans.name: Soeurt's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Soeurt is a 38-year-old and one of the breadwinners in the family, consisting of seven children. Nowadays, only five children still need her support. One of them is too young for schooling, whereas the remaining four are still in school. 

To cover the needs in her big household, a rice and pineapple farming business is the main source of income. Never having been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, Soeurt leads the first-time group loan to get a new loan from VisionFund. 

As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide to use on her crop farm. She hopes that the loan enables her to expand her farming business so that she can improve the living of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Roun

texts.en:
Roun is a resident of Dambae district, located in Kampong Cham province. She is 30 years old and married with two children. As a hardworking mother who struggles for the future of her children, Roun has earned money from rice farming and a cassava plantation to support the family and keep her children in school. 

She has been engaged in agribusiness for about twelve years already. She has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund for one cycle already, and she has completely repaid the past loan. 

Now, she requests another loan of 4,000,000 KHR. She plans to use a portion of the loan to buy a plot of land to expand her crop farm. She will use another portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for the land plowing fee and labor fee of her cassava plantation. 

She strongly believes that this year she will be able to get a higher yield from both farms and be able to uplift the living condition of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for the land plowing and labor fee.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma  manages their own piggery ,aside from farming, while her husband works as a seaman. 

She grows and harvests bananas and raises pigs to sell. From four years in her business, she was able to provide for the needs of her child in school. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying feeds. 

Recently, she took a new loan to purchase feeding supplies to boost her pigs. She wants to improve the general living situation of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies

loans.name: Nak's Group

texts.en:
Nak, 28, is married with two dependent children who are both still in school. Her family lives in a house with a thatched roof located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district and the main sources of her family’s income are from farming rice and fishing in her village. She has been running her business for ten years, earning about KHR 23,000 per day and she is able to save about KHR 13,000 each day. 

Nak is a first-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Nak wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields to earn more income to make a living better and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Rat's Group

texts.en: Rat is living in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a 31 year-old married woman with three children. Two are schoolchildren and the remaining one is under school age. To secure the basic needs in her household, rice farming is the main source of her income and driving a tricycle motorbike for a fee is the second source of her family’s income. Rat has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for the past four cycles already. She has completely repaid past loans and it has allowed her to withstand the hardship that her family has faced. Now she leads a group of two members to request a loan of 2,200,000 KHR.  Rat owns a portion of 800,000 KHR of the loan. As the leader, she plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer for her crop. She strongly believes that she will be able to get a higher yield from the farm through the help of the loan.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Chanthrea's Group

texts.en: A resident of Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cheathrea is a 27 year-old married woman blessed with one little child. In order to earn money to support the family, she has been doing rice farming for about seven years and works for others for a fee. In a group of two members, Chanthrea is the group leader. This is the first time for both of them to request a loan of 1,100,000 KHR from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  A portion of 600,000 KHR is owed by Chanthrea. She plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer for her crop. She hopes that this year she will be able to increase the yield of the cash crop more than previous years.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Hun's Group

texts.en:
Hun is 27 years old and married. She lives with her husband and three children in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. 

Hun and her husband are rice farmers and they supplement their income by planting sesame. Having been in this business for seven years, together they can earn about KHR 45,000 per day. 

Hun is the third-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia and she completely paid back the loan, which has helped her improve her family’s living conditions. 

Now, Hun is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Emm's Group

texts.en:
Emm is 59 years old and married with seven children. Her family lives in a village of Moung Russey district. To make a living, she has been farming rice for 11 years and she supplements the family’s income by working as a paid worker. She can earn about 30,000 KHR per day. 

Emm has been with VisionFund for four cycles and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Emm wants to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to harvest more rice so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Rohat

texts.ru:
Рохат 44-летняя замужняя женщина, занимающаяся скотоводством. Она в течение 8 лет у себя во дворе разводит крупнорогатый скот. Члены семьи активно помогают ей в этом. Потому  что сам климат и природа их района Спитамена благоприятствует ведению этого бизнеса и почти все жители этого района имеют в своем хозяйстве скот. Не исключение в этом и семья Рохат. 
Сейчас Рохат хочет увеличить поголовье скотов и таким образом расширить свою деятельность. Для этой цели она запрашивает кредит в размере 2500 долларов США, на сумму которого собирается приобрести несколько крупнорогатых скотин хорошей породы. Она надеется на вашу отзывчивость.
texts.en:
Rohat is 44, married, and raises livestock. She has kept cattle in her yard for eight years with help from her family members. Because the climate and conditions in the Spitamen district are favorable, many residents of this area keep livestock at home. Rohat and her family are no exception. 

Rohat wants to increase her livestock headcount and expand her business. She has applied for a loan for $2500 USD in order to buy a good breed of cattle. She hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a few head of a good breed of cattle to expand her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 58 years old and married. She was gifted with three siblings, and they live harmoniously in a rural community. She and her husband work together to provide the necessities of their family. She runs a small retail store as an additional source of income. Due to financial hardship, she aims to improve her business in order to earn a higher income. 

Having insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of  PHP 10,000 to buy additional stock of soft drinks, canned goods, crackers, candy, soap, shampoo and beverages to resell. She is hoping that someday, she will make her business more profitable through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of soft drinks, canned goods, crackers, candy, soap, shampoo and beverages to resell

loans.name: Maria Nelly

texts.es:
Maria desde hace cuatro años monto un negocio de cría de pollos en el municipio de Sonsón como alternativa te trabajo para obtener ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus familia.
Sus 3 hijos le ayudan en el negocio y le dan el apoyo necesario para continuar con su actividad.
Ella es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora que hace todo lo que este a su alcance para cuidar a sus hijos.
Ella pide un crédito para comprar concentrados y alimentos para sus pollos. Este alimento le dará la oportunidad de mejorar su oferta y aumentar sus clientes, pues sus animales crecerán mucho más sanos.
La mayoría de sus clientes son amigos y vecinos y manifiestos mucho agradecimiento con ellos ya que son los que le han ayudado a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Maria opened a business breeding chickens four years ago in the municipality of Sonsón as a work alternative to make an income to support her family.

Her 3 children help her in the business and they give her the support necessary to continue with her activity.

She is an entrepreneurial and very hard-working woman who does all that is within her reach to care for her children.

She is requesting a loan to purchase pellets and food for her chickens. This food will give her the opportunity to improve her offering and increase her customers, and her animals will grow much healthier.

The majority of her customers are friends and neighbors. She expresses much thankfulness with them since it is they who have helped her to come out ahead.

loans.use: to purchase food and pellets.

loans.name: Oy's Group

texts.en: Oy is a villager of Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. She is 36 years old and married,  She has one child. Oy earns a living from the yield of a one hectare cassava plantation which she has occupied for about 18 years. She also struggles to earn extra income by working for local farmers for a fee. For this cycle, she leads a group of five members requesting a loan for the first-time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the group leader, Oy owns a portion of 400,000 KHR and she plans to use it to buy fertilizer to use on her cassava plantation. She strongly believes that she will be able to get a higher yield and be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to use on her cassava plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Leangheng's Group

texts.en: Leangheng, aged 50, living in a rural village of the Tbaung Khum district, has seven children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. She and her husband are farmers, and sometimes she works for others for a fee. She has been in this business for 32 years. She can earn about 30,000KHR per day.  Leangheng is in her third microloan with VisionFund.  Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and to plow the field. She hopes for a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to plow the field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Ley's Group

texts.en: Ley is a 20-year-old woman, living in Srey Snorm district of Siem Reap province. She is married with one little child. To earn a living, she runs a cassava plantation as her main business, earning about 31,900 KHR per day. As a second time borrower (with the successful repayment of her first loan which improved her living condition gradually), Ley has formed a new group consisting of three to get a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for a plowing fee for the cassava plantation. She hopes that she will be able to earn a higher income through the yield of her cassava plantation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay a plowing fee for her cassava plantation

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Khun's Group

texts.en:
Khun lives in the Srey Snorm district of the Siem Reap province. She is 47 years old and a mother of five children, two of whom are dependent on her and in school. Khun makes a living from rice farming on two hectares of land. This is her only income source.

Having never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) previously, Khun is a leader of a group of two borrowers. As the representative of her group, she will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizers and to pay to have her land plowed. Khun hopes that this loan will allow her to make greater profits from the farm and earn a better income to support her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay to have her land plowed.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: La's Group

texts.en: Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province is the residential area of La and her family of four children. She is a 42-year-old married woman and a farmer who plants rice on three hectares of farmland to earn a living. She also earns extra income to support the family expenses by working as a factory worker. La and her joint borrowers, who have never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), make a group of four to get a new loan. The total requested loan amount of her entire group is 3,500,000 KHR, of which 800,000 KHR is La’s portion. As the leader, La plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer for her crops. She looks forward to getting a higher yield of cash crops through the help of the loan.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is married with five children. He operates a fishing business to make a living. He has been in this field of business for 10 years. Recently, he borrowed a loan from GDMPC to buy a new fishing net for fishing. In the future, Jonathan wants to own a stall in the market in town where he could sell fish. He wants to improve the general living situation of his entire family.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing net for fishing.

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.ru: Санавбар родилась в 1969 году в Таджикистане. Она замужем. Ее муж строитель. Санавбар 2 года назад начала свой бизнес. Вначале она занималась купле продажей носков. Постепенно она развевала свой бизнес. Данное время она занимается купле продажей детской одежды. Санавбар от полученного дохода помогает мужу по обеспечению семьи. Санавбар каждый сезон обновляет ассортимент своего товара и таким образом привлекает покупателей. Санавбар запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки детской одежды для нового сезона. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Sanavbar was born in 1969 in Tajikistan. She is married. Her husband is a carpenter. Sanavbar started her own business 2 years ago. In the beginning she sold socks. Stepwise she developed her business. Currently she sells children's clothing. With the income received, Sanavbar helps her husband provide for the family. 

Every season, Sanavbar changes her assortment of goods and this way attracts more customers. Sanavbar requests a loan in the amount of 1,000 US dollar to purchase children's clothing for the new season. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing for the new season

loans.name: Ganna

texts.ru: Ганна - предприниматель из Виноградово, Западная Украины. Более 7 лет она торгует женской одеждой - платья, юбки, купальники, пр. Она арендует часть магазина, расположенного на рынке, где размещает свой товар. Удобное месторасположение, хороший ассортимент и умеренные  цены - залог успеха бизнеса Ганны. Ее мечта - приобрести собственный магазин. Для этого она хочет развивать свой бизнес дальше, увеличивая оборот и прибыль. Ганна просит предоставить ей кредит в 20,000 гривен для закупки летнего товара. Ганна замужем, у нее есть две взрослые дочери. Старшая помогает по бизнесу.
texts.en: Ganna is an entrepreneur from Vinogradovo in western Ukraine. She has sold women's clothing items for more than seven years, including dresses, skirts, bathing suits, etc. She rents a storefront in the marketplace where she sells her clothing. A convenient location, good range of products and reasonable prices are the keys to Ganna's success. Her dream is to own her own shop. She wants to expand her business and increase sales turnover and profits in order to do this. She has asked for a loan of 20,000 hryvnia to buy summer clothing. She is married and has two grown daughters. The eldest helps her with the business.

loans.use: to purchase a summer inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy assorted goods for her store and to pay off financial obligations

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en:
Sim is a 42-year-old woman who is living in Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. She is also a mother of four children, two of whom still rely on her as they are in school. She struggles to earn a living for the family through her farm, which has two hectares of crops. She has operated her farm for 22 years. The average income for the family is only 36,600 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for Sim with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed and fertilizer. She hopes that she can replant her crop seasonally. She optimistically believes that she will be able to earn a higher income from the farm so that she can expand her farm in the future.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ranh's Group

texts.en:
Ranh, a resident of Dambae district, Kampong Cham province, is 44 years old and a widow living with one child. To earn a living for the family, she has been raising pigs for sale for about 26 years already. Ranh has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle already. She has completely repaid the past loan and it has enabled her to improve the living condition of her family progressively. 

For this cycle, she has formed a group of two to get a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. She will spend part of her loan portion to buy more piglets to raise and another part to buy pig feed. Ranh hopes that she can earn a higher income from her business so that she will be able to expand her current business next year.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Thol's Group

texts.en:
Thol is 44 years old and lives with her husband and six children in a rural village of the Moung Russey district. Rice farming and sesame growing are the only sources for her family’s income. She has been in this business for about 11 years. The current business earns her family a daily income of about 70,000 KHR, and she is able to save 50,000 KHR each day. 

This is Thol's sixth loan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Thol wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow more crops in order to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Mony's Group

texts.en:
Mony, 26, is married, with one son, residing in a rural village of the Mony district of Kampong Cham province. 

To support the family, Mony has been farming rice for eight years while her husband works as a paid worker to gain more income, to better support the family. Together, they can earn about KHR 33,000 per day and can save about KHR 16,000 each day for future needs. 

Mony has been with VisionFund Cambodia for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. 

As the leader, Mony is going to plow the rice field and use a portion of her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice to increase her family’s income, to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry has been operating his own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more than ten years and he earns well from this. Having a big family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for his four children. The couple has to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide their children with better education. 

To improve sales, Jerry would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. At an amount of PHP 30,000, he could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business. He sincerely lets you know his heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Jerry hopes that his business will grow bigger and better. He also dreams of giving his children a good and quality education.

He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week. There, he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more feed and other supplies needed to expand his product inventory.

loans.name: Gulrukhsor

texts.ru: Гулрухсор на протяжении 5 лет работает швеей. Ей 26 лет. Она замужем за предпринимателя. У них двое детей, которым по 2 и 4 года. Гулрухсор с мужем и детьми живет в районе Гиссар. Ее муж на рынке района имеет свою торговую точку и занимается там продажей детской одежды. Сейчас ему не хватает немного средств, чтобы привезти новый сезонный товар. Его жена - Гулрухсор решила помочь мужу и обратилась за кредитом. Она надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Gulrukhsor has worked as a seamstress for 5 years. She is 26 years old. She is married to a teacher. They have two children, who are 2 and 4 years old. Gulrukhsor, her husband and her children live in the Gissar region. 

Gulrukhsor's husband has a sales point at the regional market and he sells children's clothing there. Currently he does not have enough money in order to bring in new seasonal goods. His wife Gulrukhsor decided to help her husband and applied for a loan. She hopes for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase a summer collection of children's clothing for her husband to sell at the market

loans.name: Vuth's Group

texts.en:
Dambae district of Kampong Cham province is home to Vuth and her family. She is 44 years old and a mother blessed with one child. To secure the needs in her family, she grows rice and cassava as her main business, which generates about 26,400 KHR per day. This is the fourth cycle that Vuth has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has repaid her past loans completely and they have enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle at a gradual pace. 

For this cycle, she has teamed up in a group of three to get a new loan. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay the land plowing fee and labor fee for the cassava plantation. She hopes that she can earn a higher income from the agricultural business so that she will be able to expand  her cassava plantation next year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay the land plowing fee

loans.name: Sreylok's Group

texts.en:
Sreylok, a villager from Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, is a young mother of three dependent children; two under school-aged kids and one schoolchild. Two hectares of rice farming and a pig-raising business are the main sources of her family's income, and she can currently generate about 37,200 KHR per day. 

This is the second microloan for her and her joint borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely and it has improved her living conditions progressively.The two borrowers are requesting a loan of 1,100,000 KHR, of which 300,000 KHR is Sreylok's loan portion. She plans to use her portion of the loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farm. She strongly believes that the loan will enable her to get a higher yield so that in the future she will be able to have enough capital to expand the agricultural business.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Myriam Patricia

texts.es: Patricia es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos de 8, 10,13 y 20 años, de los cuales 3 viven con ella y están estudiando  y la hija mayor ya es independiente, Patricia se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, es  un año que tiene  su negocio que es una tienda, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería en productos de tienda, la meta de Patricia es seguir adelante en su negocio para tener dinero y cubrir los gastos que implica la educación y mantención de sus hijos y dice  que ese será su mayor orgullo ya que ella lucha sola por sus hijos.
texts.en:
Patricia is a single mother with four children who are 8, 10, 13 and 20 years old. Three of them live with her and are in school and the eldest daughter is already independent. Patricia works in the sale of foodstuffs and it has been a year since she began her business, which is a store. She will invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise for the store. 

Patricia's goal is to continue growing her business in order to make money and cover the expenses incurred educating and maintaining her children. She says that is her greatest pride since she struggles only for her children.

loans.use: to buy products for a general store.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando has been providing transportation services in their community for more than six years. He earns well from this aside from farming, the main source of income.  

Armando successfully repaid his previous loan, used for motorcycle  repair, from his  income. Recently, he took a new loan new to buy new tires to replace the old used tires. In the future, he wants to sustain his transportation business and wants to save his profit to use it when they get old.

loans.use: to buy new tires to replace the old used tires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition and to buy a new computer for her youngest daughter.

loans.name: Samorn's Group

texts.en:
Samorn is a villager from Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province and she is 45 years old. She is also a mother of four children. 

To strive for a living, she is growing cassava as the sole source of her household’s income, which she has done for ages. This current business has returns her about 31,900 KHR per day. 

Samorn has never before been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and now she leads a group of two for the loan. She and her co-borrower are requesting loans of the same amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for land preparing and buying cassava seedlings. She highly hopes to uplift her situation better than before.

loans.use: To pay for land preparing and to buy cassava seedlings

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao, 26, lives in a rural village of the Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district. She is a married mother of one daughter. She has been in this business for eight years to make a living. From the current business, she can earn about KHR 30,000 per day and manage to save about KHR 18,000 per day for future needs. 

Mao has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already and she completely repaid the loan. With the loan from VisionFund, she has successfully used it to better support her living. Now applying for another loan, she is going to use it to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to extend her farmland to increase her business so as to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнуре 48 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей, супруг и младший сын активно помогают по хозяйству. У Айнуры средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, она на протяжении 20 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес 8 лет назад с суммы в 4,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Айнуры в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 дойные коровы, 2 бычка, 1 теленок, 5 овец, 5 коз и 1 лошадь. Также есть земельный надел мерою 1,38 ГА, где Айнура выращивает картофель и эспарцет. Также на участке есть сад, который в сезон приносит хорошую прибыль. Ежемесячный доход Айнуры от бизнес деятельности составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айнура обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 бычка и семян картофеля элитных сортов. Доходы от кредита Айнура планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса, что позволит ей дать достойное образование младшему сыну.
texts.en:
Ainura is 48 years old, married and has two children. Her husband and the youngest son actively help her with the farming. Ainura has vocational education. As a main source of income for her family, she has worked with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation for a period of 20 years. She started a business 8 years ago with a sum of 4,000 som (KGS). 

Thanks to Ainura's persistent work, her farm currently has two dairy cows, two bulls, one calf, five sheep, five goats and one horse. She also has a plot of land of 1.38 hectares, where she grows potatoes and sainfoin. She also has a garden which brings a good seasonal profit. Ainura's monthly income from the business is around 10,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Ainura turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of 1 bull-calf and high quality potato seeds. Ainura plans to invest the income from the loan in developing the business, which will allow her to give her youngest son a decent education.

loans.use: To purchase a bull-calf and high quality potato seeds

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea, 49, is married with four children residing in a rural village located in the Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district, Cambodia. He has four children, three of whom are still in school. For the last 31 years, he has been farming rice. The current business earns him about 25,000 KHR per day. 

Chea is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now he is leading his group to apply for a loan. Chea, who is the leader, will use his portion to buy fertilizer and plow the field. He hopes to earn more income from his current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and plow the field

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase staple foodstuffs (corn, beans, rice)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, chicken, ham, cheese, spices, and more.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge owns and operates a rice retailing/wholesale business to earn a living. He has been successful in this business for seven years, and he repaid his previous loan used for the business. He also finds ways to improve his profit by generating income from his small variety store and house rental business.

Relative to this, he would like to take a new loan to increase his product inventory. He is requesting an amount of PHP 50,000 to buy more sacks of rice and other products needed in his business.

In the future, he desires to be successful in business and in life, and he also hopes for good health for his family.

He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and there, he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more sacks of rice needed in his business.

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
Carlita, a 48-year-old mother of three, helps her husband by vending fish in their village while her husband does fishing. 

For many years, the couple has been able to provide for the family.  Carlita had to be determined in her work to give adequate allowance for her children in school. In order to improve sales, she is taking a loan from GDMPC micro-credit to purchase fish to sell. She hopes that, someday, her children will be successful in their career.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргизе 24 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Наргизы среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством, стартовав в 2009 году, благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Наргизы, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 4,0 ГА поливной земли, где Наргиза выращивает перец, фасоль и клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет от 10,000 до 15,000 сом (KGS). Наргиза обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для закупки селитры для проведения весенне-полевых работ. Наргиза намерена расширить свой бизнес, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита она хочет направить на строительство сарая.
texts.en:
Nargiza is 24 years old, married and raising two children together with her husband. Nargiza has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she works with field crop cultivation, after having started this business in 2009. 

Thanks to Nargiza's perseverance, purposefulness and hard work, she currently has 4.0 hectares of irrigated land, where she grows peppers, beans and clover. The monthly income is between 10,000 and 15,000 som (KGS). 

Nargiza turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase nitrate to carry out spring work on the field. Nargiza intends to expand her business, which will certainly lead to an increase in the family's capital. She plans to use the income from the loan to build a shed.

loans.use: To buy nitrate

loans.name: Andres Dario

texts.es: A sus 22 años de juventud Dario se dedica a la elaboración de pan desde hace un año atrás, Dario se encuentra asistiendo a la universidad, dice que su tiempo lo divide para estudiar y trabajar y que su ventaja es que la panadería es familiar o sea trabaja con sus padres en una casa por la que pagan arriendo para vivir y atender su negocio ahí mismo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de harina y demás implementos para elaborar tortas y pan, Dario tiene una vida muy agitada ya que el lugar donde estudia le queda a dos horas de donde vive y así tiene que viajar diariamente, Dario espera que su esfuerzo sea compensado y mediante los ingresos de su negocio terminar su carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
At 22 years old, Dario began making bread. A year ago, Dario began attending a university and says his time is divided between studying and working. It is an advantage that the bakery is family-owned and that he works in a house his parents are renting to live in and house their business at the same time. He will invest the loan in the purchase of flour and other implements to make tortas and bread. 

Dario has a rough life and since the place where he studies is two hours from where he lives, he has to travel daily. Dario hopes that his efforts will be rewarded and with his income from his business he will be able to finish his college education.

loans.use: to buy flour.

loans.name: Nurzina

texts.ru: Нурзина, 25 лет, замужем, мать 1 ребенка. У Нурзины- среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством, стартовав в 2010 году. Благодаря целеустремленности и трудолюбию, Нурзины на сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве есть: 3 коровы, 1 бычок и 10 овец. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нурзина обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для закупки бычков, от реализации которых она сможет получить большую прибыль, что приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Нурзина планирует вложить в ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Nurzina is 25 years old, married and the mother of one child. Nurzina has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she works with livestock breeding, after having started this business in 2010. Thanks to Nurzina's purposefulness and hard work, she currently has three cows, one bull and 10 sheep. The total monthly income is around 9,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Nurzina turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase bull-calves. When reselling them, she will be able to get a large income, which will lead to an increase in the family's capital. Nurzina plans to invest the income from the loan in renovating her house.

loans.use: To purchase bull-calves

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle helps her husband with operating their own farm for a living. For more than ten years of farming, the couple earns well to provide for the family.  

She borrowed a loan to buy organic fertilizer in order to improve the rice farming that they have planned. 

In the future, she wants to ensure a better source of income to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Voz Del Rio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VOZ DEL RIO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ninfa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de fruta, producción de fruta, costura de polleras, tienda de barrio.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ninfa es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia, ya que desde niño ella apoyo a su familia y por ello conocía este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de semilla por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo cultivará en su estancia para poder comercializarlo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Voz del Rio” (Voice of the River) is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Ninfa is the president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as selling fruit, producing fruit, sewing traditional skirts, and managing a neighborhood store.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Ninfa. She says that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation from a promoter from the organization who came to her house to visit her. Ninfa currently has a business of producing fruit. She became knowledgeable about this type of work after she started the business on her own. As a young girl she helped her family, which is why she knows about the business.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying seeds in bulk. She acquires her supplies from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto and then cultivates her land so that she can sell her products. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family. Ninfa is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Ninfa said that she enjoys the training seminars offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy seeds in bulk.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a widow with five children and operates a fish-vending business to earn a living. Her many years of selling fish has earned her a good income for the family. She is determined to provide her children with a good education. They never get tired of working. She is borrowing from GDMPC micro credit to buy more fish to sell. In the future, she wants to renovate the home for the comfort of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Myanganai

texts.en: Myanganai is 51 years old and lives with family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He is a skilled crane operator who has been working for over 16 years. His wife was a laboratory technician at the public health authority before she retired. Their older son lost his ability to work from an accident and their younger son is a student. Myanganai owns an old Russian mobile-crane and is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugrigs) to buy some parts like a petrol pump, pump-barrel, and some other parts and do line maintenance on his mobile-crane.

loans.use: to buy auto parts

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora has been operating her own internet café for 10 years, and she earns well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her two children. The couple has to work hard with the determination to have better income to provide their children with a better education. 

To improve sales, Nora would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional items for business purposes. With an amount of 40,000 PHP, she can pay for maintenance and purchase another computer unit and accessories needed for her business. 

She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Nora hopes to become successful and financially free. She desires her children to finish school.

She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy computer accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to refurbish his house.

loans.name: Ban's Group

texts.en: Ban is a 60-year-old villager from the Sreysnom district of Siem Reap province. To feed the family, he grows rice as his sole source of income. He can earn 25,500 KHR per day through his business which he has had for years. He is a four-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and has completely repaid his past loans that enabled him to improve his business. For this loan, Ban is a leader of a two-member group. He is seeking a loan of 1,200,000 KHR while his joint-borrower is requesting 600,000 KHR. As the leader, he will use his loan to buy fertilizer and pay the land plowing fee. He hopes to harvest a better-than-ever crop yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay the land plowing fee

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
Kong, originally from the Phornhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, is a farmer who plants cassava and rice for income. She is married and blessed with two kids, one of school age and one under school-age. 

The business that she has had for ages has earned her a decent income. She is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loan which had a positive impact on her family. 

Now she is seeking a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is a leader. She is applying for a loan in the amount of 1,500,000 KHR and she is planning to use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava field. She hopes to gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cassava field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Athiparasakthi Shg Group

texts.en:
Athiparasakthi Self Help Group is an eight-member team operating for more than four years. The group is managed by a local NGO called “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT) in Maharajapuram village in Tamil Nadu, India. Sumathi, the leader of the group, is married and has a child. Her husband is a daily wage farm worker.   
                                                                         
The members of the group have received small loans from PAT during these four years and have been making prompt and on time payments. These loans have helped to improve the quality of their life for which they are very grateful to the NGO. 

Sumathi and her group have learned of a smokeless stove produced by Grameen Infra which is cheaper than alternative stoves and uses less fuel. In addition the stove can reduce indoor air pollution and provide a safe and healthy environment for their families. This is very important for them because most group members’ young children spend substantial amounts of time in and around the kitchen.

A Kiva loan can not only help provide this stove for eight group members, but also provide a healthier living space for their family.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition and buy educational equipment for her son

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Being a responsible mother, Marilyn has been engaged in buying and reselling vegetables, pork, and chicken barbecue within her community to supplement her husband's income. 

She operates their motorcycle transport to sell those products within the local community. She aims to make her business more profitable to sustain their necessities and support the schooling of her children. 

Marilyn plans to acquire more stock of the said products to sell, but she has limited capital. For this reason, she wants to take a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase the additional stock of the said products to resell. 

Through her patience and hard work, she believes that she will further improve the business with this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables, pork, and chicken barbecue to sell

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en: Natividad owns and operates a general store, selling food and daily use products in her village to make a living. She has many customers and over the years has improved her ability to engage in business. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. With her income, Natividad was able to start a pig-fattening business that adds income for the family. She took a new loan recently to purchase pig feeding supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase pig feeding supplies.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma started operating her own farm a number of years ago. This loan will be used to pay for the labor costs of planting and cultivating her farm. 

This will allow her to make her farm greener in order to gain more produce. This loan will result in higher farm production and a higher income for Emma.

Emma tells us that her biggest desire is to continue working at her farm, improving and expanding it. By doing this, she will have more financial stability and can enjoy a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for the labor costs of planting and cultivating her farm

loans.name: Ma. Dulia

texts.en:
Ma. Dulia previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used buy corn to sell. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan for her to purchase additional quantities of corn needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Dulia dreams of excellence in business and life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay back micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for corn, needed in her business

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
Neang is a 40-year-old and a mother of two kids. She resides in Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. 

Neang struggles for a living with rice farming as her main source of income for 20 years. This current business has returned her 27,600 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for her with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, and she leads a group of three. She is seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR, and she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for the land preparation fee. 

Neang hopes to expand her business to a larger scale and to support her kids' studies to a higher level.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for the land preparation fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Ohmsakthi Shg Group

texts.en:
