Muthulakshmi is the leader of “Ohmsakthi” Self-Help Group (SHG) managed by the local NGO “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT), which provides micro finance loans. She has been receiving PAT’s support for the last few years.  

Muthulakshmi is married to a mason and is living in Palinjiyanallur, a small village in Trichy District. She is 44 years old and has five children.

Muthulakshmi has recently learned about the Greenway Smart Stove, a sustainable stove that that reduces smoke emissions up to 70%, resulting in better long-term health due to decreased inhalation of poisonous gases. Her group seeks a Kiva loan to buy this stove for a better quality of life for their families.

Muthulakshmi and the eight other members of this self-help group are extremely excited about the possibility of saving on fuel and having less smoke emission in their houses.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Parasakthi Shg Group

texts.en:
The Parasakthi Self-Help Group is managed by the local NGO “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT). The group is made up of five industrious women who have been receiving micro-finance loans from PAT for the last three years. These loans have been extremely helpful in developing a better quality of life and the weaving activity they have undertaken. These loans allowed group members to increase their income and they are very prompt in repaying the loans.   

Thiruvidaimaruthur is a village in Trichy District of Tamil Nadu, India. Here is Viji (standing, hand raised), the leader of the Parasakthi Self-Help Group who  lives with her husband Gowtham and three children. Her spouse is a driver by trade and her children are studying in school. Viji has completed her schooling till 7th grade.
 
Group members are seeking a Kiva loan in order to purchase a smokeless stove manufactured by Grameen Infra. This stove would result in long-term savings due to less money spent on fuel and would be less hazardous to their health due to reduced smoke emissions.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Hue

texts.en: Mrs. Hue is 34 years old, married and has three children. She lives in rural area and raising poultry and cattle are her main job, which she has been doing for more than 10 years. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine in order to improve her living standard, especially her children.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Mrs. Loan is 46 years old. She is married and has five children, so she works very hard to provide for them. Husbandry and fishing are the main income of her family. With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve her family living standard as well as environment protection.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Thoan

texts.en: Mrs. Thoan is 51 years old. There are five people in her family. Fishing is the main income source of her family. She can cover her family’s daily cost and education from selling fish, which her husband caught. With this loan, she can build a hygienic latrine to improve the living conditions and health of her family.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Le

texts.en: Mrs. Le is 38 years old. She is married and has three children. Fishing is main income of her family. She sells fish and has been in this business for 10 years. She has also daily income from garden such as chicken, duck and vegetable. She is interested in improving the living standard for her family so she really needs the loan to build a toilet.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Luan

texts.en: Mrs. Luan is a hardworking woman, 26 years old. She is married and has a baby. Her family’s income is mainly from small business and fishing. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family members. With support from her husband, she will be able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To buld the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new computer for her son

loans.name: Virginia Manuela

texts.es:
La socia Virginia  pertenece SIEMPRE UNIDOS, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Virginia tiene 56 años de edad, casada y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de cafetería, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende café, leche, hamburguesas, galletas entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de gaseosas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member, Virginia, belongs to "Siempre Unidos". This bank is located in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

The member, Virginia, is 56 years old. She is married and has two children. She alternates her daily activities with running a cafe business. She has been in this business for a good amount of time, and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into it daily. She sells coffee, milk, hamburgers, cookies, and other items to the customers who seek them. Virginia wishes to be able to continue working so that she can continue to support her family in this way. 

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of soft drinks, among other items. 

The member feels grateful for the loan offered and is committed to meeting her established payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, among other items.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is responsible and dedicated to her work as a tailor. She has a business producing school uniforms and carrying out repairs to clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive.

She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons, and sewing supplies. 

This loan will allow her to generate more income and to be able to provide tailoring services.

loans.use: to buy additional textiles, buttons, and sewing supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments and peanuts

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is a 23-year-old married woman who lives with her family in Misamis, Occidental, Philippines. For more than a year, Rosalinda was able to run a fish-vending business while her husband did fishing. Until now, the business was doing well with sufficient cash flow to cover the family's day-to-day expenses. Her first loan application from the cooperative has been approved. The loan is intended to buy a variety of fish to sell. Rosalinda expects an increase in sales to expand her business and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel earned well from raising pigs so he was able to put up capital for his transportation service business. He had successfully repaid his previous loan used to renovate his pigs' shelter. He is thankful to GDMPC for the financial assistance to help his business. He took out a new loan recently to buy motorcycle accessories to improve his transportation services. In the future, Daniel wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle accessories to improve his transportation services

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business by increasing her stock.

loans.name: Sudar Shg Group

texts.en:
Banumathi (the lady who is standing with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of “Sudar” Self-Help Group (SHG), which PAT has been supporting with loans over the last five years. With the loans the borrowers have improved their livelihood. Through training given by the NGO, these women are empowered and they are becoming morally strong.  
 
Banumathi lives in a small hamlet in a rural area, Thiruvidaimaruthur, in Trichy District. She is married to Panjabikesan and they have three children who are all going to local school. They live in a house with a thatched roof. Her husband is a farmer by trade.
           
Now Banumathi has planned to buy a smokeless stove for her kitchen for which she is asking for a loan from Kiva. This will help her to have a good environment with fresh air in her house. 

The other four diligent women are also seeking a loan to buy a smokeless stove. All are looking forward to getting this Kiva loan to purchase a smokeless stove to use in their kitchen.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more grocery stock

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 61 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.  She has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Jasmin would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Rossana

texts.en:
Rossana works hard to support her family. 

She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rossana has been in this business for three years.

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase an additional fishing net for her business.

In the future, Rossana would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net for her business

loans.name: Mercedes Viviana

texts.es: Vivana es una chica de 21 años de edad, ella se dedica desde hace 5 años a vender productos por pedido y por catalogo, Viviana también trabaja ayudando a sus padres en  su negocio que es elaboración de pan en su casa y cuando ya está  listo este producto sale a repartirlo y a ofrecerlo de tienda en tienda, Viviana va a invertir el crédito en la compra de productos de belleza y uso personal para ofrecerlo de puerta en puerta y a sus clientes, ella aspira en algún momento ponerse un local de estos productos para salir adelante y seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Viviana is a 21-year-old young woman. She has been working for five years selling products through orders and by catalogue. Viviana also works helping her parents in their business. They bake bread in their home, and when it is ready she goes out to distribute it and sell it from store to store. 

Viviana will invest this loan into the purchase of beauty products and personal care products to sell door-to-door and to her customers. She hopes to someday have a storefront to sell these products from in order to get ahead and continue her studies.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Oumy

texts.fr:
Oumy est une femme âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 02 garçons. Elle fait comme activité principale de l'embouche bovine et porcine. Elle va acheter 02 bœufs à 175 000 F l'unité et les revendre à 300 000 F l'un. Elles achète aussi 10 cochons de lait à 18 000 F l'un. Elle les élève et les revend à 25 000 F l'unité. Le reste de l'argent va servir à couvrir les frais vétérinaires et l'alimentation du bétail. 
Les bénéfices vont servir à la scolarisation de ses enfants et aussi aux besoins familiaux (soins médicaux et alimentation).
texts.en: Oumy is a 39-year-old woman who is a married mother of seven children, including two boys. Her main work involves fattening cattle and pigs. She is going to purchase two head of cattle at 175,000 francs each and resell them at 300,000 francs each. She is also purchasing ten suckling pigs at 18,000 francs each. She raises and resells them at 25,000 francs each. The rest of the money will be used to cover the veterinarian and feed costs. The profits will be used for the children’s education and also to meet family expenses (healthcare and food).

loans.use: to fatten cattle and pigs

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
La socia Luz María  pertenece SIEMPRE UNIDOS, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Luz María tiene 44 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de frutas como platanos,manzanas entre otros, la socia distribuye su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, a la vez la socia trabaja para una institución pública, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito parta la compra de frutas como plátanos.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member, Luz María, belongs to "Siempre Unidos". This bank is located in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

Luz María is 44 years old. She has a partner and two children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling fruit, such as bananas, apples and other fruits. She distributes her merchandise to her customers who seek it. She has spent a good amount of time in this business and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts in every day. The member also works for a public institution. She wants to be able to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family. 

Luz María is requesting this loan in order to purchase fruit, such as bananas. She feels grateful for the loan offered and is committed to meeting her payment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase fruits like bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments and staple foods

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, provincia La Convención y departamento Cusco.
La socia Nidia tiene 28 años tiene 02 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, a la vez la socia se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros para su tienda de abarrotes.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Nidia is a member of the Communal Bank “Komoyganakera Maganiroigi” which is located in the District of Echarate in La Convención Province, Department of Cusco. She is 28 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. Nidia divides her time between her daily activities and her farming duties. She has been devoted to her business for a long time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work. Nidia also manages a grocery store. She wants to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family.

Nidia is requesting a loan in order to buy rice, sugar, milk, and other products for her grocery store. She appreciates the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and other products for her grocery business.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is 64 years old and lives in Ticwas, Dumalinao, ZDS. She is married with four children.                   

Lucresia has a shop that sells a variety of fish. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan to buy 10 boxes of fish.                                                                                        

Lucresia has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Lucresia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy 10 boxes of fish

loans.name: Merly Magaly

texts.es:
Merly es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 21 años de edad, vive en Lurin con su familia.
Tiene una hija maravillosa por quien lucha constantemente para poder brindarle un futuro mejor.
Desde hace varios años trabaja como ayudante de cocina en un restaurante, le va muy bien porque es una persona trabajadora, responsable, siempre dedicada a su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
Merly está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar un televisor para que su familia pueda disfrutar momentos agradables juntos y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida. Con esto ella seguirá esforzándose para poder cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Merly is an enterprising woman. She is 21 years old and lives with her family in Lurin. Merly has a wonderful daughter, so she is striving constantly to provide a better future for her.

For several years, Merly has been working as a kitchen assistant in a restaurant. She is doing very well because she is a hardworking and responsible person who is always dedicated to her work. Merly also has tremendous drive to succeed.

She is grateful to the Kiva lenders because of the assistance they have provided. Merly will be able to buy a television for her family so that they can enjoy pleasant moments together. This will also improve their quality of life. Merly continues to strive toward accomplishing her goals.

loans.use: to buy a television.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara is a 22-year-old entrepreneur living in Zimbabwe’s Gokwe South District. Clara also runs a flea market business selling clothes, bags and shoes. She started her business in 2012 when she finished school to support her three siblings. She is very proud of what she has achieved so far in her business and would like to expand it. With the Kiva loan, Clara will purchase clothes and other stock for her stall to improve her sales volume and profits. She hopes to raise enough money to continue with her education and continue supporting her siblings.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and other stock for her stall to improve her sales volume and profits.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 52 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Elisa has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Elisa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Sevvanthi Shg Group

texts.en:
Jayanthi is the leader of “Sevvanthi” Self Help group which is managed by the local NGO “PAT”. This group contains five members from the same locality, Maharajapuram village, Tamil Nadu. The lady who is sitting in the picture is Jayanthi. She is 38 years old and married to Mr. Gunasekar who is a farmer. They have three children and live in their own house.  

The group have been receiving loans from “PAT” under micro-finance for the last five years to develop their livelihood. And they have repaid their loans successfully. 

Now all the members decided to buy smokeless stoves because they have lower firrewood consumption, so there is less need to cut trees for firewood. This increases green cover and reduces carbon emissions and indoor air pollution levels. 

The group is requesting a loan from Kiva. This loan will help the group members to create a good environment in their surroundings.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open a shop and purchase more grocery products

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is a 19-year-old mother of one, living in Zimbabwe’s Gokwe South District. 

She has been successfully operating a grocery shop at the local business center, selling items such as cooking oil, salt, and other household goods. Through her entrepreneurship and determination to succeed, Jacqueline has become an inspiration to many young people in her community. She volunteers at the local secondary school as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills to students. She hopes to expand her business into a larger store one day.  

Jacqueline will use the Kiva loan to purchase stocks to improve sales volume and profits.

loans.use: to purchase stocks to improve sales volume and profits.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Die

texts.fr:
Dié, âgée de 46 ans est célibataire. Elle fait comme activité principale la restauration dans les marchés hebdomadaires. En parallèle, elle fait le commerce de chaussures. Elle achète 07 sacs d'oignons à 13 000 F l'unité; 05 sacs de riz à 16 500 F l'unité; 04 bidons d'huile de 20 Litres à 16 500 F l'unité; 05 sacs de pommes de terres à 18 000 F l'unité; 50 poulets à 2500 F l'unité. Elle revend le plat entre 500 F et 1000 F. Elle achète 50 paires de chaussures à 2500 F la paire et revend la paire à 3000 F.
Avec les bénéfices générés, elle envisage de construire sa maison et aussi répondre à ses propres besoins. les bénéfices vont aussi lui servir à participer à des tontines qui l'aident beaucoup dans ses activités.
texts.en:
Dié, aged 46, is unmarried. Her main work involves a restaurant at the weekly markets. In parallel, she does commerce in shoes. She is purchasing seven sacks of onions at 13,000 francs each; five sacks of rice at 16,500 francs each; four 20-liter containers of oil at 16,500 francs each; five sacks of potatoes at 18,000 francs each; and fifty chickens at 2,500 francs each. She sells a dish of food at 500 to 1,000 francs. She is purchasing 50 pairs of shoes at 2,500 francs a pair to resell at 3,000 francs a pair. 

With the profits generated, she envisions building her own house and also supporting herself. The profits will also be used to help her participate in tontines, which help her a lot in her work.

loans.use: to run a restaurant

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en: Marietta is 54, married and blessed with four children. They live in a rural community and makes their living through farming. To have additional income, Marietta raises hogs within their community. She aims to raise more hogs to sell but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she would like to avail of a loan of PHP 6,000.00 to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines needed for hog-raising. She believes that her loan will be a great help for her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines needed for hog-raising

loans.name: Vecenta

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Vecenta works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling corn.  Vecenta is borrowing PHP 27000 through NWTF to purchase additional coconut wine to sell for her coconut wine vending business.

Vecenta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 41 years old and married with seven children.  With four children in school, Cristina works very hard to provide for them.

Cristina runs a nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa leaves, bamboo, etc for her business.

Cristina has been in this business for 9 years.

In the future Cristina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa leaves, bamboo, etc for her business

loans.name: Thach's Group

texts.en:
A 28-year-old citizen from Kong Meas District of Kampong Cham province, Thach is a mother of three kids; one is in school and two are too young for schooling. Her main source of income to feed the family is from rice and bean farming. She can earn extra income via a fish-catching business. She has been involved with this business for nine years and she earns an income of around 34,600 KHR per day. 

Now, Thach is seeking a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is the leader of a group consisting of two. For this cycle, Thach is a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her loans have been fully repaid successfully and it has enabled her to cover her daily cost of living and to keep her kid in school. Thach is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR; it is the same amount of her joint-borrower. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and gasoline for her rice farmland. She hopes to collect more rice so that she can increase her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline for her rice farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Diena

texts.en:
Diena is 51 years old and married with two children, one of whom in school, Diena works very hard to provide for them.

Diena runs a nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Diena has been in this business for 6 years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her nipa roofing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Ruth Wambui's Group

texts.en: This is a group promising group of entrepreneurs working as independent distributors of energy efficient stoves and solar lamps in a large slum in Nairobi. Despite having little to no education, these men and women have taken it upon themselves to find a venture that not only helps them make their way out of poverty but also brings positive externalities to their community. Their peers on the other hand sit around the streets of Nairobi engaging in illegal activities. In order to keep their enterprises growing, these young individuals will use this loan to finance inventory to take their sales to the next level.

loans.use: To purchase energy efficient stoves for sale

loans.name: Ha

texts.en: Mrs. Ha is a hardworking woman, 26 years old. She is married and has three children. She has operated a fish selling business for the past three years. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the living condition and health for her family, especially her children. Her income is mainly from business and fishing and she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Las Estrellitas (Flat) Group

texts.es:
En un municipio de México, se festeja a Santa Teresa De Limas con una mis a la que asisten casi todos los habitantes del pueblo, se lanzan fuegos artificiales, se organiza un torneo de futbol y, por supuesto, un paseo de la Santa por la calle principal.

La actividad principal en este lugar es la agricultura: los habitantes se dedican a la siembra de caña, hule(de donde se obtiene resina de árbol), nanche y maderas preciosas. Es una comunidad de raíces cristianas, resulta sorprendente ver como las mujeres también trabajan en campo y apoyan a sus esposos, es por eso el nombre del grupo “Las Estrellitas” conformado por 5 mujeres trabajadoras teniendo cada una de ellas una actividad económica productiva.
Maribel-Venta de tortillas Hechas a Mano, Maricela-Venta De Pollo, Marina-Venta De Donas, Margarita-Venta De Producto Berteware e Isabel-Venta de Tacos.

Doña Isabel se ha dedicado desde hace ya 3 años a la venta de tacos los fines de semana, con las ganancias ha apoyado a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, de igual  manera a sus hijas, es una señora alegre, amable, quien decidió pedir nuevamente un préstamo para comprar carne, chiles, comal taquero,gas,verduras, sillas pues venderá tacos de bistec, longaniza, etc. Con sus ganancias cubrirá en tiempo y forma los pagos del préstamo y buscara la manera de ampliar mas la taquería, comenta que también ayuda a su esposo en el campo.
texts.en:
In a municipality of Mexico, Santa Teresa de Limas is celebrated with a party that almost everyone in the community attends. They set off fireworks, organize a football tournament, and, of course, there is a parade for the Saint on the main street.

The main activity in this region is agriculture. The inhabitants work growing sugar cane, rubber (where tree resin is obtained), nance and quality woods. It is a community with Christian roots, which is surprising seeing as how the women also work in the fields to support their spouses. It's for this reason that the savings group is called "Las Estrellitas". It is made up of five working women, each of whom has a productive economic activity. 

Maribel sells handmade tortillas, Maricela sells chickens, Marina sells doughnuts, Margarita sells Berteware products and Isabel sells tacos.

Doña Isabel has worked for three years selling tacos on the weekends. With her earnings she has been able to support her spouse with their household expenses along with her daughters. She is a happy, friendly woman who decided to request another loan in order to buy meat, chiles, a taco grill, gas, vegetables and chairs, which she will use to sell steak tacos, sausage, etc. With her earnings she will cover her loan payments over time and seek out ways to expand the taqueria more. She mentioned that she also assists her spouse out in the field.

loans.use: to purchase meat, chiles, chairs, gas, vegetables and a taco grill.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros owns and operates a food stall business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for fifteen years. She repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income like having her own variety store which also supports their everyday needs and expenditures.

Relative to this, Milagros would like to take a new loan to increase her product inventory. She is requesting an amount of PHP 50,000 to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings needed in her business. She would also add items for her 'sari-sari' store. More items displayed should result to better profit.

In the future she wants to make improvements to her storehouse and dreams of good health for her family.

Every week she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients, like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 47-year-old married woman. She settled in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, together with her family, to earn her living . Over the past two years, Grace was able to put up a service based business with the help of her husband. The business is still doing well and is giving cash inflow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures. 

Grace joined GDMPC and have an easy access to financial services. Her first loan application from the cooperative has been approved. The money taken is intended to cover the school expenses of her children. Grace expects an increase in income in order to  improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to cover the school expenses of her children

loans.name: Nobuhle T

texts.en:
Nobuhle is a 22-year-old mother of two. She lives in Gokwe South District in Zimbabwe where she has been successfully selling clothes for over a year and a half from her home. Nobuhle also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide assisting students with learning and encouraging them to stay in school. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Nobuhle will buy more shirts, jeans, trousers, shoes, tops, dresses and skirts to boost her sales and profits. With the additional profits she hopes to expand by opening a stall at the local flea market. Nobuhle is planning to improve her standard of living and further her education.

loans.use: To buy more shirts, jeans, trousers, shoes, tops, dresses and skirts to boost her sales and profits.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support her family. Editha is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Editha has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Editha would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en: Thy’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Thy makes a living cultivating rice with his family and he also does extra work as a farm laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of member of the group to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Lan's Group

texts.en: Lan’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Lan makes a living cultivating rice and her son also does extra work as a farm laborer to support the family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Sokum's Group

texts.en: Sokum’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sokum makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yeng's Group

texts.en: Yeng’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Yeng makes a living cultivating rice with her family and she also does extra work as a farm laborer and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Kimly's Group

texts.en: Kimly’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Kimly makes a living cultivating rice with her family and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Chanry's Group

texts.en: Chanry’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Chanry makes a living cultivating rice with her family and her son also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Saman's Group

texts.en: Saman’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Saman makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en: Sreymom’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sreymom makes a living cultivating rice and raising ducks with her family, she also does extra work selling groceries from home to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yoem's Group

texts.en: Yoem’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Yoem makes a living cultivating rice and her son also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each member of the group to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Gretchen Faith

texts.en:
Gretchen is a micro entrepreneur from Coron, Palawan, Philippines. Coron is one of the tourist spots in the Philippines that was hit by typhoon Haiyan last November 2013. Months after the typhoon Gretchen and her family are still recovering and are positive they will have a better future. She is married to Edieson, a van operator, and they have a child. They both work hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Gretchen operates a salon business. She offers hair styling, hair grooming and like services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Her salon is located adjacent to her house. She earns a minimum of 700 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business she is requesting a Php 35,000 loan. She will utilize the loan to buy supplies for her salon like shampoo, hair treatment creams and oils, etc.

Gretchen hopes to have additional services in her salon and dreams to give her child a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for supplies for her salon like shampoo, hair treatment creams and oils, etc.

loans.name: Luz Y Vida Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ Y VIDA” iniciará el vigésimo quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de salteñas, taller de tapicería, taller de carpintería, venta de ropa interior, venta de api, venta de pescado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su esposo que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de tapicería; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento hace varios años al lado de su pareja y con la guía de su hermano quien ya conocía de la forma de trabajo. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cuero por mayor) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido de la clienta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el compartir su encuentro con sus compañeras de la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Luz Y Vida” (Light and Life) is starting its 25th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. María is the president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as selling meat turnovers, managing an upholstery shop, managing a carpentry shop, selling undergarments, selling “api” (a beverage made from purple corn), and selling fish.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. María. She says that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation from her husband, who is a client of the organization. María currently has an upholstery business. She became knowledgeable about this type of work when she and her partner started the business several years ago. With guidance from her brother, María learned how to do the work.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying leather in bulk. She acquires her supplies from stores in the city of El Alto and then uses them to fulfill orders from her customers. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family. María is in a common-law relationship and has one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, María said that she enjoys sharing her experiences with the other members of the organization.

loans.use: to buy leather in bulk.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
This is Elsie. She owns and operates a variety store business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for five years and she has repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income by offering electronic load service and by selling SIM (Subscriber identity module) cards, and also ice cold water.

Relative to this she would like to take a new loan to increase her product inventory. She is requesting an amount of PHP 12,000 to buy a larger quantity and variety of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

In the future Elsie desires to improve the general living conditions of her family.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a 39 year old male.  He is married and has four children who all attend school. Amos is a teacher by profession and owns a retail shop as an additional income source. Helping society and teachers’ intelligence is what inspired him to join the service.  Amos intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children despite the challenge of a low salary that affects teachers in general.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 57 years old.  She is married and has eight children, one of whom is in school, Elisa works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc.  Elisa has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Elisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Mamerta

texts.en:
Mamerta is 51 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Mamerta  requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

Mamerta has been raising pigs for 5 years now and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Ha

texts.en: Mrs. Ha is a hardworking woman, 29 years old. She is married and has a baby. She needs loan to build a sanitation latrine to improve health of her family members and also for environmental protection. She is a teacher and her husband is a worker so they have regular monthly income to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make bulk purchases to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make bulk purchases of chicks, vaccines and feed to boost production.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail is 24 years old, from Gokwe South, Zimbabwe. She works hard as an entrepreneur to provide for her two children whom she loves so much. Abigail has been successfully running her business selling clothes door-to-door in the community since 2013. She sells pants, shirts, skirts and dresses. 

Abigail also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in schools within the community. As a Learner Guide she teaches life skills to students and encourages them to stay in school. With the requested Kiva loan, Abigail will increase her stock of trousers, shirts, skirts, baby wear, jackets, shoes and dresses to boost her sales and profits. She hopes to be financially stable and support her family at all times.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing

loans.name: Lemison

texts.en:
Lemison raises chickens in a small village in Kapiri Mposhi District, Zambia. He is requesting a loan for a maize mill to provide a maize milling service to over 200 families in his community.

The maize milling machine takes raw maize (corn) and creates a maize flour which is the staple food in Zambia. Most rural families in Kapiri Mposhi District grow maize on their small farms and store it and use it as their primary supply of food for the year. After the kernels are removed from the cob, they then have to be milled to create flour, which can then be boiled to make what is locally called Nshima. While only 29 years old, Lemison is already a well-respected member in his community and wants to expand his business to offer the maize milling service. 

Rent-to-Own has done market research in Lemison’s community and has determined that the location for this equipment is ideal. The closest maize mill is over 13 km away, but is often broken down. This means most potential customers have to travel to other villages, and since most will walk or use their bicycles to travel to the maize mill, it is certain they will prefer to use this maize mill rather than traveling a longer distance. 

Equipment such as a maize mill can be a major boost for many enterprising farmers and rural business owners such as Lemison, as it allows for him to diversify his business. Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a maize mill are very prohibitive. Once he secures a loan, Lemison will be able to get a maize mill from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to his farm, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it. 

This loan will help Lemison on the path to building up a viable business that can provide for his family and community throughout the year.

loans.use: to obtain a maize milling machine

loans.name: Dionisia Deneisse

texts.en:
Dionisia lives in the community of Charco Seco in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. She is a farmer (potato), age 26 years who lives with her husband and two children.  Her husband is a municipal office employee.    It is clear that Dionisia works hard to maintain her family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity.   
The family currently illuminates their home with kerosene lamps because the electrical utility grid does not reach this rural area.  She mentioned that she hopes to improve education of children because they will be able to do their homework with better lighting, and assisting production activities in the home and to improve living conditions for her family, Dionisia is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras.

loans.use: To buy a solar energy system for her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy flower pots, seedlings and fresh flowers for bulk sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bales of second hand shoes

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Mrs. Loan is 33 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a small house. Her family’s income is mainly from fishing and husbandry. With this loan, she can build a hygienic latrine to improve her family’s living standard, especially her children.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Thu

texts.en: Mrs. Thu is 43 years old, married and has three children. She works hard to support her family. She would like to improve her family’s living standard, especially her children but lacks the necessary capital. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine and she is able to repay the loan from selling chicken, duck, pig and vegetables.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
For almost five years, Letecia has operated a business, selling biscuits, cookies, and dried fish and she earns well from this. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of putting up new businesses.

To improve sales, Letecia would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional items and goods to sell. With an amount of PHP 20,000, she could purchase more quantities and varieties of biscuits and dried fish needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance, in advance.

In the future, Letecia hopes that her business will continue to cover her everyday needs and that she will always be able to help her family.

Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of biscuits and dried fish needed for her business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is 55 years old, married and has four children. To provide their daily basic needs, Imelda is selling laundry soap in their village. Her husband grows rice in their field. Imelda also manages a hog raising business as her family additional source of income. She has been eight years in raising pigs and usually invests her income in farming. Imelda wants to continue operating her hog raising business and further provide for their farm needs. For this purpose, Imelda is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy piglets to raise and feed for the hogs. Imelda aims for the growth of her both businesses.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and feed for the hogs.

loans.name: Jesus Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Jesús sufrió por 5 años el flagelo del desplazamiento forzado a causa de la violencia. Estuvo rodando por muchos municipios del departamento de Antioquia soportando múltiples inclemencias y desvelos.
Un día se despertó cansado de tanto rodar y caminar sin rumbo y decidió regresar a su tierra en San Rafael, Antioquia y allí inicio un negocio de venta de frutas y jugos naturales.
Actualmente tiene un negocio bien reconocido en el sector y trabaja todos los días con el afán de buscar recursos para su sostenimiento.
El solicita un préstamo para realizarle el mantenimiento a su puesto de trabajo comprando pintura y una carpa.
Estos elementos le permitirán mejorar su puesto de trabajo y lo hará mucho más atractivo ante sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jesús suffered for five years the scourge of forced displacement due to violence. He was wandering through many municipalities in the Department of Antioquia bearing many hard times and worries. One day he woke up tired of so much roaming and wandering aimlessly. He decided to return to his home in San Rafael, Antioquia and there he started a business selling fruit and natural juices. 

He currently has a well known business in the sector and works every day with the desire to strive for resources to sustain himself. He is requesting a loan to buy paint and a canopy in order to perform maintenance on his workplace. These things will allow him to improve his workplace and will make it much more attractive to his customers.

loans.use: To buy paint and a canopy to perform maintenance on his workplace.

loans.name: Normally

texts.en: Normally is a 20-year-old businesswoman who runs a retail shop in Gokwe South, Zimbabwe. She devotes her time to assisting the elderly in her community who do not have anyone to care for them. She is also a Camfed Learner Guide at the local school, where she teaches life skills to students. Normally operates a retail shop, selling products such as shoes, slippers, shirts, t-shirts, trousers, skirts, baby clothes and jewelry to the community. She intends to use the Kiva loan to increase her stock and improve sales. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothing and improve her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more kapenta (dried sardines) to sell.

loans.name: Deab's Group

texts.en:
Deab is 61 years old living with her husband and five children in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district. Rice farming is the only source for her family’s income and she has been farming rice. The current business earns her family the daily income of about 60,000 KHR, but she is able to save 25,000 KHR each day. 
This is the third loan for Deab with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to plow the field. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to plow the field

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock

texts.en: Tal’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Tal makes a living cultivating rice with his family and he also does extra work as a farm laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of member of the group to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.
