loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda is 24 years old. As a mother of three living in the Gokwe South District of Zimbabwe, Brenda works hard at her poultry business to support her family. She has been successfully running a poultry project for over 18 months, selling chicken to the local community with the help of her family. She started the business with batches of 25 broiler birds every 6 weeks, and she has since increased her capacity to 100. Brenda also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching students life skills at the local secondary school. With the requested Kiva loan, Brenda will make bulk purchases of chicks, feed and vaccines to increase her productive capacity and boost her profits. With the additional profits, she hopes to expand her business into laying hens in order to enter the egg market. This will enable Brenda to support her family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To make bulk purchases of chicks, feed and vaccines to increase her production capacity and boost her profits.

loans.name: Wadzanai

texts.en:
Wadzanai is a 23-year-old single businesswoman. She resides in Gokwe South District, Zimbabwe. In her spare time, Wadzanai volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well-being of students by enhancing their learning environment. 

Wadzanai also rents a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits and jewelry. She has been running this business for half a year now and it has enabled her to support her family.  With the Kiva loan, Wadzanai will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and jewelry to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring financial stability to her life and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy more bags, clothing and jewelry to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nanh's Group

texts.en: Nanh’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Nanh makes a living cultivating rice with her family and she also does extra work as a construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Paula

texts.en:
Paula lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. She is a farmer (potato and corn), age 46 years who lives with her husband and six children.  Her husband is a farmer too, and they work together. It is clear that Paula works hard to maintain her family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity.   
The family currently illuminates their home with kerosene lamps because the electrical utility grid does not reach this rural area.  She mentioned that she hopes to improve education of children because they will be able to do their homework with better lighting, and assisting production activities in the home and to improve living conditions for her family, Paula is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras.

loans.use: To buy a solar energy system for her home

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en: Mao’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Mao makes a living cultivating rice and doing extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe is a farmer (corn and potatoes), age 56 years who lives with his spouse and 5 children.  His spouse is a homemaker.   
It is clear that Felipe works hard to maintain his/her family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity.   The family currently illuminates their home with kerosene lamps the electrical utility grid does not reach this rural area.  The kerosene lamps, which must be lit by striking a match, produce substantial contamination in the house, present a risk of fire and produce a very low level of lighting. 
He mentioned that he hopes to be able to charge his cell phone which is important for communication and he is concerned about the kerosene fumes.   To improve living conditions for his family, Felipe is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras.  With this system the illumination in the house will be with highly efficient and long life LED lamps.  With electrical light it is much easier to study and other activities are much more pleasant, such as cooking in the kitchen or gathering the family at the dinner table or in the living room. The solar electric system can power a television and radio which provide entertainment, news and education in this rural area providing better access to information from within the country and around the world. The system can also maintain the charge in a cellular telephone to allow essential communications from this rural area.
In addition to the reduction of toxic fumes from kerosene lamps, the solar electric system reduces the family’s energy costs by eliminating the cost of kerosene, the cost of dry cell batteries for radios and the cost of cell phone charging with related cost of transport to an urban center for charging.  These savings will provide Felipe a return on his investment in the solar electric system.  The solar panel has a 25 year warranty. Soluz Honduras installs, guarantees, and maintains the system to assure that the benefits will continue for many years. 
A positive global environmental impact of this investment is the reduction of carbon dioxide emissions (0.25 tons per year) that results from the elimination of kerosene consumption.

loans.use: To buy a solar energy system for his home

loans.name: Voeng's Group

texts.en: Voeng’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Voeng makes a living cultivating rice with her family and she also does extra work as a construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Francisca Garcia Emiliano's Group

texts.en:
Francisca is 39 years old and lives with her husband and her four beloved children in the state of Guerrero, in the community of Pueblo Hidalgo. Besides being a loving mother and a housewife, Francisca works in the afternoons with her friend Josefina in a small Mexican food restaurant, selling food to local people and tourists searching for traditional Mexican food and even tough their restaurant has grid access, Francisca has to use candles during nighttime because of the grid bad service with constant blackouts and high monthly fee. This forces Francisca keep cooking until her last candle goes out while she, Josefina and their children breathe hazardous smoke.

Francisca has cooked all her life, is an activity she enjoys because “is her best way to tell her family she loves them. Each dish is made with passion and love”. That’s why Francisca doesn’t want to keep cooking while breathing the candles smoke and paying for a bad grid service. She has dreamed on acquiring a solar home system that will allow her stop relying on non-renewable lighting sources and loosing almost all her income in monthly fees, by doing these she would be able to cook more hours and spend time with her 4 beautiful children.

loans.use: A portion of Francisca  and Josefina's group loan helps a member stop relying on a bad quality grid access and start using renewable energy sources.

location.town: Pueblo Hidalgo, San Luis Acatlán, Guerrero

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandría tiene 66 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive con sus hijos y su madre, en casa propia, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayalti y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos, se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, desde hace varios años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismo y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Alejandría is 66 years old, is married, and lives with her children and her mother in her own house in a large community in the urban area of Cayalti. She enjoys good personal and work references from her neighbors who make a living in agriculture, trade and livestock, located in the Province of Chiclayo which is part of the Lambayeque Region on the north coast of Peru.

For several years, she has made a living raising and selling small animals. Her business is located in the rear part of her home. She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles to buy balanced food to fatten her animals and in this way generate greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced food to fatten her animals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: A portion of Timoteo, Alma and María Guadalupe's group loan helps each member acquire a solar home system to extend their productive hours during nighttime.

loans.name: Maria Alicia Del Socorro Gollaz's Group

texts.en:
María Alicia, Romulada and Juan Manuel live in a community nearby Tuxpan, Veracruz. María Alicia is 57 years old, and she is a proud farmer. Since her childhood his father taught her three brothers and her to love and respect the soil. That’s why María married Justino, a man that also loves farming and together they harvest maize and beans to self-consumption and selling, they work hard to save money for their three sons education. Nevertheless, María Alicia´s home does not have grid access; this situation forces them to pay $35 USD monthly to buy candles and light their nighttime hours to select the best seeds and to extend their children studying hours. 

María Alicia knows that she can achieve anything by being persevering and by working hard; therefore she has made a plan: buy a solar home system that will allow her little kids stop breathing the candles smoke, have more study hours to improve their education and improve her family quality life.

loans.use: A portion of María, Romulda and Juan Manuel's group loan helps a member purchase a solar home system to improve their families’ quality life.

location.town: COL. FIDEL HERRERA BELTRAN, TUXPAN, Veracruz

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia Bertha pertenece SIEMPRE UNIDOS, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Bertha tiene 43 años de edad y tiene 01 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de elaboración de tortas, la socia elabora para los distintos compromisos que solicitan sus servicios como matrimonio, cumpleaños entre otros, la socia a la vez es profesoras cesante, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como harina, mantequilla, leche entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of SIEMPRE UNIDOS; the bank is located in the province and department of Cusco.

Bertha is 43 years old and has one child; she alternates her daily activities with her cake making business, preparing cakes for different special engagements, like weddings and birthdays etc.; at the same time she is an unemployed teacher.  She would like to continue working in the cake business in order to support her family.

Bertha is requesting the loan in order to purchase supplies such as, flour, butter, milk and other like products. She is very grateful for the loan and is committed to fulfilling her established dues.

loans.use: To purchase supplies such as, flour, butter, milk and other like products.

loans.name: Jose Norvil

texts.es:
José Norvil tiene 39 años de edad, vive con sus hijos y su madre, en casa propia, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayalti y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica al servicio de transporte público en su mototaxi por zonas aledañas a su distrito, cuenta con 2 mototaxis desde hace 5 años, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de aceite, limpieza de cadena y mantenimiento de su vehículo y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José Norvil is 39 years old and lives with his children and his mother in his own house in a large community in the urban area of Cayalti. He enjoys good personal and work references from his neighbors whose population makes a living in agriculture, trade and livestock, and is located in the Province of Chiclayo which is part of the Lambayeque Region on the north coast of Peru.

He makes a living providing public transport service in his moto-taxi throughout the areas surrounding his district, and has owned two moto-taxis for the last five years. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternative of 3000 nuevos soles to buy oil and to clean the chains and maintain his vehicle, and in this way generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy oil and to clean the chains and maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Darwin

texts.es:
Darwin tiene 33 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, cubriendo las rutas el Ingenio, Pilca, Maravilla, Herrada, Morropon y viceversa, es conocido en la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos para su mototaxi y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Darwin is 33 years old.  He lives in the district of Buenos Aires, a community with a hot climate and a population that engages in farming, trade and livestock.  It is located in Morropon Province, which is part of the Piura region on the northern coast of Perú. 

Darwin  provides transportation services to passengers in his motorcycle taxi and covers the routes of Ingenio, Pilca, Maravilla, Herrada and Morropon and back. He is known in the area.  He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternative of S/.1,000 in order to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle taxi so that he can earn more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 53 años de edad, vive en casa propia, junto a su esposo e hijos de 4 y 21 años de edad en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica al alquiler de espacios para venta de comida, su esposo brinda servicio técnico para reparación de artefactos, son una familia unida, Mercedes ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de equipos que le permitirán brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Mercedes, age 53, lives in her own house with her husband and children, ages 4 and 21.  They live in the Cayaltí district in a community that is devoted to agriculture, commerce, and livestock.  It is in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She rents out spaces for selling food.  Her husband provides services as a technician for repairing appliances.  They are a united family.

Mercedes has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 4,000 soles in order to buy equipment that will allow her to provide better service.

loans.use: to buy equipment that will allow her to provide better service.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana tiene 46 años de edad,  es ama de casa y es soltera, estudió hasta tercer grado porque donde vivia no existian otros niveles de estudio mas que tercer grado.

Ella vive con sus padres y sus hermanos, no tiene hijos por lo tanto a dedicado su vida a cuidar de sus viejitos quienes ya estan de avanzada edad.

Juana por las tardes vende platillos tipicos como nuegado, yuca, chicharras, bebidas frias, etc, antes se dedicaba a la venta de ropa de cama y salia a vender casa por casa; pero a raiz de que su madre enfermara tubo que dar un poco mas de deicación y cuido de su madre y entonces decidio poner su pequeño negocio de venta de platillos tipicos por lsa tardes.

El préstamo lo necesita para para comprar productos como harina, yuca, bebidas, etc. al tener surtido su negocio le dara opciones de comprar a sus clientes obteniendo ella ciertas ganacias.

El sueño de Juana es seguir trabajando y que Dios le de fuerzas y salud para seguir velando por el bienestar de sus padres.
texts.en:
Juana, age 46, is a single housewife.  She went to school through the third grade.  Where she lived they did not have any higher grades than the third grade.  She lives with her parents and her siblings.  She does not have children.  Therefore, she has devoted her life to caring for her parents, who are now elderly.

In the afternoons she sells typical dishes like ‘nuegados’ [fried yucca dumplings], yucca, pork rinds, and cold drinks, etc.  She used to sell bedding, and she sold door to door.  However, her mother got sick, and she had to be a little more devoted to her mother’s care.  So, she decided to set up her small business of selling typical dishes in the afternoons.

She needs the loan to buy products like flour, yucca, and drinks, etc.  Having her business stocked will give her customers buying options, and she will get a sure income.

Juana’s dream is to continue working and for God to give her the strength and good health to continue watching out for her parents’ well-being.

loans.use: to buy flour, yucca, sweets, and drinks, etc. to stock her business.

loans.name: Ron's Group

texts.en: Ron’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Ron makes a living cultivating rice with her family and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en: Sokha’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Cham province in Cambodia. Sokha makes a living cultivating rice with her family and she also does extra work as a farm laborer and tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ronald Cesar

texts.es:
Ronald es el mayor de tres hermanos, vive en Chaclacayo en las afueras de Lima y todos los días tiene que viajar durante 3 horas para ir de su casa a su centro de estudios. 
El es una persona muy comprometida con sus estudios y labora con su hermano menor a medio tiempo en un pequeño taller que tienen de manera informal en su casa, lo cual les permite generar ingresos para poder vivir.
Sus padres viajaron hace años a Italia en busca de trabajo y un mejor porvenir y con ello estuvieron ayudando a sus hijos enviándoles dinero al Perú, sin embargo la crisis económica en europa dejo sin trabajo a su padre, con lo que solo su madre labora actualmente y solo les alcanza para subsistir allá sin poder enviar dinero, lo que ocacionaria que Ronald tenga que dejar de estudiar y dedicarse a tiempo completo a trabajar de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
Ronald esta en su ultimo semestre de estudios y esta a puertas de culminar su sueño de ser profesional. El es un ejemplo para sus hermanos menores, en esfuerzo, empeño y superación, y culminar su carrera seria de gran ayuda para su familia. 
Ronald desea renovar su pequeño negocio de taller de estructuras metálicas que tienen en casa, volverse formal para captar mas clientes y mejorar para generar mas ingresos con que poder ayudar a que su hermano y hermana puedan estudiar y ser profesionales como el.
El cree que no hay mejor apoyo que una buena educación, es por esto que esta muy agradecido con los prestatarios de Kiva con toda la ayuda que le brindan para culminar sus estudios y convertirse en una persona productiva para la sociedad.
texts.en:
Ronald is the oldest of three siblings. He lives in Chaclacayo, which is outside of Lima, so every day he must travel three hours from his house in order to get to school.

Ronald is very committed to his studies and also works part-time with his younger brother in a small informal workshop set up in their house. This allows him to generate income for living expenses.

His parents traveled to Italy several years ago in search of jobs and a better future. They were able to help their children by sending money back to Peru. However, due to the financial crisis in Europe, his father lost his job, so his mother’s income is the only way for his parents to support themselves. As a result, they are not able to send money home. Without the assistance from Kiva lenders, Ronald would have to quit his studies and commit himself to full-time work.

Ronald is in his last semester of studies, which represents the door to fulfilling his dream of becoming a professional. He is a role model of effort, determination, and achievement for his younger siblings. Finishing his degree will be a great help to his family.

Ronald wants to renovate the small metal shop that is set up in his home. By turning it into a formal business, he will able to attract more customers and improve the amount of income that he can generate. This will help his brother and sister with their studies so that they can become professionals, just like him.

Ronald believes that there is no better support than a good education. For this reason, he is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for all of the assistance they have offered so that he can finish his studies and become a productive individual in society.

loans.use: to pay for his technical studies in order to become a maintenance mechanic.

loans.name: Phon's Group

texts.en: Phon’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Phon makes a living cultivating rice with her family and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each member of the group to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

Hen makes a living cultivating rice with her family and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. loans.name: Maria Modesta

texts.en:
Maria lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. She is a farmer (potato and vegetables), age 33years who lives with her husband and two children, her husband is a farmer too, and they work together. It is clear that Maria works hard to maintain her family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity.   
The family currently illuminates their home with kerosene lamps because the electrical utility grid does not reach this rural area.  She mentioned that she hopes to improve education of children because they will be able to do their homework with better lighting, and assisting production activities in the home and to improve living conditions for her family, Maria is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras.

loans.use: To buy a solar energy system for her home

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Babacar fait de l’agriculture depuis des années. Il possède un champ et l’exploite tous les ans. Il cultive des céréales : mil, maïs, arachides et augmente la dose en cette période d’hivernage qui arrive déjà. Le crédit lui servira à acheter des semences et de l’engrais. 
Babacar est marié et père de trois enfants qui vont à l’école. Il veille à ce qu’ils aient de bonnes conditions alimentaires et une bonne éducation dans la vie. Babacar vit en grande famille avec ses frères et chacun participe pour la gestion des charges de la maison.
Babacar souhaite diversifier son activité en faisant de l’embouche bovine et ovine.
texts.en:
Mr. Babacar has been farming for years. He owns a field that he cultivates every year. He grows cereals: millet, corn, ground nuts… He grows more in the wintering season, which is already near. He will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

Babacar is married and a father of three children, who go to school. He is careful to offer them good nutrition and good education in life. Babacar lives as an extended family with his brothers, and all contribute to the household expenses.

Babacar wishes to diversify his business by fattening cows and sheep.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Juan Carlos se dedica al negocio de crianza de pollos, el socio también trabaja en una empresa publica, el socio los pollos los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados, el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es tener un local donde pueda vender los pollos. El socio solicita le crédito para comprar pollos y alimentos para los pollos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI” Communal Bank. The bank is located in the Echarate district, belonging to the province of La Convención and department of Cusco.

The member, Juan Carlos, has a business raising chickens. He also works at a public enterprise. He fattens the chickens and lets them grow and then sells them at different markets. He has had this business for several years and it is going very well.

The member’s dream is to have a place where he can sell his chickens. He is requesting a loan to purchase chickens and feed. He is happy about the loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and feed.

loans.name: Angel Oswaldo

texts.es:
Ángel tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil soltero vive con sus padres en la comunidad la Palmira perteneciente al cantón Chillanes Provincia Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla LA PALMIRA  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad  La Palmira a unos 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa formada por 14 socios que son de la misma comunidad,  que se dedican a la agricultura.
Ángel se dedica a la construcción y al negocio de venta de ganados. Solicita el crédito para la compra de ganado. La compra lo realiza en Chillanes. Su meta es comprarse un terreno y sembrar. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte, y la costumbre que le gusta es las fiestas del Divino Niño.
texts.en:
Ángel is 23 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the canton of Chillanes in Bolívar Province. He is a member of the Communal Bank “La Palmira”, which is located in the community of La Palmira and approximately 40 minutes away from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. The group consists of 14 members who are from the same community. They all engage in agriculture.

Ángel works in construction and also has a business of selling livestock. He is requesting a loan in order to buy livestock. His purchases are conducted in Chillanes. His goal is to buy a plot of land for planting.

In his free time, Ángel enjoys playing sports. The tradition he enjoys most is celebrating the festivals of “El Divino Niño” (the Divine Child).

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Fransiskus

texts.en:
Frans is making great progress in selling green technologies in his community. He is happy to be educating his customers on the health benefits and cost savings of the technologies.

Kopernik originally listed this loan with fixed monthly repayments however as actual sales are difficult to predict in advance, repayments were not being made at the fixed rate. This loan will be repaid as actual sales are made. He may even pay his loan off early! 

Frans hopes you can support him again.

loans.use: to buy clean technology goods to sell to his community

loans.name: Humberto De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Humberto es un hombre humilde y trabajador que conoce el significado del esfuerzo y la perseverancia para alcanzar los sueños y cumplir metas.
El se dedica a la venta de licores, tinto, aromática, gaseosas, comestibles, entre otros, en un café bar que montó como alternativa para obtener ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.
El pide un apoyo económico para la compra de un amplificador de sonido y de esta forma ofrecer un mejor servicio, haciendo que su negocio se mas ameno y llamativo para sus clientes. Este préstamo le dará la oportunidad de conseguir nuevos clientes y mejorar sus ventas.
Su mayor sueño es poder tener un negocio más grande y ofrecer algunos empleos en su negocio.
texts.en:
Humberto is a humble and hard-working man who knows the significance of effort and perseverance to reach one’s dreams and reach one’s goals.

He makes a living selling liquors, black coffee, sodas, and food, among others, in a bar café that he opened as an alternative to make an income to support his family.

He is asking for some economic support for the purchase of a sound amplifier and in this way offer a better service, making his business more enjoyable and noteworthy to his customers. This loan will give him the opportunity to obtain more customers and improve his sales.

His greatest dream is to be able to have a larger business and offer some jobs in his business.

loans.use: to purchase a sound amplifier.

loans.name: Sumarti

texts.en:
Sumarti is making great progress in selling green technologies in her community. She is saving the money for her daughter's education. 

Kopernik originally listed this loan with fixed monthly repayments however as actual sales are difficult to predict in advance, repayments were not being made at the fixed rate. This loan will be repaid as actual sales are made. She may even pay her loan off early! 

Sumarti hopes you can support her again.

loans.use: to buy more green technologies for her tech kiosk

loans.use: to purchase life-saving renewable energy technologies to sell to his community

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina works hard to support her family. Saturnina is married and has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 23,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy sacks of rice to sell through her business.

Saturnina has been in this business for ten years now. In the future, Saturnina would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell through her business.

loans.name: Yohanes

texts.en:
Yohannes is making great progress in selling green technologies in his community. He is excited to educate his customers in the health and cost benefits of the solar lights.

Kopernik originally listed this loan with fixed monthly repayments however as actual sales are difficult to predict in advance, repayments were not being made at the fixed rate. This loan will be repaid as actual sales are made. He may even pay his loan off early! 

Yohannes hopes you can support him again.

loans.use: to purchase renewable energy technologies to sell to his community

loans.name: Joval

texts.en:
Joval is 33 years of age, married, and has three children. His wife is taking care of their children while managing their sari-sari store business. 

Joval is a farmer. He grows rice in their field and, at the same time, he engages himself in a hog-raising business. Joval’s goal is to increase his income in both of his businesses. 

He is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy feed and vaccines for his hogs. He believes that, by feeding his hogs with enough feed, they will grow faster and sell at the right time. 

Joval will save his earnings from his hog-raising business for the education of his children. Joval will be the happiest person, if he will provide a better way of living for his family and finish his children's studies soon.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for his hogs.

loans.name: Santos

texts.en:
Santos lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. He is a farmer (potato), age 48 years who lives with his wife and three children, his wife is a farmer too, and his oldest son help in the agriculture, they work together. It is clear that Santos works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity.   
The family currently illuminates their home with kerosene lamps because the electrical utility grid does not reach this rural area.  He mentioned that hopes to improve education of children because they will be able to do their homework with better lighting, and assisting production activities in the home and to improve living conditions for his family, Santos is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras.

loans.use: To buy a solar energy system for his home

loans.name: Elmer Oswaldo

texts.en:
ELMER lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. He is a farmer (potato), age 22 years, He is single and lives with his sister who has two children, It is clear that Elmer works hard to help his sister to maintain her sons, and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity.   
He and his family currently illuminate their home with kerosene lamps because the electrical utility grid does not reach this rural area.  He mentioned that he hopes improve living conditions for his family and assisting production activities in the home, Elmer is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras

loans.use: To buy a solar energy system or his home

loans.name: Leonediza

texts.en:
Leonediza has a strong passion in doing a business. She has selling skills that help her in her sari-sari (variety) store. With a family to feed, Leonediza has gathered her courage to withstand the odds in doing a business. She reached out to PMPC for her capital needs and maintains a record of no default on all her obligations. With the requested 5,000 PHP loan, Leonediza would like to restock her store with biscuits, soft drinks and canned goods.

Leonediza deeply wishes to live comfortably with her family around.

loans.use: to restock her store with biscuits, soft drinks and canned goods

loans.name: Sophany's Group

texts.en:
Sophany, age 35, has seven children, and is living in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district. She is a teacher and, to gain more income, she also raises pigs. She has been working as a teacher for ten years. The current job earns her about KHR 37,000 per day.  

This is a micro-loan for Sophany with VisionFund Cambodia and she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Sophany wants to use her portion to buy pig feed and piglets to raise. She hopes to fatten her pigs, so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a 22-year-old entrepreneur from Gokwe South District, Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide, volunteering in schools in her community and teaching students life skills. 

Over the last year, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity, producing about 100 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. She started the business in 2012 because she wanted to be financially independent. 

Leah would very much like to increase her sales and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. She hopes to provide for herself and increase her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Lorena Liliana

texts.es:
Lorena Liliana tiene 29 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Morropon una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos plásticos y de loza en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de diversos artículos para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Lorena Liliana is 29 years old. She lives with her parents in the Morropon district, a farming, business, and ranching community. It is in the province by the same name, which is in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

She sells plastic products and ceramics in the rear part of her home. She has requested a loan from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 nuevos soles to purchase a variety of items to offer her customers. This way, she will generate better income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of items to offer her customers.

loans.name: Santa Catalina

texts.es:
Santa Catalina tiene 42 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico junto con su conyugue y sus tres menores hijos de edades 20, 14, 3 años de edad el cual el segundo cursa primaria en colegio nacional del Caserio de Lishinas, una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, la compra lo realiza en tiendas mayoristas de su distrito, desde hace tres años, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Santa Catalina is 42 years old. She lives in her own home, which is made of crude materials. She lives with her husband and their three children who are 20, 14, and three years old. The second one goes to primary school at the Colegio Nacional del Caserio de Lishinas. It is a rural zone in the district of Pucara, a community in a sweltering climate. The population works in farming, sales, and ranching. The zone is located in the province of Jaen, which is in the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.

Santa Catalina sells groceries in general. She buys them at wholesale stores in her district. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase a variety of products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of items to offer her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase refrigerators and supplies, and to make modifications to the store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise. She has a guest house and wants to stock it. She will buy candy wholesale (40 bags of candy), and she will purchase a refrigerator and three quintals (hundredweights) of corn.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a 50-year-old married man. He settled in Oroquieta City in the Philippines together with his family. Over twenty years, Edward was able to manage his farm that absolutely met the needs of his family. The farm is still doing well and is giving enough cash inflow. With his generated revenue, he was able to save for their future needs. Recently, he took a new loan to purchase fertilizer to improve his farm. His photo was taken in his house where his income goes. He plans to expand his farm in order to gain more income for the family needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
A mother of two children residing in Kampong Cham province, Oun is 39 years old. Two of her kids are in school. Rice farming and grocery business are her main sources of income to support her household. It is the business that she has engaged for 16 years and it has returned her with decent income. Her family earns more income from her husband who drives taxi for a fee. 

This is the fourth-cycle loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), while her co-borrower is a second-time borrower. She and her group member are asking for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR respectively. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to renovate her house. She strongly hopes that she will have decent shelter for her family.

loans.use: To renovate her house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en: Sokhom is 31 years old and a mother of two kids, one of whom is in school and one still under school age. To cover her family cost of living, she grows rice and beans and does paid-working job for extra income. She has been with this business for 11 years and it has earned her decent income. This is not her first cycle loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Sokhom has completely repaid the past loans; and it has enabled her to cover her daily cost of living, to set aside some money for further need and to keep her kid in school. Now, she leads a small group of two for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and gasoline, and to pay for labor fee for her farm. She strongly believes she will gain better crop yield and good income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline, and to pay for labor fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Vannak's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Vannak, 34, has four children in total. Three of them are in school. Vannak and her husband are farmers who have been farming rice and growing cassava for ten years to make a living.

Vannak has been with VisionFund for five cycles and completely paid back the loans, which have helped her improve livelihood from cycle to cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Rosemer

texts.en: Rosemer operates a motor transport business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. For her to continue her business, she requested a loan to pay for motor spare parts and repair. She dreams to own motor units and be able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to pay for motor spare parts/repair

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander tiene 24 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico junto con su conyugue y sus dos menores hijos de edades 8 y 1 año de edad el cual el primero cursa primaria en colegio nacional del Caserío San Antonio, una zona rural del distrito de Pomahuaca, de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El brinda servicios como chofer de camión, las principales rutas son Yambolon – Pucara y viceversa, cuenta con dos años de experiencia en el rubro, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos para su vehículo y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Alexander is 24 years old. He lives in his own house, which is made of rustic materials, with his spouse and his two dependent children, who are 8 and 1 years old. The first studies in the national elementary school of the small village of San Antonio, a rural area in the Pomahuaca district that has a varied climate and is located in the Jaen province, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern coast of Peru. The population there primarily works in agriculture, commerce, and livestock.

He makes a living as a truck driver. His main routes are Yambolon to Pucara and vice versa. He has two years of experience in this line of business. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 3000 nuevos soles to buy spare parts for his vehicle and, in this way, to earn a higher income for his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven emprendedor, tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y vive en el Distrito de La Tiguiña junto a su familia. 
Actualmente estudia Ingeniería de Sistemas en la Universidad de la zona donde vive
Desde hace casi 1 año tiene una panadería y ofrece diversos productos a los clientes, le va muy bien porque es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable, y sobre todo porque brinda productos de calidad y tiene muchos clientes.
Carlos está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar mercadería para poder suministrar el negocio y brindar otros productos no solo pan, así obtendrá mayores ingresos con el que más adelante podrá cumplir su sueño: "Tener varias sucursales de panadería".
texts.en:
Carlos, 25, is a young entrepreneur.  He's single and lives with his family in the La Tinguiña district.  Currently he's studying systems engineering at the university in his area.

For almost a year he has had a bakery where he sells a variety of products to his customers.  It's going very well for him because he's a very hardworking and responsible person who, above all, offers quality products and has a lot of customers.

Carlos is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their help he'll be able to buy goods to supply his business and offer other products besides bread.  That way he'll earn more income and in the future achieve his dream of having several locations of his bakery.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Damian

texts.es:
Damián tiene 43 años de edad, vive en casa de familiares, junto a su mamá e hijos de 4 y 21 años de edad en el distrito de Zaña, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de carnes en puesto de mercado y de animales vivos, su negocio se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Damián is 43 years old, and he lives in his family’s house together with his mother and his children, ages 4 and 21, in the district of Zaña.  The people here work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock-raising. It is located within the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque Region on Peru’s northern coast.

He sells meat in a stall in the market, and he also sells live animals. His business is located in his home. He has requested a loan of 2,000 Nuevos Soles with Edpyme Alternativa to purchase various animals, and in this way generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of animals to offer to his customers.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en: Roberto personally sells his catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities. Since he became a member of Paglaum MPC, he has been a member in good standing. He wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC to purchase new fishing nets. As much as possible, he wants to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch. In the future, he dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing nets

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is 49 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Teresa is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Teresa has been raising pig for 26 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 36 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar debido  a la pobreza que vivía y porque sus padres solo se preocupaban por el trabajo, tiene 4 hijos, 2 de ellos estudian y 2 ya son mayores, su esposo es agricultor y además tiene vacas de las cuales saca aproximadamente 45 botellas de leche diario, posee el ganado desde hace años y se va con su esposo a pie  hasta el lugar de trabajo 
Sonia necesita el crédito para la reparación de su vehículo, ya es muy importante para el servicio familiar y emergencias inesperadas. 

Ella expresa que le hubiese gustado que sus hijos mayores lograran una profesión pero decidieron dedicarse a la ganadería y ella respeta sus decisiones, pero espera que sus hijos menores logren ser profesionales ya que ella no tuvo esa oportunidad y está dispuesta a ayudarlos.
texts.en:
Sonia is 36 years old and did not have the opportunity to go to school due to the poverty she suffered and because her parents were only able to worry about work. She has 4 children -- 2 of them are in school and 2 are already adults. Her husband works in agriculture and also has cows from which he gets approximately 45 bottles of milk per day. They have owned the cattle for years and walk together to their workplace. 

Sonia needs the loan to repair her vehicle, as it is very important for the family and for unexpected emergencies.

She says that she would have liked her older children to have a profession, but they decided to work with cattle. She respects their decision, but hopes that her younger children will become professionals, as she did not have that opportunity and is willing to help them.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feeds

loans.name: Juaquena

texts.en:
Juaquena works hard to support her family. Juaquena is married and has a business selling corn in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional corn to sell.

Juaquena has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Juaquena would like to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to purchase additional corn to sell

loans.name: Demba

texts.fr:
Demba, âgé de 37 ans, s’active dans l’agriculture depuis plus de 8 ans déjà. Il a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit et ce renouvellement lui permettra de préparer l’hivernage qui pointe du bout du nez. Il va acheter des semences et de l’engrais. Demba partage son champ avec son frère qui cultive une moitié et lui, l’autre ; l’avantage c’est que si l’un n’est pas présent, l’autre peut surveiller tout le territoire. 
Demba est marié et père de famille qui se doit de nourrir sa famille et de les mettre dans de bonnes conditions de vie et cela, il peut le faire grâce à son activité. 
Demba veut faire de l’embouche et améliorer ses revenus pour améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille.
texts.en:
Demba, 37 years old, has been working as a farmer for over eight years. He already had a loan before, and this new loan will allow him to prepare for the approaching rainy season. He will be seeds and fertilizers. Demba shares his field with his brother, with each of them working one half of the land. The advantage is that, whenever one of the brothers is absent, the other can keep an eye on the entire field.

Demba is married and has children to support and provide a good quality of life to them. He is able to do so thanks to his work.
Demba would like to [also] raise livestock and increase his revenues so as to improve the nutrition of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for farming.

loans.name: Rokhy

texts.fr:
Elle a 34 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle s’appelle Rokhy et elle s’active dans le commerce. Elle a une expérience de cinq ans dans ce domaine. C’est sa deuxième expérience de crédit et elle envisage d’acheter pour revendre des céréales : mil, maïs, arachide ; des légumes et des denrées alimentaires, elle a ouvert une cantine chez elle. 
Rokhy, donne une participation régulière pour l’organisation de la maison et la scolarisation de ses deux enfants.
Elle a comme ambition, d’élargir sa boutique et d’augmenter la quantité de la marchandise pour attirer beaucoup plus de clients.
texts.en:
Rokhy is 34 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  She is actively involved in retail and has a five-year experience in this field.  It is the second time that she is taking a loan.  With this new loan, she is planning to buy some grains (millet, maize, groundnut) as well as vegetables and other food products for resale.  She has opened a small food stall in her house.

Rokhy regularly contributes to her household's expenses and she pays part of her children's school fees.  Her goal is to expand her shop and to increase her stock of merchandise in order to attract many more customers.

loans.use: to buy grains such as millet, maize, groundnut, and other food products for resale.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 20-year-old single mother of one, living Gokwe South District in Zimbabwe. She has been operating a business selling groundnuts, round nuts, cow peas and beans for over 18 months now. Fatima also volunteers as a Learner Guide, teaching life skills at the local secondary school.

Fatima plans to use the Kiva loan to make more bulk purchases of groundnuts, beans and cow peas. She also intends to start adding value to her products by roasting the groundnuts to expand her clientele. Her hope is to be financially stable and provide for her son.

loans.use: To make more bulk purchases of groundnuts, beans, and cow peas.

loans.name: Yawel Junior Group

texts.fr:
Yawel Junior, est le nom donné à ce groupe de crédit qui regroupe cinq femmes qui habitent le même village. La responsable, la dame Mame Yacine qui se trouve au milieu de la photo, s’active dans le commerce de céréales locales telles du mil, du maïs, de l’arachide cela fait maintenant plus de 5 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle appuie son époux dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne grâce aux revenus de son activité.
Mame Yacine souhaite ouvrir un jour un magasin pour stockage de céréales locales et pouvoir alimenter tout le village.
texts.en:
The name of this borrowers' group is Yawel Junior. It is composed of five women living in the same village. The group's leader, Mrs. Mame Yacine, who is in the middle of the photo, works as a vendor selling local cereals, such as millet, corn and peanuts. She has been in this business for over five years. She is married and has children. She helps her husband provide for everyday household needs thanks to the revenue from her business.
Some day Mame Yacine would like to open a storage facility to keep local cereals and be able to serve the needs of her entire village.

loans.use: to buy millet, corn and peanuts for resale.

loans.name: Book Jom Keur Diaga Soune Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de crédit, nommé « Book Jom Keur Diaga Soune », est en fait un groupe mixte qui regroupe deux personnes, un homme et une femme. Balla est le responsable ; il fait de l’agriculture. Avec le crédit sollicité, il envisage d’acheter des semences et de l’engrais, vu que c’est la saison des pluies qui s’approche. Balla à une autre activité parallèle, ce qui lui permet de s’occuper de sa famille et de leurs besoins au quotidien.
Il pense aussi à acheter un véhicule pour faire du transport, voulant diversifier ses revenus.
texts.en: This credit group, named « Book Jom Keur Diaga Soune », consists of two members, a man and a woman.  Balla is the group's representative and he is involved in farming.  He plans to use his loan to buy some seeds and fertilizers because the rainy season is fast approaching.  In addition to farming, Balla  is involved in another type of activity, which allows him to take care of his family and of their day-to-day needs.  He is also thinking of buying a vehicle, to provide transportation services and to diversify his source of income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for farming.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth is a businesswoman from Sindangan. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. She is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic goods and consumable items. She continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic goods and consumable items

loans.name: Darou Mbiteyene 3 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit « Darou Mbiteyene 3, regroupe des femmes qui évoluent dans l’agriculture depuis des années. Elles logent dans le même village et font la même activité.
Alimatou la plus âgée est la responsable et avec son financement, elle va acheter des semences et du fumier et de l’engrais pour cultiver son champ. Avec son époux, ils vont ensembles travailler en duo dans les champs. Les fruits récoltés serviront à l’organisation des dépenses du foyer.
Alimatou pense faire de l’embouche bovine et ovine pour améliorer et augmenter les sources de revenus afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille.
texts.en:
The Darou Mbiteyene 3 group is composed of women who have been working as farmers for years. They live in the same village and do the same type of work.

Alimatou, the oldest, is the group's leader. With her loan, she will buy seeds, manure and fertilizers in order to work her field. She works the land together with her husband. Their harvest helps them manage household expenses.
Alimatou is thinking to start raising cattle and sheep in order to increase her revenues and thus improve her family's nutrition.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for farming.

loans.name: Karina Zelmira

texts.es:
Karina Zelmira tiene 43 años de edad, vive en casa de familiares junto a su mamá y cuatro hijos de 4 y 21 años de edad, en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y ropa al contado y al crédito, tiene clientes de las zonas aledañas, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Karina Zelmira, 43, lives in a relative's house with her mother and her four children, ages 4 to 21.  She lives in the district of Cayaltí, a community devoted to agriculture, commerce, and ranching located in Chiclayo Province in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She makes a living selling beauty products and clothing.  She sells in cash and on credit, and has customers in nearby areas.

Karina Zelmira has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 2,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy a variety of products to sell to her customers so she can generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana de 44 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado de educación básica, por motivos de escasos recursos económicos ella no pudo continuar sus estudios, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 4 hijos que están estudiando y son los únicos que dependen de ella. 
 

Juana se dedica al trabajo de los oficios domésticos, ya cuenta con 18 años de realizar esta actividad, ya que desde que terminó sus estudios salía a trabajar con su papá en la agricultura, y ella actualmente siembra su propia milpa junto con su esposo, además Juana se dedica al cuido de animales domésticos y lo lleva acabo en su casa, en cuanto al trabajo agrícola tiene que trasladarse a pie en un tiempo de 25  minutos.

Ella necesita este préstamo para comprar fertilizantes para su milpa, comprará 5 sacos de fertilizantes, 2 bolsas de semilla y pagará la mano de obra, de esta manera será distribuido el dinero ya que ella con esto quiere darle un buen manejo a su parcela de maíz.

Su sueño a futuro es tener buen rendimiento de su cosecha y así obtener mejor producción que le permita generar alimentos para su familia y si es posible comercializar estos granos básicos.
texts.en:
44-year-old Juana studied up to the sixth grade. She could not continue with her studies due to scant economic resources. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. She has four children who are studying and who are the only ones who are dependent on her.

Juana is a domestic worker. She has been doing this for 18 years. Since she finished her studies she went out to work with her father in agriculture, and she is now planting her own maize field with her husband. Juana also looks after domestic animals, which she does in her house. As for the agricultural work, she has to walk for 25 minutes to get to the maize field.

She needs this loan in order to purchase fertilisers for her maize field. She will buy five sacks of fertiliser and two bags of seed, and she will pay labourers. The money will be distributed in this way because she wants to manage her parcel of maize well.

Her dream for the future is to have a good yield from her harvest and thereby obtain better output, which will enable her to provide food for her family and, if possible, sell these staple grains.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers for her maize field. She will buy five sacks of fertiliser and two bags of seed, and she will pay labourers
